Sentences_from: Plastrem miodu opływają wargi twoje, oblubienico moja! miód i mleko pod językiem twoim, a wonność szat twoich, jako wonność Libanu.
Sentences_to: Your lips, my bride, drip like the honeycomb. Honey and milk are under your tongue. The smell of your garments is like the smell of Lebanon.
Translated_sentences: Your lips are like honeycomb, my bride! honey and milk under your tongue, and the fragrance of your garments, as the fragrance of Lebanon.

Sentences_from: I stałem się jako człowiek, który nic nie słyszy, i niema odporu w ustach swoich.
Sentences_to: For in you, Yahweh, do I hope. You will answer, Lord my God.
Translated_sentences: And I became like a man who hears nothing, and has no resistance in his mouth.

Sentences_from: O nieprzyjacielu! azaż wykonane są spustoszenia twoie na wieczność? Poburzyłżeś miasta? i owszem ich samych pamiątka zginęła z niemi.
Sentences_to: But Yahweh reigns forever. He has prepared his throne for judgment.
Translated_sentences: O enemy! are your desolations made for ever? Have you outraged the towns? and indeed, their own memory died with them.

Sentences_from: A odpowiadając Dawid rzekł: Oto włócznia królewska; niech sam przyjdzie kto z sług, a weźmie ją.
Sentences_to: God do so to the enemies of David, and more also, if I leave of all that belongs to him by the morning light so much as one who urinates on a wall. "
Translated_sentences: And David answered and said, Behold the king's spear: let one of the servants come and take it.

Sentences_from: Potem ty, synu człowieczy! weźmij sobie nóż ostry, to jest brzytwę barwierską, weźmij ją sobie, a ogól nią głowę swoję i brodę swoję; potem weźmij sobie wagę, i rozdziel je.
Sentences_to: You, son of man, take a sharp sword; You shall take it as a barber's razor to you, and shall cause it to pass on your head and on your beard: then take balances to weigh, and divide the hair.
Translated_sentences: Then you, son of man! take for yourself a sharp knife, that is, a barber's razor, take it for yourself, and cover your head and your beard with it; then take for yourself the scales, and divide them.

Sentences_from: Zachodnią zaś granicę będziecie mieli morze wielkie; to wam będzie granicą od zachodu.
Sentences_to: They traveled from Succoth, and encamped in Etham, which is in the edge of the wilderness.
Translated_sentences: And your western border shall be the great sea; it shall be your border on the west.

Sentences_from: Wystaw sobie pamiątki; nakładź sobie gromad kamieni; pamiętaj na ten gościniec, i na drogę, którąś chodziła: nawróć się, panno Izraelska! nawróć się do tych miast swoich.
Sentences_to: Set up road signs, make guideposts; set your heart toward the highway, even the way by which you went: turn again, virgin of Israel, turn again to these your cities.
Translated_sentences: Set up for yourselves a memorial; set up for yourselves a heap of stones; remember the tabernacle, and the way that she walked: turn again, O Virgin of Israel. return to your cities.

Sentences_from: Widząc tedy synowie Ammonowi, że się zbrzydzili Dawidowi posłali ciż synowie Ammonowi, i najęli za pieniądze Syryjczyka z domu Rechob, i Syryjczyka w Soba, dwadzieścia tysięcy pieszych, a od króla Maacha tysiąc mężów, a od Istoba dwanaście tysięcy mężów.
Sentences_to: When the children of Ammon saw that they were become odious to David, the children of Ammon sent and hired the Syrians of Beth Rehob, and the Syrians of Zobah, twenty thousand footmen, and the king of Maacah with one thousand men, and the men of Tob twelve thousand men.
Translated_sentences: And when the children of Ammon saw that they were abhorred of David, the children of Ammon sent also, and hired for money a Syrian of the house of Rehob, and a Syrian for themselves, twenty thousand footmen, and of King Maacah a thousand men, and of Isthob twelve thousand men.

Sentences_from: A wychodzili i przywodzili z Egiptu cug woźników za sześć set srebrników, a konia za sto i za pięćdziesiąt. A tak wszyscy królowie Hetejscy, i królowie Syryjscy z rąk ich koni dostawali.
Sentences_to: They brought up and brought out of Egypt a chariot for six hundred pieces of silver, and a horse for one hundred fifty: and so for all the kings of the Hittites, and the kings of Syria, they brought them out by their means.
Translated_sentences: And they went out, and brought out of Egypt a cart of charioteers for six hundred pieces of silver, and a horse for an hundred and fifty. And all the kings of the Hittites, and the kings of Syria, were delivered by their horses.

Sentences_from: Utwierdzona jest stolica twoja przed wszystkiemi czasy; tyś jest od wieczności.
Sentences_to: Your throne is established from long ago. You are from everlasting.
Translated_sentences: Thy throne is established before all times: thou art from everlasting.

Sentences_from: Nadto rzekli do niego: Cóż z tobą uczynimy, aby się morze uspokoiło? Bo się morze im dalej tem bardziej burzyło.
Sentences_to: Then they said to him, "What shall we do to you, that the sea may be calm to us?" For the sea grew more and more stormy.
Translated_sentences: And they said unto him, what shall we do unto thee, that the sea may be still? Because the sea got more and more stormy.

Sentences_from: Wspomnij, Panie! na zelżywość sług twoich, a jakom ponosił wzgardę w zanadrzu swem od wszystkich narodów możnych.
Sentences_to: With which your enemies have mocked, Yahweh, with which they have mocked the footsteps of your anointed one.
Translated_sentences: Mention, Lord! for the livelihood of thy servants, and to whom he hath borne the reproach of all the mighty nations.

Sentences_from: Synów Adynowych sześć set pięćdziesiąt i pięć;
Sentences_to: The children of Adin, six hundred fifty-five.
Translated_sentences: The children of Adin, six hundred fifty and five;

Sentences_from: I wysłał je Mojżesz po tysiącu z każdego pokolenia na wojnę; posłał też z nimi Fineesa, syna Eleazara kapłana, na wojnę, a naczynia święte, i trąby do trąbienia były w ręku jego.
Sentences_to: "If she has a husband, while her vows are on her, or the rash utterance of her lips, with which she has bound her soul,
Translated_sentences: And Moses sent them a thousand out of every tribe to war; and he sent with them Phinehas the son of Eleazar the priest to war: and the holy vessels and the trumpets were in his hand.

Sentences_from: Powiedz synom Izraelskim, a rzecz do nich: Gdy wnijdziecie do ziemi, do której Ja was wprowadzę:
Sentences_to: "Speak to the children of Israel, and tell them, 'When you come into the land where I bring you,
Translated_sentences: Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, when ye come into the land whither I will bring you:

Sentences_from: Pan Jeruzalem buduje, a rozproszonego Izraela zgromadza.
Sentences_to: Yahweh builds up Jerusalem. He gathers together the outcasts of Israel.
Translated_sentences: The Lord builds Jerusalem, and gathers scattered Israel.

Sentences_from: A gdy zstąpili z góry do miasta, rozmawiał z Saulem na dachu.
Sentences_to: When they had come down from the high place into the city, he talked with Saul on the housetop.
Translated_sentences: And when they came down from the mountain into the city, he talked with Saul on the roof.

Sentences_from: I powiedział mu lud oneż słowa, mówiąc: To dadzą mężowi, który go zabije.
Sentences_to: The people answered him in this way, saying, "So shall it be done to the man who kills him."
Translated_sentences: And the people spake unto him words, saying, these things shall they give unto the man that killeth him.

Sentences_from: Zatem podniósł Mojżesz rękę swoję, i uderzył w skałę laską swą dwa kroć, a wyszły wody obfite i piło ono mnóstwo, i bydło ich.
Sentences_to: Moses lifted up his hand, and struck the rock with his rod twice: and water came forth abundantly, and the congregation drank, and their livestock.
Translated_sentences: And Moses lifted up his hand, and smote the rock with his staff two times: and there came forth abundant waters, and they drank abundantly, and their cattle.

Sentences_from: Na to jeszcze mówiąc do niego Abraham rzekł: A jeźliby się ich tam znalazło czterdzieści? i odpowiedział: Nie uczynię nic dla tych czterdziestu.
Sentences_to: He spoke to him yet again, and said, "What if there are forty found there?" He said, "I will not do it for the forty's sake."
Translated_sentences: And Abraham spake unto him again, and said, were there forty of them found there? and he said, I will do nothing for these forty.

Sentences_from: Wszystkich do haóby przywiedzie przez lud, który im nie będzie ku dogodzie, ani ku pomocy, ani ku pożytkowi, ale tylko ku zelżywości i ku haóbie.
Sentences_to: They shall all be ashamed because of a people that can't profit them, that are not a help nor profit, but a shame, and also a reproach."
Translated_sentences: He will bring all to haobah through the people, who will not be for their comfort, nor for their help, nor for their profit, but only for food and for haobah.

Sentences_from: Jeźliże tak, jako inni ludzie umierają, pomrą ci, a zwykłem innych ludzi karaniem, karani będą, nie posłał mię Pan;
Sentences_to: If these men die the common death of all men, or if they be visited after the visitation of all men; then Yahweh hasn't sent me.
Translated_sentences: If so, as other people die, you will die, and I used to punish other people, they will be punished, the Lord did not send me;

Sentences_from: Wziąłlibym skrzydła rannej zorzy, abym mieszkał na koócu morza,
Sentences_to: If I take the wings of the dawn, and settle in the uttermost parts of the sea;
Translated_sentences: I would take the wings of the morning dawn to dwell at the end of the sea,

Sentences_from: A gdy Samuel wejrzał na Saula, rzekł mu Pan. Otóż mąż, o którymemci powiedział; tenci będzie panował nad ludem moim.
Sentences_to: When Samuel saw Saul, Yahweh said to him, "Behold, the man of whom I spoke to you! this same shall have authority over my people."
Translated_sentences: And Samuel looked upon Saul, and the Lord said unto him, Now the man of whom I have spoken, he shall rule over my people.

Sentences_from: Oczy moje ustawicznie patrzą na Pana; albowiem on wywodzi z sieci nogi moje.
Sentences_to: My eyes are ever on Yahweh, for he will pluck my feet out of the net.
Translated_sentences: My eyes are always on the Lord; for he brings forth my feet out of the net.

Sentences_from: Widzi wiele rzeczy, a wszakże nie zrozumiewa; otworzone ma uszy, wszakże nie słyszy.
Sentences_to: You see many things, but don't observe. His ears are open, but he doesn't listen.
Translated_sentences: He sees many things, but does not understand; his ears are open, but he does not hear.

Sentences_from: A rzecz im: Tak mówi Pan zastępów, Bóg Izraelski: Oto Ja poślę i przywiodę Nabuchodonozora, króla Babilońskiego, sługę mego i postawię stolicę jego na tych kamieniach, którem skrył: i rozbije majestat swój na nich.
Sentences_to: and tell them, Thus says Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel: Behold, I will send and take Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon, my servant, and will set his throne on these stones that I have hidden; and he shall spread his royal pavilion over them.
Translated_sentences: And say unto them, Thus saith the Lord of hosts, the god of Israel: behold, I will send and bring Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, my servant, and will set his throne upon these stones which he hath hid; and he shall break His Majesty upon them.

Sentences_from: A zabiwszy go Mojżesz wziął ze krwi jego, i pomazał nią koniec prawego ucha Aaronowego, i wielki palec prawej ręki jego, także palec wielki prawej nogi jego.
Sentences_to: "Speak to the children of Israel, saying, 'You shall eat no fat, of bull, or sheep, or goat.
Translated_sentences: And when Moses had slain him, he took of his blood, and anointed with it the end of Aaron's right ear, and the great finger of his right hand, and the great toe of his right foot.

Sentences_from: A gdy było południe, naśmiewał się z nich Elijasz, mówiąc: Wołajcie większym głosem, ponieważ jest bóg; tylko że się albo zamyślił, albo jest zabawny, albo też jest w drodze; albo też śpi, aza ocuci.
Sentences_to: It happened at noon, that Elijah mocked them, and said, "Cry aloud; for he is a god. Either he is musing, or he has gone aside, or he is on a journey, or perhaps he sleeps and must be awakened."
Translated_sentences: And when it was noon, Elijah mocked them, saying, cry out with a louder voice, for there is a god; but he is either meditating, or amusing, or on his way, or asleep, and he shall awaken.

Sentences_from: Była też jeszcze inna wojna w Gob z Filistynami, kędy zabił Elhana, syna Jaara Oregim, Betlehemczyk, brata Golijatowego z Giet, którego drzewce u włóczni było jako nawój tkacki.
Sentences_to: There was again war with the Philistines at Gob; and Elhanan the son of Jaareoregim the Bethlehemite killed Goliath the Gittite's brother, the staff of whose spear was like a weaver's beam.
Translated_sentences: And there was another war in gob with the philistines, when he slew Elhan the son of Jaar the oregite, a Bethlehemite, the brother of Goliath of Gath, whose tree was a weaver's thread by the spear.

Sentences_from: A tak obchodził Salomon na on czas święto zacne, i wszystek Izrael z nim, zgromadzenie wielkie od wejścia do Emat aż do rzeki Egipskiej, przed Panem, Bogiem naszym, przez siedm dni i przez siedm dni, to jest, przez czternaście dni.
Sentences_to: So Solomon held the feast at that time, and all Israel with him, a great assembly, from the entrance of Hamath to the brook of Egypt, before Yahweh our God, seven days and seven days, even fourteen days.
Translated_sentences: And Solomon kept at that time a solemn feast, and all Israel with him, a great congregation, from the entering in of Hamath even unto the river of Egypt, before the Lord our God, seven days, and seven days, that is, fourteen days.

Sentences_from: Tedy rzekł do nich Izrael, ojciec ich: Jeźliże tak być musi, uczyńcież to; nabierzcie najlepszych pożytków ziemi w naczynia wasze, a zanieście mężowi onemu w upominku: trochę balsamu, i trochę miodu, i rzeczy wonnych, i myrry, orzechów terebintowych, i migdałów.
Sentences_to: Their father, Israel, said to them, "If it must be so, then do this. Take from the choice fruits of the land in your bags, and carry down a present for the man, a little balm, a little honey, spices and myrrh, nuts, and almonds;
Translated_sentences: And Israel their father said unto them, if it be so, do it: gather ye the best of the land into your vessels, and bring unto the man for a token, a little balsam, and a little honey, and spices, and myrrh, and terebinth nuts, and almonds.

Sentences_from: Przetoż polegną młodzieńcy jego na ulicach jego, i wszyscy mężowie waleczni jego wygładzeni będą dnia onego, mówi Pan.
Sentences_to: Therefore her young men will fall in her streets, and all her men of war will be brought to silence in that day, says Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: Therefore shall his young men fall in his streets, and all his mighty men shall be cut off in that day, saith the Lord.

Sentences_from: Jeźli wnijdziemy do miasta, głód w mieście, i pomrzemy tam, a jeźli tu zostaniemy, przecię pomrzemy. Teraz tedy pójdźcie, a zbieżmy do obozu Syryjskiego; jeźli nas żywo zostawią, będziemy żywi; jeźli nas też zabiją, pomrzemy.
Sentences_to: If we say, 'We will enter into the city,' then the famine is in the city, and we shall die there. If we sit still here, we also die. Now therefore come, and let us surrender to the army of the Syrians. If they save us alive, we will live; and if they kill us, we will only die."
Translated_sentences: If we go into the city, there's a famine in the city, and we die there, and if we stay here, we'll die. Now therefore go, and let us go down to the camp of Syria; if they leave us alive, we shall live; if they kill us, we shall die.

Sentences_from: Potem rzekł Pan do Mojżesza: Wstąp na tę górę Abarym, a oglądaj ziemię, którąm dał synom Izraelskim.
Sentences_to: Yahweh said to Moses, "Go up into this mountain of Abarim, and see the land which I have given to the children of Israel.
Translated_sentences: And the Lord said unto Moses, go up to mount Abarim, and see the land which he hath given unto the children of Israel.

Sentences_from: I odpowiedział jej Joab, mówiąc: Niedaj, niedaj mi tego Boże, abym miał podwrócić i zburzyć je.
Sentences_to: Joab answered, "Far be it, far be it from me, that I should swallow up or destroy.
Translated_sentences: Joab answered her, " god forbid, god forbid, that I should turn them back and tear them down."

Sentences_from: Rzekł tedy Balaam do Balaka: Zostaó tu przy całopaleniu twojem, a ja zabieżę tam Panu.
Sentences_to: He said to Balak, "Stand here by your burnt offering, while I meet over there."
Translated_sentences: Balaam said to balak, " stay here by your burning, and I will go there to the Lord."

Sentences_from: Ci, którzy w nienawiści mają Pana, choć obłudnie, poddaćby się im musieli, i byłby czas ich aż na wieki.
Sentences_to: But he would have also fed them with the finest of the wheat. I will satisfy you with honey out of the rock."
Translated_sentences: Those who hate the Lord, however hypocritically, would have to submit to them, and their time would be forever.

Sentences_from: A Madyjaóczycy sprzedali Józefa do Egiptu Potyfarowi, dworzaninowi Faraonowemu, hetmanowi żołnierstwa.
Sentences_to: The Midianites sold him into Egypt to Potiphar, an officer of Pharaoh's, the captain of the guard.
Translated_sentences: And the Midianites sold Joseph into Egypt to Potiphar pharaoh's courtier, the captain of the army.

Sentences_from: I rzekł Jakób: Przysiążże mi dziś, i przysiągł mu. I sprzedał pierworodztwo swoje Jakóbowi.
Sentences_to: Jacob said, "Swear to me first." He swore to him. He sold his birthright to Jacob.
Translated_sentences: Jacob said, "swear to me today." he swore to him. And he sold his birthright to Jacob.

Sentences_from: A rzecz: Słuchajcie słowa Pańskiego, królowie Judzcy i obywatele Jeruzalemscy! Tak mówi pan zastępów, Bóg Izraelski: Oto Ja przywiodę złe na to miejsce, o którem ktokolwiek usłyszy, zabrzmi mu w uszach jego.
Sentences_to: and say, Hear the word of Yahweh, kings of Judah, and inhabitants of Jerusalem: thus says Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel, Behold, I will bring evil on this place, which whoever hears, his ears shall tingle.
Translated_sentences: And the thing is, Hear ye the word of the Lord, ye kings of Judah, and inhabitants of Jerusalem. Thus saith the Lord of hosts, the god of Israel: behold, I will bring evil into this place, which whosoever heareth shall sound in his ears.

Sentences_from: Tedy wziąwszy Achaz srebro i złoto, które się znalazło w domu Pańskim i w skarbach domu królewskiego, posłał dar królowi Assyryjskiemu.
Sentences_to: In the thirty-eighth year of Azariah king of Judah, Zechariah the son of Jeroboam reigned over Israel in Samaria six months.
Translated_sentences: And Ahaz took the silver and the gold that were found in the house of the Lord, and in the treasures of the king's house, and sent a present unto the king of Assyria.

Sentences_from: Książę Kienaz, książę Teman, książę Mabsar,
Sentences_to: chief Kenaz, chief Teman, chief Mibzar,
Translated_sentences: Prince Kienaz, Prince Teman, Prince Mabsar,

Sentences_from: Jako trzodę na ofiary, jako trzodę Jeruzalemską na święta jego uroczyste, tak spustoszone miasta będą napełnione trzodami ludzi; i dowiedzą się, żem Ja Pan.
Sentences_to: As the flock for sacrifice, as the flock of Jerusalem in her appointed feasts, so shall the waste cities be filled with flocks of men; and they shall know that I am Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: As the flock for sacrifices, as the flock of Jerusalem for her solemn feasts, so shall the desolate cities be filled with herds of men; and they shall know that I am the Lord.

Sentences_from: I usłuchał Benadad króla Azy; a posławszy hetmany z wojski, które miał przeciw miastom Izraelskim, zburzył Hijon i Dan i Abelbetmaachę, i wszystko Cynnerot, i wszystkę ziemię Neftalim.
Sentences_to: Ben Hadad listened to king Asa, and sent the captains of his armies against the cities of Israel, and struck Ijon, and Dan, and Abel Beth Maacah, and all Chinneroth, with all the land of Naphtali.
Translated_sentences: And benhadad hearkened unto the king of ASA; and he sent the captains of the host which he had against the cities of Israel, and destroyed hijon, and Dan, and abelbethmaachah, and all shinneroth, and all the land of Naphtali.

Sentences_from: Ale Manases zwiódł Judę i obywateli Jeruzalemskich, tak iż się gorzej sprawowali niż narody, które Pan wygładził przed obliczem synów Izraelskich.
Sentences_to: After this, Sennacherib king of Assyria sent his servants to Jerusalem, (now he was before Lachish, and all his power with him), to Hezekiah king of Judah, and to all Judah who were at Jerusalem, saying,
Translated_sentences: But Manasseh deceived Judah and the people of Jerusalem, so that they were worse than the nations which the Lord had destroyed before the children of Israel.

Sentences_from: Przetoż mi żywot omierzł; bo mi się nie podoba żadna rzecz, która się dzieje pod słońcem; albowiem wszystkie są marnością, i utrapieniem ducha.
Sentences_to: So I hated life, because the work that is worked under the sun was grievous to me; for all is vanity and a chasing after wind.
Translated_sentences: Therefore I have ceased to live; for I do not like any thing that is done under the sun: for they are all vanity, and a travail of the spirit.

Sentences_from: Tedy podniósłszy Aaron ręce swe do ludu błogosławił im, a zstąpił od ofiarowania ofiary za grzech, i ofiary całopalenia, i ofiary spokojnej.
Sentences_to: He presented the other ram, the ram of consecration: and Aaron and his sons laid their hands on the head of the ram.
Translated_sentences: And Aaron lifted up his hands unto the people, and blessed them, and went down to offer the sin offering, and the burnt offering, and the peace offering.

Sentences_from: Ale odpowiedziawszy Jozue, syn Nunów, sługa Mojżeszów, jeden z młodzieńców jego, rzekł: Panie mój Mojżeszu, zabroó im.
Sentences_to: Joshua the son of Nun, the servant of Moses, one of his chosen men, answered, "My lord Moses, forbid them!"
Translated_sentences: And Joshua the son of Nun, Moses ' servant, one of his young men, answered and said, My Lord Moses, forbid them.

Sentences_from: I urosną na pałacach ich ciernie, pokrzywy i oset na zamkach ich; i będzie przybytkiem smoków, a mieszkaniem strusiów.
Sentences_to: Thorns will come up in its palaces, nettles and thistles in its fortresses; and it will be a habitation of jackals, a court for ostriches.
Translated_sentences: And thorns shall grow in their palaces, and nettles, and asses in their castles: and it shall be a tabernacle for dragons, and an abode for ostriches.

Sentences_from: Kto tedy jest między wami ze wszystkiego ludu jego, z tym niech będzie Bóg jego, a ten niech idzie do Jeruzalemu, które jest w Judztwie, a niech buduje dom Pana, Boga Izraelskiego; onci jest Bóg, który jest w Jeruzalemie.
Sentences_to: Whoever there is among you of all his people, may his God be with him, and let him go up to Jerusalem, which is in Judah, and build the house of Yahweh, the God of Israel (he is God), which is in Jerusalem.
Translated_sentences: And whosoever is among you of all his people, let his God be with him; and let him go to Jerusalem, which is in Judah, and build the house of the Lord God of Israel: he is the god that is in Jerusalem.

Sentences_from: Gdyż rozniecę ogieó w Egipcie, Syn bolejąc boleć będzie, i No rozwalone będzie, a Nof na każdy dzień udręczone będzie.
Sentences_to: I will set a fire in Egypt: Sin shall be in great anguish, and No shall be broken up; and Memphis [shall have] adversaries in the daytime.
Translated_sentences: For I will kindle a fire in Egypt, and the son of sorrows shall be sorrowful, and Noh shall be broken down, and Noh shall be tormented every day.

Sentences_from: I przewiódł mię przez nie w około a w około, a oto było ich bardzo wiele na onem polu, a oto były bardzo suche.
Sentences_to: He caused me to pass by them all around: and behold, there were very many in the open valley; and behold, they were very dry.
Translated_sentences: And he led me through them round about, and round about; and, behold, there were very many of them in the field, and, behold, they were very dry.

Sentences_from: A synom Kaatowym, pozostałym z rodzaju tegoż pokolenia, dostało się w połowie pokolenia Manasesowego losem miast dziesięć.
Sentences_to: the son of Amzi, the son of Bani, the son of Shemer,
Translated_sentences: And unto the children of Kohath, which were left of the generation of this generation, in the midst of the generation of Manasseh were ten cities.

Sentences_from: Cić mówili do Faraona, króla Egipskiego, aby wyprowadzili syny Izraelskie z Egiptu; toć jest ten Mojżesz i Aaron.
Sentences_to: These are those who spoke to Pharaoh king of Egypt, to bring out the children of Israel from Egypt. These are that Moses and Aaron.
Translated_sentences: And they spake unto Pharaoh king of Egypt, to bring the children of Israel out of Egypt: this is Moses and Aaron.

Sentences_from: I rzekł: Błogosławiony Pan, Bóg Izraelski, który mówił usty swemi do Dawida, ojca mego, i wypełnił to skutecznie, mówiąc:
Sentences_to: He said, "Blessed be Yahweh, the God of Israel, who spoke with his mouth to David my father, and has with his hands fulfilled it, saying,
Translated_sentences: And he said, Blessed Be The Lord God of Israel, who spake with his mouth unto David my father, and fulfilled it effectually, saying,:

Sentences_from: Otoś ich wiele uczył, i ręceś mdłe potwierdzał.
Sentences_to: Behold, you have instructed many, you have strengthened the weak hands.
Translated_sentences: You taught them a lot, and you confirmed them with your hands.

Sentences_from: A tak teraz jeźliście prawdziwie a szczerze uczynili, obrawszy sobie królem Abimelecha; a jeźliście się dobrze obeszli z Jerobaalem i z domem jego, a jeźliście podług dobrodziejstw ręki jego uczynili z nim;
Sentences_to: "Now therefore, if you have dealt truly and righteously, in that you have made Abimelech king, and if you have dealt well with Jerubbaal and his house, and have done to him according to the deserving of his hands
Translated_sentences: And now ye have done truly and truly, when ye have made Abimelech king: and ye have dealt well with Jerobaal and with his house, and have dealt well with him according to the good works of his hand.;

Sentences_from: Przetoż jako płomieó ogniowy pożera parzdzieże, i jako płomieó plewy trawi: tak korzeń ich będzie jako zgnilizna, a kwiat ich jako proch ku górze pójdzie; albowiem odrzucili zakon Pana zastępów, a wyrokiem świętego Izraelskiego pogardzili.
Sentences_to: Therefore as the tongue of fire devours the stubble, and as the dry grass sinks down in the flame, so their root shall be as rottenness, and their blossom shall go up as dust; because they have rejected the law of Yahweh of Armies, and despised the word of the Holy One of Israel.
Translated_sentences: And as the flame of fire he devoureth the stubble, and as the flame he devoureth the chaff: so their root shall be as rot, and their flower as dust shall go up: for they have rejected the law of the Lord of hosts, and have despised the judgment of the holy one of Israel.

Sentences_from: Tedy rzekł Elijakim, syn Helkijaszowy, i Sobna, i Joach do Rabsacesa: Proszę mów do sług twoich po syryjsku, boć rozumiemy; a nie mów z nami po żydowsku, gdzie słyszy lud, który jest na murze.
Sentences_to: Therefore they spoke to the king of Assyria, saying, "The nations which you have carried away, and placed in the cities of Samaria, don't know the law of the god of the land. Therefore he has sent lions among them, and behold, they kill them, because they don't know the law of the god of the land."
Translated_sentences: And Eliakim the son of Hilkiah, and shebna, and Joah, said unto rabshazeh, speak unto thy servants in Syriac, for we understand; and speak not unto us in Hebrew, where the people that are upon the wall hear.

Sentences_from: I wyrzezał na deszczkach po krańcach jego, i po listwowaniach jego Cherubiny, lwy, i palmy, jedno podle drugiego, po każdem przydaniu w około.
Sentences_to: On the plates of its stays, and on its panels, he engraved cherubim, lions, and palm trees, according to the space of each, with wreaths all around.
Translated_sentences: And he carved cherubims, lions, and palm trees, one after the other, in the sides thereof, and in the borders thereof, after every work in the region.

Sentences_from: A czasu, któregośmy chodzili od Kades Barne, ażeśmy się przeprawili przez potok Zared, było trzydzieści i osiem lat, aż wyginął wszystek on naród mężów walecznych z obozu, jako im był przysiągł Pan.
Sentences_to: The days in which we came from Kadesh Barnea, until we had come over the brook Zered, were thirty-eight years; until all the generation of the men of war were consumed from the midst of the camp, as Yahweh swore to them.
Translated_sentences: And the time that we journeyed from Kadesh barneh, until we passed over the brook zared, was thirty and eight years, until all the nation of the men of war perished out of the camp, as the Lord had sworn unto them.

Sentences_from: Nie wywrócisz sądu przychodniowi, ani sierocie, ani weźmiesz w zastawie szaty wdowy;
Sentences_to: There shall be no prostitute of the daughters of Israel, neither shall there be a sodomite of the sons of Israel.
Translated_sentences: Thou shalt not overturn the judgment of the ward, nor of the orphan, nor take the garments of the widow for a pledge.;

Sentences_from: Jam uczynił ziemię, także człowieka i bydlęta, którekolwiek są na obliczu ziemi, mocą swoją wielką i ramieniem swojem wyciągnionem: przeto ja daję temu, który się podoba oczom moim.
Sentences_to: I have made the earth, the men and the animals that are on the surface of the earth, by my great power and by my outstretched arm; and I give it to whom it seems right to me.
Translated_sentences: I have made the earth, both man and beast, which are on the face of the earth, with my great power and with my outstretched arm: therefore I give to him that pleaseth my eyes.

Sentences_from: Pokądże się nie odwrócisz odemnie? a nie zaniechasz mię, ażbym przełknął ślinę moję?
Sentences_to: How long will you not look away from me, nor leave me alone until I swallow down my spittle?
Translated_sentences: Why don't you turn your back on me? will you not forsake me till I swallow my saliva?

Sentences_from: Rzekł potem Bóg do Jakóba: Wstań, wstąp do Betela, a mieszkaj tam, i uczyń tam ołtarz Bogu, któryć się ukazał, gdyś uciekał przed obliczem Ezawa, brata twego.
Sentences_to: God said to Jacob, "Arise, go up to Bethel, and live there. Make there an altar to God, who appeared to you when you fled from the face of Esau your brother."
Translated_sentences: And God said unto Jacob, arise, go up to Bethel, and dwell there, and make there an altar unto God, which thou didst appear, when thou didst flee from the face of Esau thy brother.

Sentences_from: Tak mówi Pan zastępów: Jeszcze będzie na tem miejscu pustem, na którem niemasz ani człowieka, ani bydlęcia, i we wszystkich miastach jego mieszkanie pasterzy, gdzieby chowali trzody;
Sentences_to: Thus says Yahweh of Armies: Yet again shall there be in this place, which is waste, without man and without animal, and in all its cities, a habitation of shepherds causing their flocks to lie down.
Translated_sentences: Thus saith the Lord of hosts; yet shall there be in that desolate place, where thou hast neither man nor beast; and in all the cities thereof shall there be shepherds to hide their flocks;

Sentences_from: Tedy zawołał Salomona, syna swego, a przykazał mu, aby zbudował dom Panu, Bogu Izraelskiemu.
Sentences_to: Then he called for Solomon his son, and commanded him to build a house for Yahweh, the God of Israel.
Translated_sentences: Then he called Solomon his son, and commanded him to build an house for the Lord God of Israel.

Sentences_from: Słuchajże tego pilnie, Ijobie! zastanów się, a uważaj dziwne sprawy Boże.
Sentences_to: "Listen to this, Job. Stand still, and consider the wondrous works of God.
Translated_sentences: Listen to this urgently, Ijob! think about it, and watch out for strange things God.

Sentences_from: Wodyś spracowanemu nie podał, a głodnemu odmówiłeś chleba.
Sentences_to: You haven't given water to the weary to drink, and you have withheld bread from the hungry.
Translated_sentences: You didn't give water to the processed, and you refused bread to the hungry.

Sentences_from: Tamar zasię, niewiastka jego, urodziła mu Faresa i Zarę. Wszystkich synów Judowych pięć.
Sentences_to: Tamar his daughter-in-law bore him Perez and Zerah. All the sons of Judah were five.
Translated_sentences: Tamar zasa, his wife, bore him fares and Zara. All the children of Judah, five.

Sentences_from: Jednak Farao obciążył serce swe i tym razem, a nie wypuścił ludu.
Sentences_to: Pharaoh said, "I will let you go, that you may sacrifice to Yahweh your God in the wilderness, only you shall not go very far away. Pray for me."
Translated_sentences: But Pharaoh burdened his heart this time, and did not let the people go.

Sentences_from: A inne sprawy Manachemowe, i cokolwiek czynił, napisane są w kronikach o królach Izraelskich.
Sentences_to: All the people of Judah took Azariah, who was sixteen years old, and made him king in the place of his father Amaziah.
Translated_sentences: And the rest of the acts of manachem, and whatsoever he did, are they not written in the chronicles of the kings of Israel?

Sentences_from: Wywyższy się ręka twoja nad nieprzyjaciołmi twoimi, a wszyscy przeciwnicy twoi wykorzenieni będą.
Sentences_to: The remnant of Jacob will be among the nations, in the midst of many peoples, like a lion among the animals of the forest, like a young lion among the flocks of sheep; who, if he goes through, treads down and tears in pieces, and there is no one to deliver.
Translated_sentences: Your hand shall be exalted above your enemies, and all your adversaries shall be uprooted.

Sentences_from: Ale Barak gonił wozy i wojsko aż do Haroset pogańskiego; i poległo wszystko wojsko Sysarowe od ostrza miecza, tak iż z nich i jeden nie został.
Sentences_to: But Barak pursued after the chariots, and after the army, to Harosheth of the Gentiles: and all the army of Sisera fell by the edge of the sword; there was not a man left.
Translated_sentences: But Barak pursued the chariots and the army as far as harosheth the heathen: and all the army of Sisera fell by the edge of the sword, and not one of them remained.

Sentences_from: To mi ukazał panujący Pan. Oto tworzył szaraóczę, gdy najpierwej począł odrastać potraw, gdy oto potraw był po pokoszeniu królewskiem.
Sentences_to: Thus the Lord Yahweh showed me: and behold, he formed locusts in the beginning of the shooting up of the latter growth; and behold, it was the latter growth after the king's harvest.
Translated_sentences: This is what the master showed me. Behold, he formed the grayling, when he first began to grow the food, when behold, the food was after the king's meal.

Sentences_from: Abym ci do wiadomości podał pewność powieści prawdziwych, abyś umiał odnosić słowa prawdy tym, którzy cię posłali.
Sentences_to: To teach you truth, reliable words, to give sound answers to the ones who sent you?
Translated_sentences: That I may make known to you the certainty of true stories, that you may be able to relate the words of truth to those who sent you.

Sentences_from: Któremu odpowiedział pan jego: Nie wstępujmy do miasta cudzoziemców, które nie jest z synów Izraelskich, ale idźmy aż do Gabaa.
Sentences_to: His master said to him, "We won't turn aside into the city of a foreigner, that is not of the children of Israel; but we will pass over to Gibeah."
Translated_sentences: And his Lord said unto him, let us not enter into the city of strangers, which is not of the children of Israel; but let us go as far as Gibeah.

Sentences_from: Synów z Karyjatyjarymu, z Kafiry i z Beerotu siedm set i czterdzieści i trzy;
Sentences_to: The children of Kiriath Arim, Chephirah, and Beeroth, seven hundred forty-three.
Translated_sentences: Of the children of Kariathearim, of Caphira, and of Beeroth, seven hundred and forty and three.;

Sentences_from: Izali nie ty, o Boże! któryś nas był odrzucił, a nie wychodziłeś, o Boże! z wojskami naszemi?
Sentences_to: Give us help against the enemy, for the help of man is vain.
Translated_sentences: If not you, oh, my god! one of you rejected US, and you didn't leave, oh, my god! with our troops?

Sentences_from: I były miasta w granicach pokolenia synów Judowych podle granicy Edom ku południowi: Kabseel, i Eder, i Jagur.
Sentences_to: The farthest cities of the tribe of the children of Judah toward the border of Edom in the South were Kabzeel, Eder, Jagur,
Translated_sentences: And there were cities in the borders of the tribe of the children of Judah by the border of Edom southward: kabshel, and Eder, and jagur.

Sentences_from: I położyli zbroję jego w kościele Astarot; ale ciało jego przybili na murze Betsan.
Sentences_to: They put his armor in the house of the Ashtaroth; and they fastened his body to the wall of Beth Shan.
Translated_sentences: And they laid his armour in the temple of Ashtaroth: but they nailed his body upon the wall of bethshan.

Sentences_from: I uczynili rotmistrze oni według wszystkiego, co im był rozkazał Jojada kapłan; a wziąwszy każdy męże swe, którzy przychodzili w sabat, i którzy odchodzili w sabat, przyszli do Jojady kapłana.
Sentences_to: The captains over hundreds did according to all that Jehoiada the priest commanded; and they took every man his men, those who were to come in on the Sabbath, with those who were to go out on the Sabbath, and came to Jehoiada the priest.
Translated_sentences: And they did according to all that Jehoiada the priest commanded them: and they took every man that came on the Sabbath, and that went on the Sabbath, and came unto Jehoiada the priest.

Sentences_from: Czego dostać mógł, jedno z tych będzie ofiarą za grzech, a drugie na ofiarę całopalenia z ofiarą śniedną; a tak oczyści kapłan tego, który się oczyszcza przed obliczem Pańskiem.
Sentences_to: If the priest examines the plague of itching, and behold, its appearance isn't deeper than the skin, and there is no black hair in it, then the priest shall isolate him the person infected with itching seven days.
Translated_sentences: Whatever he may receive, one of these shall be for a sin offering, and the other for a burnt offering with a meat offering: and the priest shall make atonement for him that purifies himself before the Lord.

Sentences_from: Ale nie chciał: i rzekł do żony pana swego: Oto, pan mój nie wie, tak jako ja, co jest w domu jego; bo wszystko, co miał, podał w ręce moje.
Sentences_to: But he refused, and said to his master's wife, "Behold, my master doesn't know what is with me in the house, and he has put all that he has into my hand.
Translated_sentences: But he would not.he said to his master's wife, " behold, my master does not know, as I do, what is in his house; for all that he has, he has given into my hand."

Sentences_from: Tak bowiem Pan rzekł do mnie, ująwszy mię za rękę, i dał mi przestrogę, żebym nie chodził drogą ludu tego, mówiąc:
Sentences_to: For Yahweh spoke thus to me with a strong hand, and instructed me not to walk in the way of this people, saying,
Translated_sentences: For thus the Lord spake unto me, and took me by the hand, and gave me a warning, that I should not walk in the way of this people, saying,:

Sentences_from: A Heberowi urodzili się dwa synowie: imię jednemu Faleg, iż za dni jego rozdzielona jest ziemia; a imię brata jego Jektan.
Sentences_to: To Eber were born two sons. The name of the one was Peleg, for in his days the earth was divided. His brother's name was Joktan.
Translated_sentences: And to Heber were born two sons: the name of the one was Phaleg, because in his days the earth was divided; and the name of his brother was Hektan.

Sentences_from: Omyjcie się, czystymi bądźcie, odejmijcie złość uczynków waszych od oczów moich; przestaócie źle czynić.
Sentences_to: Wash yourselves, make yourself clean. Put away the evil of your doings from before my eyes. Cease to do evil.
Translated_sentences: Wash yourselves, be clean; take away the evil of your doings from my sight; you shall cease to do evil.

Sentences_from: Przyłożę i ręce moje do rozkazaó twoich, które miłuję, a będę rozmyślał o ustawach twoich.
Sentences_to: I reach out my hands for your commandments, which I love. I will meditate on your statutes.
Translated_sentences: I will also lay my hands on your commandments, which I love, and I will meditate on your statutes.

Sentences_from: Psalm Dawidowy. Pan jest światłością moją, i zbawieniem mojem, kogóż się bać będę? Pan jest mocą żywota mego, kogóż się mam lękać?
Sentences_to: < < By David. > > Yahweh is my light and my salvation. Whom shall I fear? Yahweh is the strength of my life. Of whom shall I be afraid?
Translated_sentences: Psalm Of David. The Lord is my light, and my salvation: of whom shall I fear? The Lord is the power of my life, of whom shall I fear?

Sentences_from: Przetoż ty idź, a czytaj na tych księgach, coś napisał z ust moich, słowa Pańskie, przed uszyma ludu w domu Pańskim w dzień postu; także też przed uszyma wszystkich z Judy którzyby przyszli z miast swoich, czytaj je.
Sentences_to: therefore you go, and read in the scroll, which you have written from my mouth, the words of Yahweh in the ears of the people in Yahweh's house on the fast day; and also you shall read them in the ears of all Judah who come out of their cities.
Translated_sentences: Go therefore, and read in these books, which he hath written out of my mouth, the words of the Lord, before the ears of the people in the house of the Lord on the day of the fast: and before the ears of all Judah that shall come out of their cities, read them.

Sentences_from: Ale szczodrze otworzysz mu rękę twoję, i ochotnie pożyczysz mu, ile będzie potrzebował i czego by mu niedostawało.
Sentences_to: The pig, because it has a split hoof but doesn't chew the cud, is unclean to you: of their flesh you shall not eat, and their carcasses you shall not touch.
Translated_sentences: But you will generously open your hand to him, and willingly lend him what he needs and what he lacks.

Sentences_from: I znalazłeś serce jego wierne przed obliczem twojem, i uczyniłeś z nim przymierze, że dasz ziemię Chananejczyka, Hetejczyka, Amorejczyka, i Ferezejczyka, i Jebuzejczyka, i Giergiezejczyka, że ją dasz nasieniu jego, i ziściłeś słowa twoje; boś ty sprawiedliwy.
Sentences_to: and found his heart faithful before you, and made a covenant with him to give the land of the Canaanite, the Hittite, the Amorite, and the Perizzite, and the Jebusite, and the Girgashite, to give it to his seed, and have performed your words; for you are righteous.
Translated_sentences: And thou hast found his heart faithful before thee, and hast made a covenant with him, that thou shouldest give the land of the Canaanites, and of the Hittites, and of the Amorites, and of the Perizzites, and of the Jebusites, and of the giergizites, that thou shouldest give it to his seed; and thou hast fulfilled thy words: for thou art righteous.

Sentences_from: Izali się zawstydzili, przeto, że obrzydliwość czynili? Zaiste, ani się zapałać ani wstydzić umieli; przetoż upadną między padającymi, czasu nawiedzenia swego upadną, mówi Pan.
Sentences_to: Were they ashamed when they had committed abomination? nay, they were not at all ashamed, neither could they blush: therefore shall they fall among those who fall; in the time of their visitation they shall be cast down, says Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: Are they ashamed because they have done abomination? For they knew neither to be zealous, nor to be ashamed; therefore they shall fall among them that fall; in the time of their visitation they shall fall, saith the Lord.

Sentences_from: A gdy nań nalegali aż do uprzykrzenia, rzekł: Poślijcież. A tak posłali onych pięćdziesiąt mężów, którzy szukając przez trzy dni nie znaleźli go.
Sentences_to: When they urged him until he was ashamed, he said, "Send them." They sent therefore fifty men; and they searched for three days, but didn't find him.
Translated_sentences: And when they pressed him to the point of trouble, he said, send. So they sent fifty men, who searched for three days and did not find him.

Sentences_from: Rozkazał też ludowi mieszkającemu w Jeruzalemie, aby oddawali dział kapłanom i Lewitom, aby byli tem pilniejszymi w zakonie Pańskim.
Sentences_to: The thing was right in the eyes of the king and of all the assembly.
Translated_sentences: And he commanded the people that dwelt in Jerusalem to give their portion unto the priests and Levites, that they might be more diligent in the law of the Lord.

Sentences_from: Ale gdyby Bóg chciał mówić, i otworzyć usta swoje przeciwko tobie:
Sentences_to: But oh that God would speak, and open his lips against you,
Translated_sentences: But if God would speak, and open his mouth against thee:

Sentences_from: Tedy podniósłszy Lot oczy swe, obaczył wszystkę równinę nad Jordanem, iż wszystka wilgotna była przedtem, niż zatracił Pan Sodomę i Gomorrę, jako sąd Pański, i jako ziemia Egipska, idąc do Zoar.
Sentences_to: Lot lifted up his eyes, and saw all the plain of the Jordan, that it was well-watered everywhere, before Yahweh destroyed Sodom and Gomorrah, like the garden of Yahweh, like the land of Egypt, as you go to Zoar.
Translated_sentences: And lot lifted up his eyes, and looked over all the plain of Jordan, that it was all wet, before the LORD destroyed Sodom and Gomorrah, for the judgment of the Lord, and for the land of Egypt, to Zoar.

Sentences_from: Także i o Syonie mówić będą:Ten i ów urodził się w nim; a sam Najwyższy ugruntuje go.
Sentences_to: Yes, of Zion it will be said, "This one and that one was born in her"; the Most High himself will establish her.
Translated_sentences: They will also say of Zion, " this and that were born in it, and the most high will establish it."

Sentences_from: I Hasabijasza, a z nim Jesajasza z synów Merarego, braci jego, i synów ich dwadzieścia;
Sentences_to: and Hashabiah, and with him Jeshaiah of the sons of Merari, his brothers and their sons, twenty;
Translated_sentences: And Hashabiah, and with him Jeshaiah of the Sons of Merari his brethren, and their twenty sons, ;

Sentences_from: Tedy rzekł Pan do Izajasza: Wyjdź teraz przeciw Achazowi, ty, i Sear Jasub, syn twój, na koniec rur sadzawki wyższej, na drogę pola farbierzowego;
Sentences_to: Then Yahweh said to Isaiah, "Go out now to meet Ahaz, you, and Shearjashub your son, at the end of the conduit of the upper pool, on the highway of the fuller's field.
Translated_sentences: And the Lord said unto Isaiah, go out now against Ahaz, thou, and shear Jashub thy son, to the end of the pipes of the High pool, to the way of the dyeing field.;

Sentences_from: (Bo tam sześć miesięcy mieszkał Joab ze wszystkimi Izraelczykami, aż wytracił wszystkie mężczyzny w Edom.)
Sentences_to: (for Joab and all Israel remained there six months, until he had cut off every male in Edom);
Translated_sentences: (For there Joab lived with all the Israelites for six months, until he killed all the men in Edom.)

Sentences_from: Lecz ty królu, panie mój, wiesz, iż się oczy wszystkiego Izraela oglądają na cię, abyś im oznajmił, kto będzie siedział na stolicy króla, pana mego, po tobie.
Sentences_to: You, my lord the king, the eyes of all Israel are on you, that you should tell them who shall sit on the throne of my lord the king after him.
Translated_sentences: But thou, O king my lord, knowest that the eyes of all Israel look upon thee, that thou mayest tell them who shall sit upon the throne of the king my lord after thee.

Sentences_from: I gdy się uszykowali Filistynowie przeciwko Izraelowi, a stoczyła się bitwa: tedy porażony jest Izrael od Filistynów, a pobito ich w onej bitwie na polu około czterech tysięcy mężów.
Sentences_to: The Philistines put themselves in array against Israel: and when they joined battle, Israel was struck before the Philistines; and they killed of the army in the field about four thousand men.
Translated_sentences: And it came to pass, when the Philistines were arrayed against Israel, and the battle was fought, that Israel was smitten by the Philistines, and they were slain in the battle in the field about four thousand men.

Sentences_from: I pobili Moabitów na ten czas około dziesięciu tysięcy mężów, wszystko bogatych, i wszystko mężów dużych, a nikt nie uszedł.
Sentences_to: They struck of Moab at that time about ten thousand men, every lusty man, and every man of valor; and there escaped not a man.
Translated_sentences: And they smote the Moabites at that time about ten thousand men, all rich men, and all great men, and none escaped.

Sentences_from: Biada! bo wielki jest ten dzień, tak, że mu nie było podobnego; ale jakiżkolwiek jest czas utrapienia Jakóbowego, przecie z niego wybawiony będzie.
Sentences_to: Alas! for that day is great, so that none is like it: it is even the time of Jacob's trouble; but he shall be saved out of it.
Translated_sentences: Woe! for this day is great, because there was none like it: but whatever the time of Jacob's affliction, he shall be delivered out of it.

Sentences_from: Zmacniajcież się, a bądźcie mężami, o Filistynowie! byście snać nie służyli Hebrejczykom, jako oni wam służyli. Bądźcież tedy mężami, a potykajcie się.
Sentences_to: Be strong, and behave like men, O you Philistines, that you not be servants to the Hebrews, as they have been to you. Strengthen yourselves like men, and fight!"
Translated_sentences: Be strong, and be men, o philistines! lest ye serve the Hebrews as they have served you. Be ye therefore men, and stumble.

Sentences_from: I rzekli do niego: Oto teraz jest przy sługach twych pięćdziesiąt mężów mocnych. Proszę niech idą, a niech szukają Pana twego; by go snać nie zaniósł Duch Pański, a nie porzucił go na której górze, albo w której dolinie. Ale im on rzekł: Nie posyłajcie.
Sentences_to: They said to him, "See now, there are with your servants fifty strong men. Please let them go and seek your master. Perhaps the Spirit of Yahweh has taken him up, and put him on some mountain, or into some valley. He said, "You shall not send them."
Translated_sentences: And they said unto him, Behold, now there are fifty mighty men with thy servants. Let them go, I pray thee, and seek thy lord: lest the spirit of the Lord take him away, and cast him away in which mountain, or in which valley. But he said unto them, send not.

Sentences_from: Lew ginie, iż nie ma łupu, i szczenięta lwie rozproszone bywają.
Sentences_to: The old lion perishes for lack of prey. The cubs of the lioness are scattered abroad.
Translated_sentences: The lion dies because there is no prey, and the lion cubs are scattered.

Sentences_from: Ale kapłani stali w rzędach swych: Lewitowie także z instrumentami muzyki Pańskiej, które był sprawił Dawid król ku chwaleniu Pana, (że na wieki miłosierdzie jego) pieśnią Dawidową, którą im podał. Inni też kapłani trąbili przeciwko nim, a wszyscy Izraelczycy stali.
Sentences_to: The priests stood, according to their positions; the Levites also with instruments of music of Yahweh, which David the king had made to give thanks to Yahweh, when David praised by their ministry, saying "For his loving kindness endures for ever." The priests sounded trumpets before them; and all Israel stood.
Translated_sentences: But the priests stood in their ranks: the Levites also with instruments of the Lord's music, which David the king had made to praise the Lord, with the song of David which he had given them. The other priests also blew against them, and all the Israelites stood.

Sentences_from: Dla zimna leniwy nie orze; przetoż żebrać będzie we żniwa, ale nic nie otrzyma.
Sentences_to: The sluggard will not plow by reason of the winter; therefore he shall beg in harvest, and have nothing.
Translated_sentences: The slothful ploweth not for cold: therefore he shall beg for the harvest, but shall receive nothing.

Sentences_from: Nie będę się zaiste na wieki wadził, ani się wiecznie gniewał; boćby duch przed obliczem mojem zemdlał, i dusze, którem Ja uczynił.
Sentences_to: For I will not contend forever, neither will I be always angry; for the spirit would faint before me, and the souls who I have made.
Translated_sentences: For I will not be troubled for ever, neither will I be angry for ever: for the spirit shall faint before me, and the souls which I have made.

Sentences_from: Nieprzyjaciele moi mówili źle o mnie: Kiedyż wżdy umrze, a zginie imię jego?
Sentences_to: If he comes to see me, he speaks falsehood. His heart gathers iniquity to itself. When he goes abroad, he tells it.
Translated_sentences: My enemies have spoken evil of me: when shall he die, and his name perish?

Sentences_from: Ale nie mogli synowi Manasesowi wypędzić z onych miast obywateli; przetoż począł Chananejczyk mieszkać w onej ziemi.
Sentences_to: Yet the children of Manasseh couldn't drive out the inhabitants of those cities; but the Canaanites would dwell in that land.
Translated_sentences: But the son of Manasseh could not drive out the inhabitants of those cities: therefore the Canaanite began to dwell in that land.

Sentences_from: Nie przystoi głupiemu rozkosz, ani słudze panować nad książętami.
Sentences_to: Delicate living is not appropriate for a fool, much less for a servant to have rule over princes.
Translated_sentences: It is not lawful for a fool to delight, nor for a servant to rule over princes.

Sentences_from: A Joab wróciwszy się z pogoni za Abnerem, zebrał wszystek lud, i nie dostawało mu sług Dawidowych dziewiętnastu mężów, i Asaela.
Sentences_to: Joab returned from following Abner: and when he had gathered all the people together, there lacked of David's servants nineteen men and Asahel.
Translated_sentences: And Joab returned after Abner, and gathered all the people together: and David's servants, nineteen men, and asahel, were not given him.

Sentences_from: Poruszę, mówię, wszystkie narody, i przyjdą do Pożądanego od wszystkich narodów; i napełnię ten dom chwałą, mówi Pan zastępów.
Sentences_to: and I will shake all nations. The precious things of all nations will come, and I will fill this house with glory, says Yahweh of Armies.
Translated_sentences: I will stir up, I say, all nations, and they shall come to the desire of all nations; and I will fill this house with glory, saith the Lord of hosts.

Sentences_from: A przysionki zewsząd w około na dwadzieścia i pięć łokci wdłuż, a wszerz na pięćdziesiąt łokci.
Sentences_to: There were arches all around, twenty-five cubits long, and five cubits broad.
Translated_sentences: And the buttocks on every side about twenty and five cubits apart, and on every side about fifty cubits.

Sentences_from: Tylko ziemi kapłańskiej nie kupił; bo kapłani mieli obrok postanowiony od Faraona, i żywili się obrokiem swym, który im dał Farao; dlategoż nie sprzedawali ziemi swej.
Sentences_to: Only he didn't buy the land of the priests, for the priests had a portion from Pharaoh, and ate their portion which Pharaoh gave them. That is why they didn't sell their land.
Translated_sentences: But he did not buy the land of the priest; for the priests had a pledge from Pharaoh, and lived on their pledge which Pharaoh had given them; therefore they did not sell their land.

Sentences_from: Roku pierwszego Cyrusa, króla Perskiego, aby się wypełniło słowo Pańskie powiedziane przez usta Jeremijaszowe, wzbudził Pan ducha Cyrusa, króla Perskiego, że kazał obwołać i rozpisać po wszystkiem królestwie swojem, mówiąc:
Sentences_to: Now in the first year of Cyrus king of Persia, that the word of Yahweh by the mouth of Jeremiah might be accomplished, Yahweh stirred up the spirit of Cyrus king of Persia, so that he made a proclamation throughout all his kingdom, and put it also in writing, saying,
Translated_sentences: In the first year of Cyrus king of Persia, that the word of the Lord might be fulfilled, which was spoken by the mouth of Jeremiah, The Lord stirred up the spirit of Cyrus king of Persia, that he should proclaim and publish throughout all his kingdom, saying,:

Sentences_from: Gdy im będziesz mówił te wszystkie słowa, i ciebie nie usłuchają; a gdy na nich wołać będziesz, nie ozwąć się.
Sentences_to: You shall speak all these words to them; but they will not listen to you: you shall also call to them; but they will not answer you.
Translated_sentences: When you speak all these words to them, they will not listen to you.when you cry out to them, they will not respond.

Sentences_from: Przetoż tak mówi panujący Pan: Biada temu miastu krwawemu, garncowi, w którym zostaje przywara jego, z którego, mówię, przywara jego nie wychodzi: po sztukach, po sztukach wyciągaj z niego, nie padnieć nań los.
Sentences_to: Therefore thus says the Lord Yahweh: Woe to the bloody city, to the caldron whose rust is therein, and whose rust is not gone out of it! take out of it piece after piece; No lot is fallen on it.
Translated_sentences: Therefore thus saith the Lord God; woe unto this bloody city, even unto the pot wherein is left its Bower, out of which, I say, its Bower cometh not out: pluck it out piece by piece, and let no fate fall upon it.

Sentences_from: Owszem, byłem szczerym przed nim, a strzegłem się od nieprawości mojej.
Sentences_to: Therefore Yahweh has rewarded me according to my righteousness, according to the cleanness of my hands in his eyesight.
Translated_sentences: Indeed, I have been honest with him, and I have guarded against my iniquity.

Sentences_from: Z synów Sechanijaszowych, który był z synów Faresowych, Zacharyjasz, a z nim poczet mężów sto i pięćdziesiąt;
Sentences_to: Of the sons of Shecaniah, of the sons of Parosh, Zechariah; and with him were reckoned by genealogy of the males one hundred fifty.
Translated_sentences: Of the Sons of Shechaniah, which was of the Sons of Perez, Zechariah, and with him a hundred and fifty men;

Sentences_from: Dwadzieścia i dwa lata miał Amon, gdy królować począł, a dwa lata królował w Jeruzalemie. A imię matki jego było Masallemet, córka Harusa z Jateby.
Sentences_to: Then Hezekiah said to Isaiah, "The word of Yahweh which you have spoken is good." He said moreover, "Isn't it so, if peace and truth shall be in my days?"
Translated_sentences: Amun was twenty and two years old when he began to reign; and he reigned two years in Jerusalem. And his mother's name was masallemet, the daughter of harus of jateba.

Sentences_from: Efa też, założnica Kalebowa, urodziła Harana, i Moze, i Giezeza; a Haran spłodził Giezeza.
Sentences_to: Ephah, Caleb's concubine, bore Haran, and Moza, and Gazez; and Haran became the father of Gazez.
Translated_sentences: And ephah, Caleb's concubine, bare Haran, and Moz, and giezez: and Haran begat giezez.

Sentences_from: Wstała tedy Anna, gdy się najedli i napili w Sylo; a Heli kapłan siedział na stołku u podwoja kościoła Pańskiego.
Sentences_to: So Hannah rose up after they had eaten in Shiloh, and after they had drunk. Now Eli the priest was sitting on his seat by the doorpost of Yahweh's temple.
Translated_sentences: And Hannah arose, when they had eaten and drunk in Shiloh: and heli the priest sat on a stool at the door of the temple of the Lord.

Sentences_from: I oddali wyroki królewskie starostom królewskim, i książętom za rzeką, a ci byli pomocą ludowi i domowi Bożemu.
Sentences_to: They delivered the king's commissions to the king's satraps, and to the governors beyond the River: and they furthered the people and God's house.
Translated_sentences: And they gave the king's judgments unto the king's officers, and unto the Princes beyond the river: and they were help unto the people, and unto the house of God.

Sentences_from: Obliczcie sumę wszystkiego zgromadzenia synów Izraelskich według narodów ich, i według domów ojców ich według imion ich, każdego mężczyznę według głów ich.
Sentences_to: "Take a census of all the congregation of the children of Israel, by their families, by their fathers' houses, according to the number of the names, every male, one by one;
Translated_sentences: Count the sum of all the congregation of the children of Israel according to their families, and according to their fathers ' houses according to their names, every man according to their heads.

Sentences_from: Chorągiew obozu Danowego położy się ku północy według hufców swych, a hetmanem nad syny Danowymi Achiezer, syn Ammisadajów;
Sentences_to: "On the north side shall be the standard of the camp of Dan according to their divisions: and the prince of the children of Dan shall be Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai.
Translated_sentences: And the standard of the camp of Dan shall be northward, according to his bands: and Ahiezer the son of Ammishadai shall be captain over the Children of Dan.;

Sentences_from: Pomaże też kapłan oną oliwą, która jest na dłoni jego, koniec ucha prawego temu, który się oczyszcza; także wielki palec prawej ręki jego, i wielki palec prawej nogi jego na miejscu krwi z ofiary za występek;
Sentences_to: If the bright spot stays in its place, and hasn't spread in the skin, but is faded, it is the swelling from the burn, and the priest shall pronounce him clean; for it is the scar from the burn.
Translated_sentences: And the priest shall anoint with the oil that is in his hand the end of the right ear of him that is to be cleansed, and the great finger of his right hand, and the great toe of his right foot, in the place of the blood of the trespass offering.;

Sentences_from: A do Neftalima rzekł: Neftali, nasycony przyjaźni i pełny błogosławieństwa Pańskiego, zachód i południe opanujesz.
Sentences_to: He commissioned Joshua the son of Nun, and said, "Be strong and courageous; for you shall bring the children of Israel into the land which I swore to them: and I will be with you."
Translated_sentences: And unto Naphtali he said, Naphtali, full of friendship, and full of the blessing of the LORD, thou shalt possess the west and the south.

Sentences_from: Przywróć mi radość zbawienia twego, a duchem dobrowolnym podeprzyj mię.
Sentences_to: Deliver me from bloodguiltiness, O God, the God of my salvation. My tongue shall sing aloud of your righteousness.
Translated_sentences: Restore to me the joy of thy salvation, and with thy willing spirit sustain me.

Sentences_from: Chwalcie imię jego na piszczałkach; na bębnie i na harfie grajcie mu.
Sentences_to: Let them praise his name in the dance! Let them sing praises to him with tambourine and harp!
Translated_sentences: Praise his name on the pipes; play to him on the drum and on the harp.

Sentences_from: Tedyś rzekł do sług swoich: Jeźli nie przyjdzie brat wasz młodszy z wami, nie ujrzycie więcej oblicza mojego.
Sentences_to: You said to your servants, 'Unless your youngest brother comes down with you, you will see my face no more.'
Translated_sentences: Then you said to your servants, " unless your younger brother comes with you, you will no longer see my face."

Sentences_from: Potknie się zaiste hardy, i upadnie, a nie będzie, ktoby go podniósł; i rozniecę ogieó w miastach jego, który pożre wszystko około niego.
Sentences_to: The proud one shall stumble and fall, and none shall raise him up; and I will kindle a fire in his cities, and it shall devour all who are around him.
Translated_sentences: For the mighty one shall stumble, and fall, and there shall be none to lift him up: and I will kindle a fire in his cities, which shall devour all that is round about him.

Sentences_from: Ale Żydzi, którzy byli w Susan, zebrali się dnia trzynastego i czternastego tegoż miesiąca; a odpoczęli piętnastego dnia tegoż miesiąca, i sprawowali dnia onego uczty i wesela.
Sentences_to: But the Jews who were in Shushan assembled together on the thirteenth and on the fourteenth days of the month; and on the fifteenth day of that month, they rested, and made it a day of feasting and gladness.
Translated_sentences: But the Jews that were in Shushan gathered themselves together on the thirteenth and fourteenth day of the month, and rested on the fifteenth day of the month, and kept that day feasts and weddings.

Sentences_from: Między gładkim kamieniem potokowym jest dział twój. Cić są, ci losem twoim, na które też wylewasz ofiarę mokrą, a ofiarujesz ofiarę śniedną, i w temże bym się Ja kochał?
Sentences_to: Among the smooth stones of the valley is your portion; they, they are your lot; you have even poured a drink offering to them. You have offered an offering. Shall I be appeased for these things?
Translated_sentences: Between the smooth stone of the stream is your plot. Are they Your lot, on which you also pour out a wet offering, and you offer a meat offering, and in which I would make love?

Sentences_from: Strzeżcież się, byście snać nie zapomnieli przymierza Pana, Boga waszego, które uczynił z wami, a nie czynili sobie rytego obrazu na kształt jakiejkolwiek rzeczy, jakoć rozkazał Pan, Bóg twój.
Sentences_to: Take heed to yourselves, lest you forget the covenant of Yahweh your God, which he made with you, and make you an engraved image in the form of anything which Yahweh your God has forbidden you.
Translated_sentences: Take heed that ye forget not the covenant of the LORD your God, which he hath made with you, and that ye make no graven image after the form of any thing, as the LORD thy God hath commanded.

Sentences_from: Ziemia Ataret i Dybon, i Jazer, i Nemra, i Hesebon, i Eleale, i Seban, i Nebo, i Beon:
Sentences_to: Moses spoke to the people, saying, "Arm men from among you for the war, that they may go against Midian, to execute Yahweh's vengeance on Midian.
Translated_sentences: The land of Ataret, and Dybon, and Jazer, and Nemr, and Hesebon, and Eleale, and Seban, and Nebo, and Beon:

Sentences_from: Boś mi bywał na pomocy; przetoż w cieniu skrzydeł twoich śpiewać będę.
Sentences_to: My soul stays close to you. Your right hand holds me up.
Translated_sentences: For I have been helped; therefore in the shadow of thy wings will I sing.

Sentences_from: Cić są synowie Semowi w domach swych, w językach swych, w ziemiach swych, w narodziech swych.
Sentences_to: These are the sons of Shem, after their families, after their languages, in their lands, after their nations.
Translated_sentences: These are the children of Shem in their houses, in their languages, in their lands, in their generations.

Sentences_from: Znalazłem Dawida, sługę mego; olejkiem świętym moim pomazałem go.
Sentences_to: with whom my hand shall be established. My arm will also strengthen him.
Translated_sentences: I found David my servant, and anointed him with my holy oil.

Sentences_from: Serce królewskie jest w ręce Pańskiej jako potoki wód; kędy chce, nakłoni je.
Sentences_to: The king's heart is in Yahweh's hand like the watercourses. He turns it wherever he desires.
Translated_sentences: The king's heart is in the hand of the Lord, like streams of water: wherever he will, he will incline them.

Sentences_from: Tedy rzekł Bóg do Abrahama: Niech to przykro nie będzie w oczach twoich z strony dziecięcia, i z strony służebnicy twojej; coćkolwiek rzecze Sara, usłuchaj głosu jej; boć w Izaaku nazwane będzie nasienie.
Sentences_to: God said to Abraham, "Don't let it be grievous in your sight because of the boy, and because of your handmaid. In all that Sarah says to you, listen to her voice. For from Isaac will your seed be called.
Translated_sentences: And God said unto Abraham, let it not be grievous in thine eyes for the child's sake, nor for thy handmaid's sake: whatsoever Sarah saith, hearken unto her voice: for in Isaac shall the seed be called.

Sentences_from: Tyś chodzenie moje i leżenie moje ogarnął, świadomeś wszystkich dróg moich.
Sentences_to: You search out my path and my lying down, and are acquainted with all my ways.
Translated_sentences: Thou hast encompassed my walking and my lying; thou hast known all my ways.

Sentences_from: A góra Synaj kurzyła się wszystka, przeto, iż zstąpił na nią Pan w ogniu; i występował dym z niej, jako dym z pieca, i trzęsła się wszystka góra bardzo.
Sentences_to: Mount Sinai, all it, smoked, because Yahweh descended on it in fire; and its smoke ascended like the smoke of a furnace, and the whole mountain quaked greatly.
Translated_sentences: And Mount Sinai was all burning, because the Lord came down upon it in the fire; and there came smoke out of it like the smoke of a furnace, and all the mountain trembled exceedingly.

Sentences_from: Nie strzyżcie w koło włosów głowy waszej, ani brody swojej oszpecajcie.
Sentences_to: (for all these abominations have the men of the land done, that were before you, and the land became defiled);
Translated_sentences: You shall not cut off the hair of your head, nor disfigure your beard.

Sentences_from: A Zacharyjasz, i Jazyjel, i Semiramot, i Jechyjel, i Unni, i Elijab, i Maasejasz, i Benajasz grali na lutniach przy śpiewaniu wysokiem.
Sentences_to: and Zechariah, and Aziel, and Shemiramoth, and Jehiel, and Unni, and Eliab, and Maaseiah, and Benaiah, with stringed instruments set to Alamoth;
Translated_sentences: And Zechariah, and jazijel, and semiramoth, and Jehiel, and Unni, and Eliab, and Maaseiah, and Benaiah, played with the lute in high singing.

Sentences_from: Zatem otworzyły się oczy obojga, i poznali, że byli nagimi; i spletli liście figowe, a poczynili sobie zasłony.
Sentences_to: The eyes of both of them were opened, and they knew that they were naked. They sewed fig leaves together, and made themselves aprons.
Translated_sentences: Then the eyes of both were opened, and they knew that they were naked; and they confused the fig leaves, and made curtains for themselves.

Sentences_from: Albowiem Lewitowie nie mają działu między wami, gdyż kapłaóstwo Pańskie jest dziedzictwo ich; ale Gad, i Ruben, i połowa pokolenia Manasesowego wzięli dziedzictwa swe za Jordanem na wschód słońca, które im oddał Mojżesz, sługa Pański.
Sentences_to: For the Levites have no portion among you; for the priesthood of Yahweh is their inheritance. Gad, Reuben, and the half-tribe of Manasseh have received their inheritance beyond the Jordan eastward, which Moses the servant of Yahweh gave them."
Translated_sentences: For the Levites have no division among you, for the priesthood of the Lord is their inheritance: but Gad, and Reuben, and half the tribe of Manasseh, have taken their inheritance beyond the Jordan toward the east, which Moses the servant of the Lord gave them.

Sentences_from: Wyścieć się zaiste dziś nawrócili, i uczyniliście to, co jest dobrego przed oczyma mojemi, żeście ogłosili wolność każdy bliźniemu swemu, i uczyniliście przymierze przed twarzą moją w domu tym, który jest nazwany od imienia mego.
Sentences_to: You had now turned, and had done that which is right in my eyes, in proclaiming liberty every man to his neighbor; and you had made a covenant before me in the house which is called by my name:
Translated_sentences: For ye have turned this day, and have done that which is good in my sight, that ye have declared liberty every man to his neighbour, and have made a covenant before me in the house which is called by my name.

Sentences_from: I postawił służebnice, i dzieci ich, na przodku, a Liję, i syny jej, za nimi, Rachelę zaś z Józefem na ostatku.
Sentences_to: He put the handmaids and their children in front, Leah and her children after, and Rachel and Joseph at the rear.
Translated_sentences: And he set the handmaids and their children before them, and Leah and her sons after them, and Rachel and Joseph at the end.

Sentences_from: A gdy był wieczór, wziął Liję, córkę swoję, i wwiódł ją do niego, a Jakób wszedł do niej.
Sentences_to: It happened in the evening, that he took Leah his daughter, and brought her to him. He went in to her.
Translated_sentences: And when it was evening, he took Leah his daughter, and brought her to him: and Jacob went in unto her.

Sentences_from: Włóż na Pana sprawy twe, a będą utwierdzone zamysły twoje.
Sentences_to: Commit your deeds to Yahweh, and your plans shall succeed.
Translated_sentences: Put thy works upon the Lord, and thy thoughts shall be established.

Sentences_from: Gdy wypuszczę srogie strzały głodu na zgubę waszę, które wypuszczę, abym was wygubił, a głód zgromadzę przeciwko wam, i złamię wam laskę chleba.
Sentences_to: when I shall send on them the evil arrows of famine, that are for destruction, which I will send to destroy you: and I will increase the famine on you, and will break your staff of bread;
Translated_sentences: When I will send forth the fierce arrows of famine against your destruction, which I will send forth to destroy you, and I will gather the famine against you, and I will break your bread.

Sentences_from: I rzecz do nich: Tak mówi Pan zastępów, Bóg Izraelski: Pijcie, a popijcie się, owszem zwracajcie, i padajcie tak, abyście nie powstali dla miecza, który Ja poślę między was.
Sentences_to: You shall tell them, Thus says Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel: Drink, and be drunk, vomit, fall, and rise no more, because of the sword which I will send among you.
Translated_sentences: And say unto them, Thus saith the Lord of hosts, the god of Israel: drink, and be drunken, and return, and fall, lest ye arise for the sword which I will send among you.

Sentences_from: Owszem, miernie go karał, i w ten czas, gdy go wypychał i gdy go nieprzyjaciel wiatrem swoim gwałtownym w dzień wschodniego wiatru, zabierał.
Sentences_to: In measure, when you send them away, you contend with them. He has removed them with his rough blast in the day of the east wind.
Translated_sentences: Yes, he punished him lightly, and at the time when he pushed him out, and when the enemy with his violent wind in the day of the east wind, he took him away.

Sentences_from: Tedy wstawszy rano sługa męża Bożego, wyszedł, a oto wojsko otoczyło miasto, i konie, i wozy. I rzekł sługa jego do niego: Ach panie mój! Cóż mamy czynić?
Sentences_to: When the servant of the man of God had risen early, and gone out, behold, an army with horses and chariots was around the city. His servant said to him, "Alas, my master! What shall we do?"
Translated_sentences: And the servant of the man of God arose in the morning, and went out: and, behold, the army surrounded the city, and the horses, and the chariots. And his servant said unto him, ah, my lord! What are we supposed to do?

Sentences_from: A gdy się najadł Booz i napił, i rozweseliło się serce jego, poszedł a układł się przy stogu; przyszła też i ona po cichu, a odkrywszy płaszcz z nóg jego, układła się.
Sentences_to: When Boaz had eaten and drunk, and his heart was merry, he went to lie down at the end of the heap of grain. She came softly, uncovered his feet, and laid her down.
Translated_sentences: And it came to pass, when Booz had eaten and drunk, and his heart was glad, that he went and laid himself by the haystack: and she also came softly, and uncovered the mantle of his feet, and laid herself down.

Sentences_from: Potem posłał Jakób posły przed sobą do Ezawa, brata swego, do ziemi Seir, do krainy Edomskiej.
Sentences_to: He commanded them, saying, "This is what you shall tell my lord, Esau: 'This is what your servant, Jacob, says. I have lived as a foreigner with Laban, and stayed until now.
Translated_sentences: Jacob sent messengers before him to Esau his brother in the land of Seir, in the land of Edom.

Sentences_from: A gniewam się bardzo na te narody, które używają pokoju; bo gdym się Ja trochę zagniewał, tedy one pomagały do złego.
Sentences_to: I am very angry with the nations that are at ease; for I was but a little displeased, but they added to the calamity."
Translated_sentences: And I am very angry with those nations that use peace; for if I was a little angry, they helped the evil.

Sentences_from: Potem rzekł Pan do Jozuego: Dzisiajm zdjął pohaóbienie Egipskie z was; i nazwano imię miejsca onego Galgal, aż do dnia tego.
Sentences_to: Yahweh said to Joshua, "Today I have rolled away the reproach of Egypt from off you." Therefore the name of that place was called Gilgal, to this day.
Translated_sentences: And the Lord said unto Joshua, I have this day taken away the reproach of Egypt from you: and the name of the place was called Gilgal unto this day.

Sentences_from: Przyłóż trąbę do ust twoich, a rzecz: Oto leci na dom Pański jako orzeł, przeto, że przestąpili przymierze moje, a przeciwko zakonowi mojemu wykroczyli.
Sentences_to: When I would heal Israel, then the iniquity of Ephraim is uncovered, also the wickedness of Samaria; for they commit falsehood, and the thief enters in, and the gang of robbers ravages outside.
Translated_sentences: You shall put a trumpet in your mouth, and behold, it flies against the house of the Lord like an eagle, because they have transgressed my covenant, and transgressed against my law.

Sentences_from: Przetoż obróciłem się do tego, abym się przypatrywał mądrośći, i szaleństwu, i głupstwu; (bo cóżby człowiek czynił ten, który nastanie po królu? to, co już inni czynili.)
Sentences_to: I turned myself to consider wisdom, madness, and folly: for what can the king's successor do? Just that which has been done long ago.
Translated_sentences: Wherefore I turned to watch wisdom, and folly, and folly: (for what shall the man that shall come after the king do? what others have done before.)

Sentences_from: Którego nie zabrał Nabuchodonozor, król Babiloński, gdy w niewolę prowadził Jechonijasza, syna Joakimowego, króla Judzkiego, z Jeruzalemu do Babilonu, i wszystkich przedniejszych, z Judy i z Jeruzalemu:
Sentences_to: which Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon didn't take, when he carried away captive Jeconiah the son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, from Jerusalem to Babylon, and all the nobles of Judah and Jerusalem;
Translated_sentences: Whom Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon did not take, when he carried away captive Jehonijah the son of Jehoiakim King of Judah from Jerusalem to Babylon, and all the nobles of Judah and Jerusalem.:

Sentences_from: A Arfachsad spłodził Selecha, a Selech spłodził Hebera.
Sentences_to: Arpachshad became the father of Shelah, and Shelah became the father of Eber.
Translated_sentences: And Arphachshad begat selech, and selech begat Heber.

Sentences_from: A tak mieszkaliśmy w dolinie przeciw Betfegor.
Sentences_to: So we stayed in the valley over against Beth Peor.
Translated_sentences: And so we lived in the valley opposite betfegor.

Sentences_from: Sromoty ojca twego, także sromoty matki twojej nie odkryjesz; matką twoją jest, nie odkryjesz sromoty jej.
Sentences_to: They shall no more sacrifice their sacrifices to the goat idols, after which they play the prostitute. This shall be a statute forever to them throughout their generations.'
Translated_sentences: The trouble of thy father, and the trouble of thy mother, Thou shalt not uncover: she is thy mother, Thou shalt not uncover her trouble.

Sentences_from: To gdy się stało, dano znać Józefowi: Oto, ojciec twój zachorzał; który wziąwszy dwóch synów swoich z sobą, Manasesa i Efraima, jechał do niego.
Sentences_to: It happened after these things, that someone said to Joseph, "Behold, your father is sick." He took with him his two sons, Manasseh and Ephraim.
