Sentences_from: Mówi w sercu swem: Nie będę wzruszony od narodu do narodu; bo się nie boję złego.
Sentences_to: He says in his heart, "I shall not be shaken. For generations I shall have no trouble."
Translated_sentences: He saith in his heart, I will not be moved from nation to nation: for I fear not evil.

Sentences_from: I stało się, gdy powstał Filistyóczyk, i szedł, a przybliżał się przeciwko Dawidowi, że pospieszył i Dawid, a bieżał na spotkanie przeciwko Filistynowi:
Sentences_to: It happened, when the Philistine arose, and came and drew near to meet David, that David hurried, and ran toward the army to meet the Philistine.
Translated_sentences: And it came to pass, when the Philistine arose, and went, and drew nigh against David, that David also hastened, and ran to meet the Philistine.:

Sentences_from: I mówił z nimi król; ale nie był znaleziony między onymi wszystkimi, jako Danijel, Ananijasz, Misael i Azaryjasz; i stawali przed obliczem królewskiem.
Sentences_to: The king talked with them; and among them all was found none like Daniel, Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah: therefore stood they before the king.
Translated_sentences: And the king spake with them: but he was not found among them all, as Daniel, Ananias, Mishael, and Azariah; and they stood before the king.

Sentences_from: Weźmiecie też snopek hysopu, i omoczycie we krwi, która będzie w miednicy, a pokropicie odrzwi, i oba podwoje oną krwią, która będzie w miednicy; a z was nie wynijdzie żaden ze drzwi domu swego aż do poranku.
Sentences_to: You shall take a bunch of hyssop, and dip it in the blood that is in the basin, and strike the lintel and the two doorposts with the blood that is in the basin; and none of you shall go out of the door of his house until the morning.
Translated_sentences: And ye shall take a sheaf of hyssop, and dip it in the blood that is in the pelvis, and sprinkle it on the two sides with the blood that is in the pelvis; and none of you shall go out of the door of his house until the morning.

Sentences_from: Ołtarz do całopalenia, i kratę jego miedzianą, drążki jego, i wszystkie naczynia jego, wannę z stolcem jej.
Sentences_to: the altar of burnt offering, with its grating of brass, it poles, and all its vessels, the basin and its base;
Translated_sentences: The altar of incense, and its brazen array, and its bars, and all its vessels, and the tub with its stool.

Sentences_from: Do ziemi, w której bez niedostatku jeść będziesz chleb, a na żadnej rzeczy schodzić ci nie będzie; do ziemi, której kamienie są żelazo, a z jej gór miedź kopać będziesz.
Sentences_to: a land in which you shall eat bread without scarceness, you shall not lack anything in it; a land whose stones are iron, and out of whose hills you may dig copper.
Translated_sentences: To a land in which you shall eat bread without scarcity, and you shall not go down on any thing; to a land whose stones are iron, and from its mountains you shall dig for brass.

Sentences_from: Edomczyków, i Moabczyków, i synów Ammonowych;
Sentences_to: Edom, and Moab, and the children of Ammon;
Translated_sentences: The Edomites, and the Moabites, and the Children of Ammon,;

Sentences_from: Oprócz tego, co przychodziło od kupców i z handlu tych, którzy rzeczami wonnemi kupczyli, i od wszystkich królów Arabskich, i książąt ziemi.
Sentences_to: besides that which the traders brought, and the traffic of the merchants, and of all the kings of the mixed people, and of the governors of the country.
Translated_sentences: Besides that which came from the merchants, and from the merchants of the merchants, and from all the kings of Arabia, and the princes of the land.

Sentences_from: I czynił dobrze Bóg onym babom; i krzewił się lud, i zmocnili się bardzo.
Sentences_to: God dealt well with the midwives, and the people multiplied, and grew very mighty.
Translated_sentences: And God did good to the women; and the people grew strong, and they became very strong.

Sentences_from: A tak odstąpili wszyscy mężowie Izraelscy od Dawida za Sebą, synem Bichry; ale mężowie Judzcy trzymali się króla swego, od Jordanu aż do Jeruzalemu.
Sentences_to: So all the men of Israel went up from following David, and followed Sheba the son of Bichri; but the men of Judah joined with their king, from the Jordan even to Jerusalem.
Translated_sentences: And all the men of Israel departed from David after him the son of Bichra: but the men of Judah clung unto their king from Jordan even unto Jerusalem.

Sentences_from: A tak było po cztery koła pod onem listwowaniem, a osi kół wychodziły z podstawka, a każde koło było wzwyż na półtora łokcia.
Sentences_to: The four wheels were underneath the panels; and the axles of the wheels were in the base: and the height of a wheel was a cubit and half a cubit.
Translated_sentences: And so it was four wheels under the molding, and the axles of the wheels came out of the stand, and each wheel was up an elbow and a half.

Sentences_from: A ci, którzy weszli do domu Michasowego, wzięli obraz ryty, Efod i Terafim, i obraz lany; i rzekł do nich kapłan: Cóż to czynicie?
Sentences_to: When these went into Micah's house, and fetched the engraved image, the ephod, and the teraphim, and the molten image, the priest said to them, "What are you doing?"
Translated_sentences: And they that entered into the house of Micah took the image of the graven image, and the ephod, and the teraphim, and the image of the lance: and the priest said unto them, why do ye these things?

Sentences_from: Bo go złożył król Egipski w Jeruzalemie, i nałożył winę na onę ziemię sto talentów srebra, i talent złota.
Sentences_to: The king of Egypt deposed him at Jerusalem, and fined the land one hundred talents of silver and a talent of gold.
Translated_sentences: For the king of Egypt laid it in Jerusalem, and laid the guilt of a hundred talents of silver and a talent of gold upon the land.

Sentences_from: Wysławiajcież Pana, albowiem jest dobry: albowiem na wieki miłosierdzie jego.
Sentences_to: Oh give thanks to Yahweh, for he is good, for his loving kindness endures forever.
Translated_sentences: Praise the Lord, for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever.

Sentences_from: I rzekł do nich: Pójdźcie za mną: albowiem podał Pan nieprzyjacioły wasze Moabity w ręce wasze. Tedy szli za nim, a odjąwszy bród Jordański Moabitom, nie dopuszczali nikomu przeprawy.
Sentences_to: He said to them, "Follow me; for Yahweh has delivered your enemies the Moabites into your hand." They followed him, and took the fords of the Jordan against the Moabites, and didn't allow any man to pass over.
Translated_sentences: And he said unto them, follow me: for the LORD hath delivered your enemies the Moabites into your hand. And they followed him, and took the Ford of Jordan from the Moabites, and suffered no man to pass over.

Sentences_from: A Isfan, i Eber, i Eliel,
Sentences_to: and Ishpan, and Eber, and Eliel,
Translated_sentences: And Isphan, and Eber, and Eliel,,

Sentences_from: A w czwartym rzędzie: chryzolit, onychin i berył; te będą wsadzone w złoto w rzędziech swoich.
Sentences_to: and the fourth row a chrysolite, an onyx, and a jasper: they shall be enclosed in gold in their settings.
Translated_sentences: And in the fourth row shall be chrysolite, and onyx, and Beryl: these shall be set in gold in their rows.

Sentences_from: Mów do synów Izraelskich, i rzecz im: Gdy przejdziecie przez Jordan do ziemi Chananejskiej.
Sentences_to: "'You shall mark out your east border from Hazar Enan to Shepham;
Translated_sentences: Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, when ye pass through Jordan into the land of Canaan.

Sentences_from: I zawiódł go na pole Sofim, na wierzch góry Fazga, i zbudował siedem ołtarzów, i ofiarował cielca i barana na każdym ołtarzu.
Sentences_to: He took him into the field of Zophim, to the top of Pisgah, and built seven altars, and offered up a bull and a ram on every altar.
Translated_sentences: And he brought him to the field of zophim, on the top of Mount phazgah, and built seven altars, and offered a calf and a ram on every altar.

Sentences_from: A do Dana rzekł: Dan jako szczenię lwie wyskakujące z Basan.
Sentences_to: Of Dan he said, "Dan is a lion's cub that leaps out of Bashan."
Translated_sentences: And he said unto dan, dan is as a lion's cub leaping out of Bashan.

Sentences_from: Znowu rzekł do mnie: Jeszcze obróciwszy się ujrzysz obrzydliwości większe, które oni czynią.
Sentences_to: He said also to me, You shall again see yet other great abominations which they do.
Translated_sentences: Again he said to me, " when you turn around, you will see the greater abominations that they do."

Sentences_from: A gdy wstępował płomieó z ołtarza ku niebu, tedy wstąpił Anioł Pański w płomieniu ołtarzowym, a Manue, i żona jego widząc to, upadli na twarze swe na ziemię.
Sentences_to: For it happened, when the flame went up toward the sky from off the altar, that the angel of Yahweh ascended in the flame of the altar: and Manoah and his wife looked on; and they fell on their faces to the ground.
Translated_sentences: And as the flame went up out of the altar toward heaven, the angel of the Lord went up in the flame of the altar: and Manoah and his wife saw it, and fell on their faces to the ground.

Sentences_from: I rzekł do chłopca swego: Bież, szukaj prędko strzał, które ja wystrzelę. Tedy chłopiec bieżał; a on wystrzelił strzały dalej przedeó.
Sentences_to: He said to his boy, "Run, find now the arrows which I shoot." As the boy ran, he shot an arrow beyond him.
Translated_sentences: He said to his young man, " run, and look quickly for the arrows that I will shoot." So the boy ran; and he shot arrows farther before him.

Sentences_from: Daj mi żony moje, i dzieci moje, za którem ci służył, że odejdę; bo ty wiesz posługi moje, jakom ci służył.
Sentences_to: Give me my wives and my children for whom I have served you, and let me go; for you know my service with which I have served you."
Translated_sentences: Give me my wives, and my children, for whom I have served you, that I may go away; for you know my service, which I have served you.

Sentences_from: Tedy poseł, który chodził, aby przyzwał Micheasza, rzekł do niego, mówiąc: Oto teraz słowa proroków jednemi usty dobrze tuszą królowi; niechże będzie proszę słowo twoje, jako słowo jednego z nich, a mów dobre rzeczy.
Sentences_to: The messenger who went to call Micaiah spoke to him, saying, "See now, the prophets declare good to the king with one mouth. Please let your word be like the word of one of them, and speak good."
Translated_sentences: And the messenger that went to call Micaiah spake unto him, saying, Behold now the words of the prophets with one mouth shall do good to the king: let thy word be, I pray thee, as the word of one of them, and speak good things.

Sentences_from: Synów Pashurowych tysiąc dwieście czterdzieści i siedm;
Sentences_to: The children of Pashhur, one thousand two hundred forty-seven.
Translated_sentences: The children of Pashur, one thousand two hundred forty and seven;

Sentences_from: Do tego wygotowali kamienie onychiny, oprawione złotem osadzeniem, rzezane, jako ryte bywają pieczęci, z imiony synów Izraelskich.
Sentences_to: They worked the onyx stones, enclosed in settings of gold, engraved with the engravings of a signet, according to the names of the children of Israel.
Translated_sentences: And they prepared the stones of onychina, set with golden settings, carved as seals, with the names of the children of Israel.

Sentences_from: A synowie Chamowi: Chus, i Micraim, i Put, i Chanaan.
Sentences_to: The sons of Ham: Cush, Mizraim, Put, and Canaan.
Translated_sentences: And the sons of ham: hush, and Mizraim, and put, and Canaan.

Sentences_from: Dnia onego pomdleją panienki piękne, nawet i młodzieńcy od onego pragnienia;
Sentences_to: In that day the beautiful virgins and the young men will faint for thirst.
Translated_sentences: On that day the fair ones will faint, even the young ones, because of his desire.;

Sentences_from: Albo jeźliby mając kamień w ręku, którym by mógł zabić, uderzył go, tak żeby umarł, mężobójcą jest; śmiercią umrze on mężobójca.
Sentences_to: "These are the names of the men who shall divide the land to you for inheritance: Eleazar the priest, and Joshua the son of Nun.
Translated_sentences: Or if he had a stone in his hand wherewith he might kill, and smote him so that he died, he is a murderer: he shall surely die a murderer.

Sentences_from: Będzieszli mądrym, sobie będziesz mądrym; a jeźli naśmiewcą, ty sam szkodę odniesiesz.
Sentences_to: If you are wise, you are wise for yourself. If you mock, you alone will bear it.
Translated_sentences: If thou be wise, thou shalt be wise unto thyself: but if thou be a scoffer, thou shalt be hurt.

Sentences_from: I Elisama, i Beelijada, i Elifelet.)
Sentences_to: and Elishama, and Beeliada, and Eliphelet.
Translated_sentences: And Elishama, and beeliada, and eliphelet.)

Sentences_from: Nie będą Panu wina ofiarowali, ani mu będą przyjemne. Ofiary ich będą im jako chleb płaczących; którzybykolwiek z niego jedli, zmazaliby się, przeto, że chleb ich za umarłych ich nie wnijdzie do domu Pańskiego.
Sentences_to: They have set up kings, but not by me. They have made princes, and I didn't approve. Of their silver and their gold they have made themselves idols, that they may be cut off.
Translated_sentences: They will not offer you wine, nor will they please him. Their sacrifices shall be unto them as the bread of them that weep: whosoever eateth thereof shall be cut off: because their bread shall not come into the house of the Lord for their dead.

Sentences_from: Mów, a rzecz: Tak mówi panujący Pan: Otom Ja przeciwko tobie o Faraonie, królu Egipski, wielorybie wielki, który leżysz w pośrodku rzek twoich, i mówisz: Mojać jest rzeka, i jam ją sobie uczynił;
Sentences_to: Speak and say, 'Thus says the Lord Yahweh: "Behold, I am against you, Pharaoh king of Egypt, the great monster that lies in the midst of his rivers, that has said, 'My river is my own, and I have made it for myself.'
Translated_sentences: Speak, and say, Thus saith the Lord God; I will speak against thee concerning Pharaoh king of Egypt, the Great Whale, which thou liest in the midst of thy rivers, and say, the river is mine, and I have made it mine.;

Sentences_from: Śpiewajcie mu, śpiewajcie mu psalmy, rozmawiajcie o wszystkich cudach jego.
Sentences_to: Sing to him, sing praises to him! Tell of all his marvelous works.
Translated_sentences: Sing to him, sing psalms to him, talk of all his miracles.

Sentences_from: I uczynił Mojżesz, jako rozkazał Pan; i wstąpili na górę Hor przed oczyma wszystkiego zgromadzenia.
Sentences_to: Moses did as Yahweh commanded: and they went up into Mount Hor in the sight of all the congregation.
Translated_sentences: And Moses did as the LORD commanded; and they went up to Mount Hor in the sight of all the congregation.

Sentences_from: I ostrze miecza jego stępiłeś, a nie ratowałeś go w bitwie.
Sentences_to: You have ended his splendor, and thrown his throne down to the ground.
Translated_sentences: And the edge of his sword thou didst blunt, and save him not in battle.

Sentences_from: Niech rozsądzi Pan między mną i między tobą, a niech się zemści Pan krzywdy mojej nad tobą; lecz ręka moja nie będzie na tobie.
Sentences_to: Then David and his men, who were about six hundred, arose and departed out of Keilah, and went wherever they could go. It was told Saul that David was escaped from Keilah; and he gave up going there.
Translated_sentences: Let the Lord judge between me and you, and let the Lord avenge my hurt on you; but my hand shall not be upon you.

Sentences_from: I żył Matuzalem po spłodzeniu Lamecha siedem set osiemdziesiąt lat, i dwa lata, i spłodził syny i córki.
Sentences_to: Methuselah lived after he became the father of Lamech seven hundred eighty-two years, and became the father of sons and daughters.
Translated_sentences: And Methuselah lived after he begat Lamech seven hundred and eighty years and two years, and begat sons and daughters.

Sentences_from: Pójdźcież, a oglądajcie sprawy Boże; straszny jest w sprawach swoich przy synach ludzkich.
Sentences_to: Come, and see God's deeds-- awesome work on behalf of the children of men.
Translated_sentences: Go, and see the works of God: he is terrible in his works in the presence of the sons of men.

Sentences_from: A teraz znieś proszę grzech mój, a wróć się ze mną, abym się pokłonił Panu.
Sentences_to: Now therefore, please pardon my sin, and turn again with me, that I may worship Yahweh."
Translated_sentences: Now, please bear my sin, and return with me, that I may worship the Lord.

Sentences_from: I kruszyłem szczęki złośnika, a z zębów jego wydzierałem łup.
Sentences_to: I broke the jaws of the unrighteous, and plucked the prey out of his teeth.
Translated_sentences: And I crushed the jaws of the malefactor, and from his teeth I plucked the spoil.

Sentences_from: A ty wstawszy idź do domu twego a gdy wchodzić będziesz do miasta, tedy umrze dziecię.
Sentences_to: Arise therefore, and go to your house. When your feet enter into the city, the child shall die.
Translated_sentences: And thou shalt arise, and go into thine house; and when thou goest into the city, the child shall die.

Sentences_from: I ofiarować będzie Aaron Lewity na ofiarę przed panem od synów Izraelskich, aby sprawowali posługi Pańskie.
Sentences_to: and Aaron shall offer the Levites before Yahweh for a wave offering, on the behalf of the children of Israel, that it may be theirs to do the service of Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: And Aaron the Levite shall offer a sacrifice before the Lord of the children of Israel, that they may Minister unto the Lord.

Sentences_from: Prawda z ziemi wyrośnie, a sprawiedliwość z nieba wyjrzy.
Sentences_to: Yes, Yahweh will give that which is good. Our land will yield its increase.
Translated_sentences: Truth will grow out of the earth, and righteousness will come out of heaven.

Sentences_from: Nauczcież mię, a ja umilknę; a w czemem zbłądził pokażcie mi.
Sentences_to: "Teach me, and I will hold my peace. Cause me to understand wherein I have erred.
Translated_sentences: Teach me, and I will be silent.show me where he has gone astray.

Sentences_from: Z pokolenia Symeonowego Salamijel, syn Surysaddajów.
Sentences_to: Of Simeon: Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai.
Translated_sentences: Of the tribe of Simeon, Salamis the son of surisaddai.

Sentences_from: Z talentu złota szczerego uczynił go, i wszystko naczynie jego.
Sentences_to: He made it of a talent of pure gold, with all its vessels.
Translated_sentences: Of the talent of pure gold he made him, and all his vessels.

Sentences_from: Zatwardź serce ludu tego, a uszy jego obciąż, i oczy jego zawrzyj, aby nie widział oczyma swemi, a uszyma swemi nie słyszał, i sercem swem nie zrozumiał, a nie nawrócił się, i nie był uzdrowion.
Sentences_to: Make the heart of this people fat. Make their ears heavy, and shut their eyes; lest they see with their eyes, and hear with their ears, and understand with their heart, and turn again, and be healed."
Translated_sentences: Harden the heart of this people, and bind their ears, and bind their eyes, lest they see with their eyes, and hear with their ears, and understand with their heart, and be converted, and be healed.

Sentences_from: I nazwała imię jego Józef, mówiąc: Niech mi przyda Pan drugiego syna.
Sentences_to: She named him Joseph, saying, "May Yahweh add another son to me."
Translated_sentences: And she called his name Joseph, saying, the Lord give me another son.

Sentences_from: Synowie Racheli, żony Jakóbowej: Józef i Benjamin.
Sentences_to: The sons of Rachel, Jacob's wife: Joseph and Benjamin.
Translated_sentences: The sons of Rachel, Jacob's wife: Joseph and Benjamin.

Sentences_from: I rzekł Ornan do Dawida: Weźmij je sobie, a niech uczyni król, pan mój, co mu się dobrego widzi; otoć przydaję i woły na całopalenia, i wóz na drwa, i pszenicę na ofiarę śniedną: toć to wszystko daję.
Sentences_to: Ornan said to David, "Take it for yourself, and let my lord the king do that which is good in his eyes. Behold, I give the oxen for burnt offerings, and the threshing instruments for wood, and the wheat for the meal offering. I give it all."
Translated_sentences: And Ornan said unto David, take them unto thee, and let the king my lord do that which seemeth good unto him: and I will give them, and oxen for burnt offerings, and carts for wood, and wheat for a meat offering: all these I will give.

Sentences_from: Kto czyni zamięszanie w domu swoim, odziedziczy wiatr, a głupi musi służyć mądremu.
Sentences_to: He who troubles his own house shall inherit the wind. The foolish shall be servant to the wise of heart.
Translated_sentences: He that maketh confusion in his house shall inherit the wind, and the fool shall serve the wise.

Sentences_from: Ale iż Nadab i Abiju umarli przed obliczem ojca swego, a synów nie mieli: przetoż odprawowali urząd kapłański Eleazar i Itamar.
Sentences_to: But Nadab and Abihu died before their father, and had no children: therefore Eleazar and Ithamar executed the priest's office.
Translated_sentences: But because Nadab and abiju died before their father, and had no sons, Eleazar and Ithamar kept the priesthood.

Sentences_from: Oto póki było całe, nic nie mogło być z niego urobione; dopieroż gdy je ogieó strawił, a spaliło się, na nic się więcej nie przyda.
Sentences_to: Behold, when it was whole, it was meet for no work: how much less, when the fire has devoured it, and it is burned, shall it yet be meet for any work!
Translated_sentences: Behold, as long as it was whole, nothing could be made of it; so long as the fire consumed it, and it was burned, it would be of no more use.

Sentences_from: Pamiętaj co uczynił Pan, Bóg twój, Maryi w drodze, gdyście wyszli z Egiptu.
Sentences_to: When you go forth in camp against your enemies, then you shall keep yourselves from every evil thing.
Translated_sentences: Remember what the LORD your God did to Mary on the way, when you came out of Egypt.

Sentences_from: To gdy usłyszał Elijasz, zakrył oblicze swoje płaszczem swoim, a wyszedłszy stanął we drzwiach jaskini. A oto do niego głos mówiący: Co tu czynisz Elijaszu?
Sentences_to: It was so, when Elijah heard it, that he wrapped his face in his mantle, and went out, and stood in the entrance of the cave. Behold, a voice came to him, and said, "What are you doing here, Elijah?"
Translated_sentences: And it came to pass, when Elijah heard it, that he covered his face with his mantle, and went out, and stood in the door of the cave. Behold, a voice came to him, saying, " what are you doing here, Elijah?"

Sentences_from: Potem rzekli: Nużeż, zbudujmy sobie miasto i wieżą, której by wierzch dosięgał do nieba, a uczyńmy sobie imię; byśmy się snać nie rozproszyli po obliczu wszystkiej ziemi.
Sentences_to: They said, "Come, let's build ourselves a city, and a tower whose top reaches to the sky, and let's make ourselves a name, lest we be scattered abroad on the surface of the whole earth."
Translated_sentences: And they said, let us build ourselves a city, and a tower, that the top may reach into heaven; and let us make a name for ourselves, that we may not be scattered abroad upon the face of all the earth.

Sentences_from: Oto ja według słów twoich odpowiem ci za Boga, chociażem ja też z błota utworzony.
Sentences_to: Behold, I am toward God even as you are. I am also formed out of the clay.
Translated_sentences: Behold, I will answer you for God according to your words, though I also am made of mud.

Sentences_from: Pragnie dusza moja do Boga, do Boga żywego, mówiąc: Kiedyż przyjdę, a okażę się przed obliczem Bożem?
Sentences_to: My tears have been my food day and night, while they continually ask me, "Where is your God?"
Translated_sentences: My soul longs for God, the living God, saying, " When will I come and appear before God?"

Sentences_from: Takby i ciebie wyrwał z miejsca ciasnego na przestronne, gdzie niemasz ucisku, a spokojny stół twój byłby pełen tłustości.
Sentences_to: Yes, he would have allured you out of distress, into a broad place, where there is no restriction. That which is set on your table would be full of fatness.
Translated_sentences: So he would also snatch you from a cramped place to a spacious one, where you have no pressure, and your quiet table would be full of fatness.

Sentences_from: Były też komory i drzwi ich przy podwojach bram, a tam omywano całopalenia.
Sentences_to: A room with its door was by the posts at the gates; there they washed the burnt offering.
Translated_sentences: And there were chambers, and their doors at the door-posts, and there they washed the burnt-offerings.

Sentences_from: Nad to rzekł Mojżesz: Ukaż mi proszę, chwałę twoję.
Sentences_to: He said, "Please show me your glory."
Translated_sentences: And Moses said, show me, I pray thee, thy glory.

Sentences_from: A w koszu najwyższym były wszelakie potrawy Faraonowe, roboty piekarskiej, a ptactwo jadło je z kosza, który był nad głową moją.
Sentences_to: In the uppermost basket there was all kinds of baked food for Pharaoh, and the birds ate them out of the basket on my head."
Translated_sentences: And in the highest basket were all the food of Pharaoh, and the work of baking: and the fowls ate thereof out of the basket that was over my head.

Sentences_from: A wnętrzności jego, i nogi jego, opłucze wodą, i zapali kapłan to wszystko na ołtarzu; całopalenie jest ofiary ognistej ku wdzięcznej wonności Panu.
Sentences_to: but its innards and its legs he shall wash with water. The priest shall burn the whole on the altar, for a burnt offering, an offering made by fire, of a pleasant aroma to Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: And his bowels and his feet shall he wash with water, and the priest shall burn them all on the altar: it is a burnt offering made by fire, for a sweet savour unto the Lord.

Sentences_from: I rzekł Samuel do lud: Pan świadkiem, który uczynił Mojżesza i Aarona, i który wywiódł ojce wasze z ziemi Egipskiej.
Sentences_to: Samuel said to the people, "It is Yahweh who appointed Moses and Aaron, and that brought your fathers up out of the land of Egypt.
Translated_sentences: And Samuel said unto the people, the Lord is the witness that made Moses and Aaron, and that brought up your fathers out of the land of Egypt.

Sentences_from: Rzekł tedy Pan: Krzyk Sodomy i Gomorry, iż się rozmnożył grzech ich, iż bardzo ociężał;
Sentences_to: Yahweh said, "Because the cry of Sodom and Gomorrah is great, and because their sin is very grievous,
Translated_sentences: And the Lord said, The Cry of Sodom and Gomorrah, because their sin was multiplied, because it was greatly oppressed.;

Sentences_from: A jeźliby nie stawało do pięćdziesięciu sprawiedliwych, pięciu, izali wytracisz dla tych pięciu wszystko miasto? I rzekł Pan: Nie wytracę, jeźli tam znajdę czterdziestu i pięciu.
Sentences_to: What if there will lack five of the fifty righteous? Will you destroy all the city for lack of five?" He said, "I will not destroy it, if I find forty-five there."
Translated_sentences: And if there be not fifty righteous, five, will you destroy the whole city for the sake of these five? And the Lord said, I will not destroy it, if I find there forty and five.

Sentences_from: Dokądże trapić będziecie duszę moję, a nacierać na mię mowami swemi?
Sentences_to: "How long will you torment me, and crush me with words?
Translated_sentences: Where then shall ye afflict my soul, and press upon me with your words?

Sentences_from: Alem Ja jest Panem, Bogiem twoim, od wyjścia z ziemi Egipskiej; jeszczeć dopuszczę mieszkać w namiotach, jako za dni uroczystych świąt;
Sentences_to: They will walk after Yahweh, who will roar like a lion; for he will roar, and the children will come trembling from the west.
Translated_sentences: But I am The Lord thy God, since I came out of the land of Egypt: I will let me dwell in Tabernacles, as in the days of solemn feasts.;

Sentences_from: A usłyszawszy Finees kapłan, i książęta zgromadzenia, i przełożeni nad tysiącmi Izraelskimi, którzy z nim byli, słowa, które mówili synowie Rubenowi, i synowie Gadowi, i synowie Manasesowi, podobało się im to.
Sentences_to: When Phinehas the priest, and the princes of the congregation, even the heads of the thousands of Israel that were with him, heard the words that the children of Reuben and the children of Gad and the children of Manasseh spoke, it pleased them well.
Translated_sentences: And when Phinehas the priest, and the princes of the congregation, and the rulers of the thousands of Israel that were with him, heard the words which the children of Reuben, and the children of Gad, and the children of Manasseh, had spoken, it pleased them.

Sentences_from: Uczynił też siedem lamp do niego, i nożyczki do nich i kaganki jego ze złota szczerego.
Sentences_to: He made its seven lamps, and its snuffers, and its snuff dishes, of pure gold.
Translated_sentences: And he made seven lamps for it, and its scissors, and its bows, of pure gold.

Sentences_from: Przetoż teraz rozdziel tę ziemię w dziedzictwo, dziewięciorgu pokoleniu, i połowie pokolenia Manasesowego.
Sentences_to: Now therefore divide this land for an inheritance to the nine tribes and the half-tribe of Manasseh."
Translated_sentences: Now therefore divide this land into an inheritance, nine generations, and half the generation of Manasseh.

Sentences_from: Ułamuj łaknącemu chleba twego, a ubogich wygnańców wprowadź do domu twego; ujrzyszli nagiego, przyodziej go, a przed ciałem swojem nie ukrywaj się.
Sentences_to: Isn't it to distribute your bread to the hungry, and that you bring the poor who are cast out to your house? When you see the naked, that you cover him; and that you not hide yourself from your own flesh?
Translated_sentences: Break your bread to the hungry, and bring the poor exiles into your house.if they see him naked, clothe him, and do not hide yourself from your flesh.

Sentences_from: Powiedz synom Izraelskim, a mów do nich: Gdy wnijdziecie do ziemi, którą Ja wam daję, tedy święcić będzie ziemia sabat Panu.
Sentences_to: "Command the children of Israel, that they bring to you pure olive oil beaten for the light, to cause a lamp to burn continually.
Translated_sentences: Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, when ye come into the land which I give you, then shall the land sanctify the Sabbath unto the Lord.

Sentences_from: A dnia ósmego zacne święto mieć będziecie; żadnej roboty służebniczej nie będziecie czynić.
Sentences_to: "'On the eighth day you shall have a solemn assembly: you shall do no servile work;
Translated_sentences: And on the eighth day ye shall have a solemn feast: ye shall do no servile work.

Sentences_from: Prędko tedy każdy złożył wór swój na ziemię; i rozwiązali każdy wór swój.
Sentences_to: Then they hurried, and each man took his sack down to the ground, and each man opened his sack.
Translated_sentences: And quickly every man laid down his sack upon the earth; and they dissolved every sack.

Sentences_from: Mówią słowa, przysięgając kłamliwie, gdy czynią przymierze; i wzrośnie sąd jako jad na zagonach polnych.
Sentences_to: They won't pour out wine offerings to Yahweh, neither will they be pleasing to him. Their sacrifices will be to them like the bread of mourners; all who eat of it will be polluted; for their bread will be for their appetite. It will not come into the house of Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: They speak words, swearing falsely, when they make a covenant; and judgment shall grow as food in the folds of the field.

Sentences_from: Ukazali się tedy obaj straży Filistyńskiej. I rzekli Filistynowie: Onoż Hebrejczycy wychodzą z jaskini, w której się byli pokryli.
Sentences_to: Both of them revealed themselves to the garrison of the Philistines: and the Philistines said, "Behold, the Hebrews are coming out of the holes where they had hidden themselves!"
Translated_sentences: And the two watchmen of the Philistines appeared. The Philistines said, " the Hebrew is coming out of the cave where they hid themselves."

Sentences_from: (Przedniejszemu śpiewakowi pieśó Dawida, sługi Pańskiego.)
Sentences_to: < < For the Chief Musician. By David, the servant of Yahweh. > > An oracle is within my heart about the disobedience of the wicked: "There is no fear of God before his eyes."
Translated_sentences: (To the chief singer of the song of David, the servant of the Lord.)

Sentences_from: Albowiem małżonkiem twoim jest stworzycie twój, Pan zastępów imię jego, a odkupiciel twój, Święty Izraelski, Bogiem wszystkiej ziemi zwany będzie.
Sentences_to: For your Maker is your husband; Yahweh of Armies is his name: and the Holy One of Israel is your Redeemer; the God of the whole earth shall he be called.
Translated_sentences: For your spouse is your creation; the Lord of hosts is his name; and your redeemer, the holy one of Israel, shall be called the god of all the earth.

Sentences_from: Synów Jahala, synów Darkona, synów Giddela,
Sentences_to: the children of Jaalah, the children of Darkon, the children of Giddel,
Translated_sentences: The children of Jahal, the children of Darkon, the children of Giddel,

Sentences_from: Jako ocet zębom, i jako dym oczom, tak jest leniwy tym, którzy go posyłają.
Sentences_to: As vinegar to the teeth, and as smoke to the eyes, so is the sluggard to those who send him.
Translated_sentences: As vinegar to the teeth, and as smoke to the eyes, so is he slothful to those who send him.

Sentences_from: Cóż mam czynić z tobą, o Efraimie? cóż mam czynić z tobą, o Judo? gdyż miłosierdzie wasze jest jako obłok poranny a jako rosa rano przemijająca.
Sentences_to: Their deeds won't allow them to turn to their God; for the spirit of prostitution is within them, and they don't know Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: What am I to do with you, Ephraim? what am I to do with you, judo? for your mercy is as the morning cloud, and as the morning dew.

Sentences_from: Niewiasty spokojne! powstańcie, słuchajcie głosu mego; córki bezpieczne! bierzcie w uszy swe powieści moje.
Sentences_to: Rise up, you women who are at ease! Hear my voice! You careless daughters, give ear to my speech!
Translated_sentences: Women calm down! arise, listen to my voice; daughters safe! take my novels to your ears.

Sentences_from: A sykiel niech ma dwadzieścia pieniędzy a dwadzieścia syklów, dwadzieścia pięć syklów, a piętnaście syklów grzywną wam będzie.
Sentences_to: The shekel shall be twenty gerahs. Twenty shekels plus twenty-five shekels plus fifteen shekels shall be your mina.
Translated_sentences: And the money shall be twenty shekels, and twenty shekels, and twenty-five shekels, and fifteen shekels shall be your fine.

Sentences_from: Mądrością twoją i roztropnością twoją nazbierałeś sobie bogactw, i nabyłeś złota i srebra do skarbów toich;
Sentences_to: by your wisdom and by your understanding you have gotten yourself riches, and have gotten gold and silver into your treasures;
Translated_sentences: By thy wisdom and thy wisdom hast thou gathered unto thyself riches, and hast purchased gold and silver for these treasures;

Sentences_from: Ale oto, dobra ich nie są w rękach ich; przetoż rada niepobożnych daleka jest odemnie.
Sentences_to: Behold, their prosperity is not in their hand. The counsel of the wicked is far from me.
Translated_sentences: Behold, their goods are not in their hands; therefore the counsel of the wicked is far from me.

Sentences_from: Tedy przyszedł Achab do domu swego smutny i zagniewany dla słowa, które mu rzekł Nabot Jezreelita, mówiąc: Nie dam ci dziedzictwa ojców moich; i układł się na łożu swem, a odwrócił twarz swoję, i nie jadł chleba.
Sentences_to: Ahab came into his house sullen and angry because of the word which Naboth the Jezreelite had spoken to him; for he had said, "I will not give you the inheritance of my fathers." He laid himself down on his bed, and turned away his face, and would eat no bread.
Translated_sentences: Ahab came to his house sorrowful and angry because of the word which Naboth the Jezreelite had spoken to him, saying, "I will not give you the inheritance of my fathers." he lay down on his bed, and turned his face away, and did not eat bread.

Sentences_from: Spojrzyjcie na Abrahama, ojca waszego, i na Sarę, która was porodziła, żem go jednego wezwał, i pobłogosławiłem mu, a rozmnożyłem go.
Sentences_to: Look to Abraham your father, and to Sarah who bore you; for when he was but one I called him, and I blessed him, and made him many.
Translated_sentences: Look at Abraham your father, and at Sarah, who bore you, because I called him alone, and blessed him, and made him fruitful.

Sentences_from: Ocuć się, ocuć się, oblecz się w siłę, o ramię Pańskie! Ocuć się jako za dni dawnych, i za rodzajów przeszłych! Izaliś nie ty jest, któreś zgładziło Egipt, i zraniło smoka?
Sentences_to: Awake, awake, put on strength, arm of Yahweh; awake, as in the days of old, the generations of ancient times. Isn't it you who cut Rahab in pieces, who pierced the monster?
Translated_sentences: Wake up, wake up, put on your strength, o arm of the Lord! Wake up as in the days of yore, and in the generations of yore! Is it not you who destroyed Egypt and wounded the dragon?

Sentences_from: Wyszli też synowie Benjaminowi przeciwko ludowi, o odsadziwszy się od miasta, poczęli bić lud i siec, jako pierwszy i wtóry raz po drogach, (z których jedna szła do Betel, a druga do Gabaa,)i po polu, a zabili około trzydziestu mężów z Izraela.
Sentences_to: The children of Benjamin went out against the people, and were drawn away from the city; and they began to strike and kill of the people, as at other times, in the highways, of which one goes up to Bethel, and the other to Gibeah, in the field, about thirty men of Israel.
Translated_sentences: And the children of Benjamin went out against the people, and departed from the city, and smote the people and the net the first and the second time by the highways, one going to Bethel, and the other to Gibeah, and by the field: and they slew about thirty men of Israel.

Sentences_from: A wziąwszy ojca waszego, i czeladź waszę, przyjedźcie do mnie; i dam wam dobre miejsce w ziemi Egipskiej, i będziecie używać tłustości ziemi.
Sentences_to: Take your father and your households, and come to me, and I will give you the good of the land of Egypt, and you will eat the fat of the land.'
Translated_sentences: And take your father, and watch over you, and come unto me, and I will give you a good place in the land of Egypt, and ye shall use the fatness of the land.

Sentences_from: Biada tym, którzy żądają dnia Pańskiego! cóż wam po tym dniu Pańskim, ponieważ jest ciemnością, a nie światłością?
Sentences_to: "Woe to you who desire the day of Yahweh! Why do you long for the day of Yahweh? It is darkness, and not light.
Translated_sentences: Woe to those who demand the day of the Lord! what will you have after this day of the Lord, because it is darkness and not light?

Sentences_from: A w pokoleniu Isascharowem Kades i przedmieścia jego, Daberet i przedmieścia jego.
Sentences_to: To the sons of Aaron they gave the cities of refuge, Hebron; Libnah also with its suburbs, and Jattir, and Eshtemoa with its suburbs,
Translated_sentences: And in the tribe of Issachar, Kadesh with its suburbs, and dabereth with its suburbs.

Sentences_from: Trzy kroć do roku ukaże się każdy mężczyzna twój przed obliczem Panującego Pana, Boga Izraelskiego.
Sentences_to: Three times in the year all your males shall appear before the Lord Yahweh, the God of Israel.
Translated_sentences: Three times a year shall every man of thee appear before the Lord God of Israel.

Sentences_from: I mówił tak Mojżesz do synów Izraelskich, ale nie usłuchali Mojżesza dla ściśnionego ducha, i dla niewoli ciężkiej.
Sentences_to: Moses spoke so to the children of Israel, but they didn't listen to Moses for anguish of spirit, and for cruel bondage.
Translated_sentences: And Moses spake thus unto the children of Israel: but they hearkened not unto Moses, because of the spirit that was oppressed, and because of the bondage that was grievous.

Sentences_from: Pieśó stopni. Błogosławiony wszelki, który się boi Pana, który chodzi drogami jego.
Sentences_to: < < A Song of Ascents. > > Blessed is everyone who fears Yahweh, who walks in his ways.
Translated_sentences: The song of degrees. Blessed is everyone who fears the Lord, who walks in his ways.

Sentences_from: Nadto rzekł: Daj płachtę, którą masz na sobie, a trzymaj ją; a gdy ją trzymała, namierzył jej sześć miarek jęczmienia, i założył na nię, i weszła do miasta.
Sentences_to: He said, "Bring the mantle that is on you, and hold it." She held it; and he measured six measures of barley, and laid it on her; and he went into the city.
Translated_sentences: And he said, give the mantle which thou hast on thee, and hold it.and as she held it, he measured her six measures of barley, and put them upon her, and she went into the city.

Sentences_from: Tak zaiste mówi Pan: Ciężkie bardzo będzie skruszenie twoje, nader bolesna rana twoja.
Sentences_to: For thus says Yahweh, Your hurt is incurable, and your wound grievous.
Translated_sentences: For Thus saith the LORD, thy repentance shall be very grievous, and thy hurt exceedingly grievous.

Sentences_from: Przetoż pytali się znowu Pana: Przyjdzieli jeszcze sam ten mąż? I odpowiedział Pan: Oto się skrył między sprzętem.
Sentences_to: Therefore they asked of Yahweh further, "Is there yet a man to come here?" Yahweh answered, "Behold, he has hidden himself among the baggage."
Translated_sentences: Wherefore they asked the Lord again, did this same man come again? And the Lord said, lo, he hid himself among the furniture.

Sentences_from: Nadto i cudzoziemiec, który nie jest z ludu twego Izraelskiego, przyjdzieli z ziemi dalekiej dla imienia twego;
Sentences_to: "Moreover concerning the foreigner, who is not of your people Israel, when he shall come out of a far country for your name's sake
Translated_sentences: Moreover, and a stranger, which is not of Thy People Israel, have come out of a far land for thy name's sake.;

Sentences_from: I odstąpili od namiotu Korego, Datana i Abirona zewsząd. Ale Datan i Abiron wyszedłszy stali u drzwi namiotów swoich, i żony ich, i synowie ich, i maluczcy ich.
Sentences_to: So they went away from the tent of Korah, Dathan, and Abiram, on every side: and Dathan and Abiram came out, and stood at the door of their tents, and their wives, and their sons, and their little ones.
Translated_sentences: And they departed from the tent of Korah, and of Dathan, and of abiron on every side. But Dathan and abiron went out, and stood at the door of their tents, and their wives, and their sons, and their little ones.

Sentences_from: I rzekli mu: Przyszliśmy, abyśmy cię związali, i wydali w ręce Filistynów; którym odpowiedział Samson: Przysiężcie mi, że się na mię sami nie targniecie.
Sentences_to: They said to him, "We have come down to bind you, that we may deliver you into the hand of the Philistines." Samson said to them, "Swear to me that you will not fall on me yourselves."
Translated_sentences: And they said unto him, we are come to bind thee, and deliver thee into the hand of the Philistines: and Samson said unto them, swear unto me, that ye shall not strive against me.

Sentences_from: A tak Balak dał nabić wołów i owiec, i posłał do Balaama, i do książąt, którzy z nim byli.
Sentences_to: Balak sacrificed cattle and sheep, and sent to Balaam, and to the princes who were with him.
Translated_sentences: Balak killed oxen and sheep, and sent to Balaam, and to the princes who were with him.

Sentences_from: A oni odpowiedzieli: Zdrówci sługa twój, ojciec nasz, jeszczeć żyw. A schyliwszy się, pokłonili mu się.
Sentences_to: They said, "Your servant, our father, is well. He is still alive." They bowed down humbly.
Translated_sentences: And they said, thy servant our father is well, yet alive.and they bowed themselves down, and worshipped him.

Sentences_from: Rzekł potem Gad prorok do Dawida: Nie mieszkaj więcej na tym zamku; idź, a wróć się do ziemi Judzkiej. Tedy poszedł Dawid, a przyszedł do lasu Haret.
Sentences_to: David answered the priest, and said to him, "Truly, women have been kept from us about these three days. When I came out, the vessels of the young men were holy, though it was but a common journey. How much more then today shall their vessels be holy?"
Translated_sentences: And Gad the prophet said unto David, dwell no more in this castle: go, and return to the land of Judah. So David went, and came into the forest of Hareth.

Sentences_from: Sprawiedliwość wywyższa naród; ale grzech jest ku pohaóbieniu narodów.
Sentences_to: Righteousness exalts a nation, but sin is a disgrace to any people.
Translated_sentences: Righteousness exalts the nation; but sin is to the shame of the nations.

Sentences_from: Która rzekła do nich: Tak mówi Pan, Bóg Izraelski. Powiedzcie mężowi, który was posłał do mnie;
Sentences_to: because they have done that which is evil in my sight, and have provoked me to anger, since the day their fathers came forth out of Egypt, even to this day.'"
Translated_sentences: And she said unto them, Thus saith the Lord God of Israel. Tell the husband who sent you to me;

Sentences_from: I umarł w starości dobrej, pełen dni, bogactw i sławy: a królował Salomon, syn jego, miasto niego.
Sentences_to: He died in a good old age, full of days, riches, and honor: and Solomon his son reigned in his place.
Translated_sentences: And he died in a good old age, full of days, riches, and glory: and Solomon his son reigned in his stead.

Sentences_from: Gdzież jest ta droga do miejsca światłości? a ciemności gdzie mają miejsce swoje?
Sentences_to: "What is the way to the dwelling of light? As for darkness, where is its place,
Translated_sentences: Where is this road to the place of light? and the darkness where do they belong?

Sentences_from: I rzekł Dawid do Pana, gdy ujrzał Anioła bijącego lud, mówiąc: Otom ja zgrzeszył, jam źle uczynił; ale te owce cóż uczyniły? niech się proszę obróci ręka twoja na mię i na dom ojca mego.
Sentences_to: David spoke to Yahweh when he saw the angel who struck the people, and said, "Behold, I have sinned, and I have done perversely; but these sheep, what have they done? Please let your hand be against me, and against my father's house."
Translated_sentences: And David spake unto the Lord, when he saw the angel smiting the people, saying, Behold, I have sinned, and I have done evil: but what have these sheep done? I pray thee, turn thine hand upon me, and upon my father's house.

Sentences_from: Nie będziesz mógł ofiarować ofiary święta przejścia w któremkolwiek mieście twojem, z onych, które Pan, Bóg twój, dawa tobie.
Sentences_to: if only you diligently listen to the voice of Yahweh your God, to observe to do all this commandment which I command you this day.
Translated_sentences: You shall not be able to offer the holy sacrifice of the Passover in any of your cities, which the LORD your God gives you.

Sentences_from: Błogosławiony Pan! bo dziwnie okazał miłosierdzie swoje przeciwko mnie, jakoby w mieście obronnem.
Sentences_to: As for me, I said in my haste, "I am cut off from before your eyes." Nevertheless you heard the voice of my petitions when I cried to you.
Translated_sentences: Blessed Be The Lord! because he strangely showed his mercy against me, as if in a defensive city.

Sentences_from: I przyniesie ją do synów Aaronowych, kapłanów, a weźmie stąd pełną garść swoję tej pszennej mąki, i tej oliwy, ze wszystkiem kadzidłem; i zapali to kapłan na pamiątkę jej na ołtarzu; ofiara ognista jest ku wdzięcznej wonności Panu;
Sentences_to: He shall bring it to Aaron's sons, the priests; and he shall take his handful of its fine flour, and of its oil, with all its frankincense; and the priest shall burn its memorial on the altar, an offering made by fire, of a pleasant aroma to Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: And he shall bring it unto the Sons of Aaron the priests, and shall take thence his handful of this fine flour, and of this oil, with all the frankincense: and the priest shall burn it for a memorial thereof upon the altar: the offering of the fire shall be for a sweet savour unto the Lord.;

Sentences_from: Ajalon i przedmieścia jego; Gatrymon i przedmieścia jego; miasta cztery.
Sentences_to: Aijalon with its suburbs, Gath Rimmon with its suburbs; four cities.
Translated_sentences: Ajalon with its suburbs; Gath-Rimon with its suburbs; four cities.

Sentences_from: Niech zaniemieją wargi kłamliwe, które mówią przeciwko sprawiedliwemu rzeczy przykre z hardością i ze wzgardą.
Sentences_to: Oh how great is your goodness, which you have laid up for those who fear you, which you have worked for those who take refuge in you, before the sons of men!
Translated_sentences: Let them lift up their lying lips, which speak against the righteous with harshness and with contempt.

Sentences_from: Wszakże Bóg nasz jest na niebie, czyniąc wszystko, co mu się podoba.
Sentences_to: But our God is in the heavens. He does whatever he pleases.
Translated_sentences: After all, our God is in heaven, doing whatever pleases him.

Sentences_from: Kozła też jednego z stada za grzech ofiarować będziecie Panu oprócz ustawicznego całopalenia, i mokrej ofiary jego.
Sentences_to: One male goat for a sin offering to Yahweh; it shall be offered besides the continual burnt offering, and the drink offering of it.
Translated_sentences: And one of the goats of the flock shall ye offer unto the Lord for sin, beside the continual burnt offering, and the continual offering thereof.

Sentences_from: I nie będzie ktoby uszedł i został z ostatków Judzkich, którzy weszli do ziemi Egipskiej, aby tam pielgrzymowali, aby się zaś wrócić mieli do ziemi Judzkiej, do której się oni pragną wrócić, i mieszkać tam; ale się nie wrócą, tylko ci, którzy ujdą.
Sentences_to: so that none of the remnant of Judah, who have gone into the land of Egypt to live there, shall escape or be left, to return into the land of Judah, to which they have a desire to return to dwell there: for none shall return save such as shall escape.
Translated_sentences: And there shall be none left of the remnant of Judah that went into the land of Egypt to go there, to return to the land of Judah, whither they would return, and to dwell there: but they shall not return, but they that go away.

Sentences_from: Książęta ludu mego są dziećmi, a niewiasty panują nad nimi. O ludu mój! ci, którzy cię wodzą, zwodzą cię, a drogę ścieżek twoich ukrywają.
Sentences_to: As for my people, children are their oppressors, and women rule over them. My people, those who lead you cause you to err, and destroy the way of your paths.
Translated_sentences: The princes of my people are children, and women rule over them. O my people! those who lead you deceive you, and hide the way of your ways.

Sentences_from: Zatem padł na szyję Benjamina, brata swego, i płakał; Benjamin też płakał na szyi jego.
Sentences_to: He fell on his brother Benjamin's neck, and wept, and Benjamin wept on his neck.
Translated_sentences: And he fell upon the neck of his brother Benjamin, and wept; and Benjamin wept upon his neck.

Sentences_from: Wysłuchajże głos próśb moich, gdy wołam do ciebie, gdy podnoszę ręce moje do świątnicy świętej twojej.
Sentences_to: Hear the voice of my petitions, when I cry to you, when I lift up my hands toward your Most Holy Place.
Translated_sentences: Hearken unto the voice of my supplications, when I cry unto thee, when I lift up my hands unto thy holy sanctuary.

Sentences_from: I stało się niektórego dnia, gdy przyszli synowie Boży, aby stanęli przed Panem, przyszedł też szatan między nich, aby stanął przed Panem.
Sentences_to: Again it happened on the day when the God's sons came to present themselves before Yahweh, that Satan came also among them to present himself before Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: And it came to pass on a certain day, when the sons of God came to stand before the Lord, that Satan also came among them to stand before the Lord.

Sentences_from: A widząc Dawid, że słudzy jego szeptali z sobą, porozumiał Dawid, iż umarło dziecię. I rzekł Dawid do sług swoich: Albo umarło dziecię? A oni odpowiedzieli: Umarło.
Sentences_to: But when David saw that his servants were whispering together, David perceived that the child was dead; and David said to his servants, "Is the child dead?" They said, "He is dead."
Translated_sentences: And when David saw that his servants were whispering among themselves, David understood that the child was dead. And David said unto his servants, is the child dead? And they said, it is dead.

Sentences_from: Usłyszał Pan prośbę moję; Pan modlitwę moję przyjął.
Sentences_to: May all my enemies be ashamed and dismayed. They shall turn back, they shall be disgraced suddenly.
Translated_sentences: The Lord has heard my request; the Lord has accepted my prayer.

Sentences_from: Tedy posłał Hyram, król Tyrski, posły do Dawida, i drzewa cedrowe, i cieśle, i kamienniki, i murarze, którzy zbudowali dom Dawidowi.
Sentences_to: Hiram king of Tyre sent messengers to David, and cedar trees, and carpenters, and masons; and they built David a house.
Translated_sentences: And Hyram king of Tyre sent messengers unto David, and cedars, and carpenters, and masons, and masons, which built David's house.

Sentences_from: Hardość twoja zdradzi cię, i pycha serca twego, ty, który mieszkasz w rozsiadlinach skalnych, który się trzymasz wysokich pogórków; byś też wywyższył jako orzeł gniazdo swoje, i stamtąd cię stargnę, mówi Pan.
Sentences_to: As for your terror, the pride of your heart has deceived you, O you who dwell in the clefts of the rock, who hold the height of the hill: though you should make your nest as high as the eagle, I will bring you down from there, says Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: Your hardness will betray you, and the pride of your heart, you who dwell in the clefts of the rocks, you who cling to the high hills, so that you may exalt your nest like an eagle, and I will drive you away from there, says the Lord.

Sentences_from: Jakoż sam znosić mam ciężką pracę około was, i brzemię wasze, i swary wasze?
Sentences_to: How can I myself alone bear your encumbrance, and your burden, and your strife?
Translated_sentences: How can I bear the hard work around you, and your burdens, and your swarms?

Sentences_from: Tak mówi Pan: Jeźli mogą być rozmierzone niebiosa z góry, a doścignione grunty ziemi na dole, tedyć i Ja cale odrzucę nasienie Izraelskie dla tego wszystkiego, co uczynili, mówi Pan.
Sentences_to: Thus says Yahweh: If heaven above can be measured, and the foundations of the earth searched out beneath, then will I also cast off all the seed of Israel for all that they have done, says Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: Thus saith the Lord; if the heavens be measured from above, and the precious land of the earth beneath, then will I utterly reject the seed of Israel for all that they have done, saith the Lord.

Sentences_from: Oto Pan, Pan zastępów, okrzesze wszystkę siłę latorośli, a te, którzy są wysokiego wzrostu, podetnie; i będą wysocy poniżeni.
Sentences_to: Behold, the Lord, Yahweh of Armies, will lop the boughs with terror. The tall will be cut down, and the lofty will be brought low.
Translated_sentences: Behold, the Lord, the Lord of hosts, will circumcise all the strength of the trees, and those who are of high stature will cut them down, and they will be highly humbled.

Sentences_from: Przetoż wyrzucili synowie Izraelscy Baala i Astarota, a służyli Panu samemu.
Sentences_to: Then the children of Israel removed the Baals and the Ashtaroth, and served Yahweh only.
Translated_sentences: Therefore the children of Israel cast out Baal and Ashtaroth, and served the Lord himself.

Sentences_from: Spuść na Pana drogę twoję, a ufaj w nim, a on wszystko uczyni;
Sentences_to: Commit your way to Yahweh. Trust also in him, and he will do this:
Translated_sentences: Let your way fall upon the Lord, and trust in him, and he will do all things.;

Sentences_from: Przetoż najgorszych z pogan przywiodę, aby posiedli domy ich; i uczynię wstręt pysze mocarzów, a splugawieni będą, którzy je poświęcają.
Sentences_to: Therefore I will bring the worst of the nations, and they shall possess their houses: I will also make the pride of the strong to cease; and their holy places shall be profaned.
Translated_sentences: Therefore will I bring the worst of the heathen to possess their houses; and I will abhor the pride of the mighty, and they that sacrifice them shall be polluted.

Sentences_from: A Salmon spłodził Booza, a Booz spłodził Obeda;
Sentences_to: and Salmon became the father of Boaz, and Boaz became the father of Obed,
Translated_sentences: And Salmon begat Booz, and Booz begat Obed;

Sentences_from: A do Lewiego rzekł: Tummim twoje, i Urim twoje było przy mężu świętym twoim, któregoś kusił w Massa, i z którymeś miał spór u wód Meryba.
Sentences_to: Of Levi he said, "Your Thummim and your Urim are with your godly one, whom you proved at Massah, with whom you strove at the waters of Meribah;
Translated_sentences: And he said unto Levi, thy tummim and thy Urim were with thy holy man, whom thou didst tempt at Massah, and with whom thou didst dispute at the waters of Meribah.

Sentences_from: Jam jest mur, a piersi moje jako wieże. Wtenczas byłam przed oczyma jego, jako ta, która znajduje pokój.
Sentences_to: I am my beloved's. His desire is toward me.
Translated_sentences: I am a wall, and my breasts are like towers. Then I was before his eyes, as one who finds peace.

Sentences_from: Teć są ustawy i sądy i prawa, które postanowił Pan między sobą, i między syny Izraelskimi na górze Synaj przez Mojżesza.
Sentences_to: You may make them an inheritance for your children after you, to hold for a possession; of them may you take your slaves forever: but over your brothers the children of Israel you shall not rule, one over another, with harshness.
Translated_sentences: These are the statutes, and the judgments, and the laws, which the LORD hath determined between himself and the children of Israel in Mount Sinai by Moses.

Sentences_from: Tedy na Azaryjasza, syna Obedowego, przypadł Duch Boży.
Sentences_to: So Abijah slept with his fathers, and they buried him in the city of David; and Asa his son reigned in his place. In his days the land was quiet ten years.
Translated_sentences: And the spirit of God fell upon Azariah the son of Obed.

Sentences_from: Aby tam uciekł mężobójca, coby zabił człowieka nie chcąc, z niewiadomości; i będą wam dla ucieczki przed tym, któryby się krwi chciał mścić.
Sentences_to: that the manslayer who kills any person accidentally or unintentionally may flee there. They shall be to you for a refuge from the avenger of blood.
Translated_sentences: That the murderer may flee thither, that he may kill a man unwillingly, out of ignorance: and they shall be unto you for a refuge from him that would be avenged by blood.

Sentences_from: Tedy posłał król Jerycha do Rachaby, mówiąc: Wywiedź męże, którzy przyszli do ciebie, a weszli do domu twego; bo na przeszpiegowanie wszystkiej ziemi przyszli.
Sentences_to: The king of Jericho sent to Rahab, saying, "Bring out the men who have come to you, who have entered into your house; for they have come to spy out all the land."
Translated_sentences: And the king of Jericho sent unto Rahab, saying, bring forth the men that came unto thee, and are come into thine house: for they are come to search all the land.

Sentences_from: Przetoż słuchajcie słowa Pańskiego wy wszyscy pojmani, którychem wysłał z Jeruzalemu do Babilonu.
Sentences_to: Hear therefore the word of Yahweh, all you of the captivity, whom I have sent away from Jerusalem to Babylon.
Translated_sentences: Hear ye therefore the word of the LORD, all ye that are taken captive, whom I have sent from Jerusalem to Babylon.

Sentences_from: I podał im ziemię pogan, a posiedli prace narodów.
Sentences_to: He gave them the lands of the nations. They took the labor of the peoples in possession,
Translated_sentences: And he gave them the land of the gentiles, and they possessed the works of the nations.

Sentences_from: I rzekł Pan do mnie: Fałsz prorokują ci prorocy w imieniu mojem; nie posłałem ich, anim im rozkazał, owszem, anim mówił do nich; widzenie kłamliwe, i wieszczbę, i marność, i kłamstwo serca swego oni wam prorokują.
Sentences_to: Then Yahweh said to me, The prophets prophesy lies in my name; I didn't send them, neither have I commanded them, neither spoke I to them: they prophesy to you a lying vision, and divination, and a thing of nothing, and the deceit of their own heart.
Translated_sentences: And the Lord said unto me, the prophets prophesy falsehood unto thee in my name: I have not sent them, neither have I commanded them; yea, neither have I spoken unto them: they prophesy unto you a lying vision, and tidings, and vanity, and falsehood of their heart.

Sentences_from: A jeźliby nie chcieli wziąć kubka z ręki twojej, aby pili, tedy rzeczesz do nich: Tak mówi Pan zastępów: Koniecznie pić musicie.
Sentences_to: It shall be, if they refuse to take the cup at your hand to drink, then you shall tell them, Thus says Yahweh of Armies: You shall surely drink.
Translated_sentences: And if they will not take the cup out of thine hand to drink, then say thou unto them, Thus saith the Lord of hosts, ye must drink.

Sentences_from: Po nim wzruszony gorliwością poprawiał Baruch, syn Zabbajowy, części drugiej od Mikzoa aż do drzwi domu Elijasyba, najwyższego kapłana.
Sentences_to: After him, Baruch the son of Zabbai earnestly repaired another portion, from the turning of the wall to the door of the house of Eliashib the high priest.
Translated_sentences: After him Baruch the son of zabbai, moved with zeal, repaired the second part from miczoa to the door of the house of eliasib the high priest.

Sentences_from: I rzekł: Jam jest sługa Abrahamów;
Sentences_to: He said, "I am Abraham's servant.
Translated_sentences: And he said, I am Abraham's servant;

Sentences_from: Ale rzekł Pan do Dawida, ojca mego: Aczkolwiekeś postanowił w sercu twem, zbudować dom imieniowi memu, i dobrześ uczynił, żeś to umyślił w sercu twojem.
Sentences_to: But Yahweh said to David my father, 'Whereas it was in your heart to build a house for my name, you did well that it was in your heart.
Translated_sentences: But the Lord said unto David my father, though thou hast purposed in thine heart to build an house for my name, thou hast done well that thou hast purposed it in thine heart.

Sentences_from: A Neer spłodził Cysa, a Cys spłodził Saula, a Saul spłodził Jonatana, i Melchisuego, i Abidanaba, i Esbaala.
Sentences_to: Ner became the father of Kish; and Kish became the father of Saul; and Saul became the father of Jonathan, and Malchishua, and Abinadab, and Eshbaal.
Translated_sentences: And Neer begat shish, and shish begat Saul, and Saul begat Jonathan, and melchisui, and abidanab, and esbaal.

Sentences_from: Onci obróci na nich nieprawość ich, a dla złości ich wytraci ich; wytraci ich Pan, Bóg nasz.
Sentences_to: He has brought on them their own iniquity, and will cut them off in their own wickedness. Yahweh, our God, will cut them off.
Translated_sentences: He will turn their iniquity upon them, and will destroy them for their wickedness: the Lord our God will destroy them.

Sentences_from: A widząc, żeście mię wybawić nie chcieli, odważyłem zdrowie swoje, i ciągnąłem przeciw synom Ammonowym, a podał je Pan w ręce moje, i przeczżeście przyszli do mnie dnia tego, abyście walczyli przeciwko mnie?
Sentences_to: When I saw that you didn't save me, I put my life in my hand, and passed over against the children of Ammon, and Yahweh delivered them into my hand. Why then have you come up to me this day, to fight against me?"
Translated_sentences: And when I saw that ye would not deliver me, I weighed my health, and went against the children of Ammon, and the LORD delivered them into mine hand, and why come ye unto me this day, that ye should fight against me?

Sentences_from: A synów ich rozmnożyłeś jako gwiazdy niebieskie, i wwiodłeś ich do ziemi, o którejś mawiał ojcom ich, że wnijdą i posiędą ją.
Sentences_to: You also multiplied their children as the stars of the sky, and brought them into the land concerning which you said to their fathers, that they should go in to possess it.
Translated_sentences: And thou hast multiplied their children as the stars of heaven, and hast brought them into the land which thou hast told their fathers, that they should come in and possess it.

Sentences_from: Bo Judas był najmężniejsz między braćmi swymi, a książęciem między nimi; ale pierworodztwo należało Józefowi.)
Sentences_to: For Judah prevailed above his brothers, and of him came the prince; but the birthright was Joseph's:)
Translated_sentences: For Judas was the mightiest among his brethren, and the prince among them: but the birthright was Joseph's.)

Sentences_from: Ten chował Hadassę, którą też zwano Ester, córkę stryja swego, przeto, iż nie miała ojca, ani matki; a była panienka pięknej urody, i wdzięcznej twarzy, którą Mardocheusz po śmierci ojca jej i matki jej za córkę przyjął.
Sentences_to: He brought up Hadassah, that is, Esther, his uncle's daughter; for she had neither father nor mother. The maiden was fair and beautiful; and when her father and mother were dead, Mordecai took her for his own daughter.
Translated_sentences: He hid Hadassah, who was also called Esther, the daughter of his uncle, because she had neither father nor mother; and she was a lady of beautiful beauty and grateful countenance, whom Mordecai, after the death of her father and her mother, took as his daughter.

Sentences_from: Tedy rzekł Jeremijasz: Stało się słowo Pańskie do mnie, mówiąc:
Sentences_to: Jeremiah said, The word of Yahweh came to me, saying,
Translated_sentences: And Jeremiah said, the word of the Lord is Come unto me, saying,:

Sentences_from: Oto Ja wzbudzę ich z tego miejsca, na któreście ich zaprzedali, a obrócę nagrodę waszę na głowę waszę;
Sentences_to: Behold, I will stir them up out of the place where you have sold them, and will return your repayment on your own head;
Translated_sentences: Behold, I will raise them up from the place where you sold them, and I will turn your reward on your head.;

Sentences_from: Pieśó stopni. Bardzoć mię utrapili zaraz od młodości mojej, powiedz teraz Izraelu.
Sentences_to: < < A Song of Ascents. > > Many times they have afflicted me from my youth up. Let Israel now say,
Translated_sentences: The song of degrees. They have afflicted me greatly from my youth: now tell Israel.

Sentences_from: Szerokość zaś sieni na przedniej stronie, na wschód słońca, pięćdziesiąt łokci.
Sentences_to: The breadth of the court on the east side eastward shall be fifty cubits.
Translated_sentences: And the breadth of the porch on the east side shall be fifty cubits.

Sentences_from: Synom zaś Aaronowym dali z miast Judzkich miasta ucieczki Hebron, i Lobne i przedmieścia jego, i Jeter, i Estemoa, i z przedmieściami jego;
Sentences_to: the son of Ethan, the son of Zimmah, the son of Shimei,
Translated_sentences: And to the children of Aaron they gave out of the cities of Judah cities of refuge, Hebron, and Lobnah, and its suburbs, and Jether, and Estemoa, and its suburbs;

Sentences_from: Przetoż upadną młodzieńcy jego na ulicach jego, a wszyscy mężowie waleczni dnia onego wytraceni będą, mówi Pan zastępów.
Sentences_to: Therefore her young men shall fall in her streets, and all the men of war shall be brought to silence in that day, says Yahweh of Armies.
Translated_sentences: Therefore shall his young men fall in his streets, and all the men of war in that day shall be cut off, saith the Lord of hosts.

Sentences_from: Przeczżeby tedy sobie utyskiwać miał człowiek żyjący, a mąż nad kaźnią za grzechy swoje.
Sentences_to: Why does a living man complain, a man for the punishment of his sins?
Translated_sentences: Let not then the living man reproach himself, and the man reproach himself for his sins.

Sentences_from: Ale żebyście pamiętali i czynili wszystkie przykazania moje, a byli świętymi Bogu waszemu.
Sentences_to: that you may remember and do all my commandments, and be holy to your God.
Translated_sentences: But that ye may remember and do all my commandments, and be holy unto your God.

Sentences_from: Bo mówi Pan: Przeto, że ten lud przybliża się do mnie usty swemi, a serce jego dalekie jest odemnie, a bojaźni, którą się mnie boją, z przykazaó ludzkich nauczyli się:
Sentences_to: The Lord said, "Because this people draws near with their mouth and with their lips to honor me, but they have removed their heart far from me, and their fear of me is a commandment of men which has been taught;
Translated_sentences: For the Lord saith, because this people draweth nigh unto me with their mouth, and their heart is far from me: and the fear which they fear me, they have learned by the commandments of men,:

Sentences_from: Zatem przeniósł się stamtąd, i wykopał drugą studnią o którą żadnego sporu nie było; i nazwał imię jej Rechobot, i mówił: Oto, teraz rozszerzył nas Pan, i urośliśmy na ziemi.
Sentences_to: He left that place, and dug another well. They didn't argue over that one. He called it Rehoboth. He said, "For now Yahweh has made room for us, and we will be fruitful in the land."
Translated_sentences: And he removed thence, and digged another well, concerning which there was no dispute: and he called the name of it Rehoboth, and said, Behold, now the LORD hath enlarged us, and we are grown in the earth.

Sentences_from: Nie uczynisz krzywdy najemnikowi ubogiemu, i potrzebnemu z braci twojej, albo z cudzoziemców twoich, którzy są w ziemi twej, w bramach twoich.
Sentences_to: for Yahweh your God walks in the midst of your camp, to deliver you, and to give up your enemies before you; therefore your camp shall be holy, that he may not see an unclean thing in you, and turn away from you.
Translated_sentences: Thou shalt not hurt the poor, nor the needy, of thy brethren, nor of thy strangers that are in thy land, within thy gates.

Sentences_from: A Semma spłodził Rahama, syna Jerkaamowego, a Rechem spłodził Sammajego.
Sentences_to: Shema became the father of Raham, the father of Jorkeam; and Rekem became the father of Shammai.
Translated_sentences: And Semma begat Raham the son of jercaam, and Rehem begat Shammai.

Sentences_from: Jako żyje Bóg, który odrzucił sąd mój, a Wszechmocny, który gorzkości nabawił duszy mojej:
Sentences_to: "As God lives, who has taken away my right, the Almighty, who has made my soul bitter.
Translated_sentences: As God lives, who rejected my judgment, and the Almighty, who made my soul bitter:

Sentences_from: A drugi z żoną bliźniego swego czyni obrzydliwość, a inny z synową swoją sprośnie się maże; inny zaś siostrę swoję, córkę ojca swego, gwałci w tobie.
Sentences_to: One has committed abomination with his neighbor's wife; and another has lewdly defiled his daughter-in-law; and another in you has humbled his sister, his father's daughter.
Translated_sentences: And the other maketh abomination with his neighbour's wife, and another maketh lewdness with his daughter-in-law: and the other maketh his sister his father's daughter to lie in thee.

Sentences_from: Aby poznali od wschodu słońca, i od zachodu słońca, iż niemasz żadnego oprócz mnie, Jam Pan, a niemasz żadnego więcej;
Sentences_to: that they may know from the rising of the sun, and from the west, that there is none besides me. I am Yahweh, and there is no one else.
Translated_sentences: That they may know from the rising of the sun, and from the setting of the Sun, that thou hast none but me, I am The Lord, and hast none more;

Sentences_from: Szarpają go wszyscy, którzy drogą mimo idą; pośmiewiskiem jest i sąsiadom swoim.
Sentences_to: You have exalted the right hand of his adversaries. You have made all of his enemies rejoice.
Translated_sentences: All those who go by the way seize him.he is a mockery to his neighbors.

Sentences_from: I umarł Saul, a królował miasto niego Balanan, syn Achborów.
Sentences_to: Shaul died, and Baal Hanan, the son of Achbor reigned in his place.
Translated_sentences: And Saul died, and balanan the son of achbor reigned in his stead.

Sentences_from: Lecz Amaza walał się w krwi w pośród drogi. A widząc on mąż, iż się zastanawiał wszystek lud nad nim, zwlekł Amazę z drogi na pole, i przyrzucił go szatą, gdyż widział, że ktokolwiek szedł mimo niego, zastanawiał się.
Sentences_to: Amasa lay wallowing in his blood in the midst of the highway. When the man saw that all the people stood still, he carried Amasa out of the highway into the field, and cast a garment over him, when he saw that everyone who came by him stood still.
Translated_sentences: But Amasa was bleeding in the middle of the road. And when the man saw that all the people wondered at him, he drew Amaziah out of the way into the field, and cast a garment over him: for he saw that whosoever passed by him wondered.

Sentences_from: Także strusia, i sowy i wodnej kani i jastrzębia, według rodzaju ich;
Sentences_to: Moses diligently inquired about the goat of the sin offering, and, behold, it was burned: and he was angry with Eleazar and with Ithamar, the sons of Aaron who were left, saying,
Translated_sentences: And the ostrich, and the owl, and the water-kani, and the Hawk, according to their kind;

Sentences_from: A teraz otośmy w rękach twoich; coć się dobrego i słusznego widzi uczynić z nami, uczyń.
Sentences_to: Now, behold, we are in your hand. Do to us as it seems good and right to you to do."
Translated_sentences: And now let us rest in thine hands: whatsoever good and right thing thou seest to do with us, do it.

Sentences_from: A tak zgładzone będzie przymierze wasze z śmiercią, a porozumienie wasze z piekłem nie ostoi się; gdy bicz gwałtowny przechodzić będzie, będziecie od niego podeptani.
Sentences_to: Your covenant with death shall be annulled, and your agreement with Sheol shall not stand. When the overflowing scourge passes through, then you will be trampled down by it.
Translated_sentences: And your covenant with death shall be destroyed, and your covenant with hell shall not stand: when the violent scourge shall pass, ye shall be trodden under foot.

Sentences_from: Słyszysz urąganie ich, o Panie! i wszystkie zamysły ich przeciwko mnie.
Sentences_to: You have heard their reproach, Yahweh, and all their devices against me,
Translated_sentences: You hear them rebuke, O Lord! and all their schemes against me.

Sentences_from: I mniemasz, żeś to z rozsądkiem rzekł: Sprawiedliwość moja przechodzi Boską?
Sentences_to: "Do you think this to be your right, or do you say, 'My righteousness is more than God's,'
Translated_sentences: And thinkest thou that with reason thou hast said, my righteousness passeth through God?

Sentences_from: Głos straszliwy brzmi w uszach jego, że czasu pokoju pustoszący przypadnie nań.
Sentences_to: A sound of terrors is in his ears. In prosperity the destroyer shall come on him.
Translated_sentences: A terrible voice is in his ears, that the time of peace shall fall upon him.

Sentences_from: Pierwej niż pracowała ku porodzeniu, porodziła, pierwej niż ją ogarnęła boleść, porodziła mężczyznę.
Sentences_to: "Before she travailed, she brought forth; before her pain came, she delivered a son.
Translated_sentences: Before she worked to give birth, she gave birth, before she was in pain, she gave birth to a man.

Sentences_from: Pan króluje, niechże zadrżą narody; siedzi między Cherubinami, niechże się poruszy ziemia.
Sentences_to: Yahweh reigns! Let the peoples tremble. He sits enthroned among the cherubim. Let the earth be moved.
Translated_sentences: The Lord reigneth, let the nations tremble: he sitteth among the cherubim, let the earth move.

Sentences_from: Dlategom rzekł: Odstąpcie odemnie, abym gorzko płakał; nie kwapcie się, cieszyć mię w spustoszeniu córki ludu mojego.
Sentences_to: Therefore I said, "Look away from me. I will weep bitterly. Don't labor to comfort me for the destruction of the daughter of my people.
Translated_sentences: Therefore said he, depart from me, that I may weep bitterly: be not grieved; rejoice me in the desolation of the daughter of my people.

Sentences_from: Nawiedzę też dnia onego każdego, który próg przeskakuje, którzy napełniają domy panów swych łupiestwem i bezprawiem.
Sentences_to: In that day, I will punish all those who leap over the threshold, who fill their master's house with violence and deceit.
Translated_sentences: And in that day I will punish every one that passeth over the threshold, that filleth the houses of their masters with plunder and iniquity.

Sentences_from: Wody kradzione słodsze są, a chleb pokątny smaczniejszy.
Sentences_to: "Stolen water is sweet. Food eaten in secret is pleasant."
Translated_sentences: Stolen water is sweeter, and broken bread is sweeter.

Sentences_from: A na onych gałkach, które były na wierzchu słupów w przysionku, była robota lilii, na cztery łokcie.
Sentences_to: The capitals that were on the top of the pillars in the porch were of lily work, four cubits.
Translated_sentences: And on the branches that were on the top of the pillars in the porch was the work of a lily, four cubits.

Sentences_from: Pragnęł tedy Dawid: Oby mi się kto dał napić wody z studni Betlehemskiej, która jest u bramy!
Sentences_to: David longed, and said, "Oh that one would give me water to drink of the well of Bethlehem, which is by the gate!"
Translated_sentences: David longed, " May someone give me water to drink from the well of Bethlehem, which is at the gate!"

Sentences_from: Ale oni mężowie robili wiosłami, chcąc się do brzegu dostać, wszakże nie mogli; bo się morze im dalej tem więcej burzyło przeciwko nim.
Sentences_to: Nevertheless the men rowed hard to get them back to the land; but they could not, for the sea grew more and more stormy against them.
Translated_sentences: But these men were rowing to get to the shore, but they could not; for the sea was still more and more raging against them.

Sentences_from: A wszakże naród on, któremu służyć będą, ja sądzić będę; a potem wynijdą stamtąd z majętnością wielką.
Sentences_to: I will also judge that nation, whom they will serve. Afterward they will come out with great wealth,
Translated_sentences: But that nation, whom they shall serve, I will judge; and afterward they shall go forth with great riches.

Sentences_from: Szukajcie też pokoju miastu temu, do któregom was przeniósł, a módlcie się za nie Panu; bo w pokoju jego będziecie mieli pokój.
Sentences_to: Seek the peace of the city where I have caused you to be carried away captive, and pray to Yahweh for it; for in its peace you shall have peace.
Translated_sentences: Seek peace also unto the city whither he hath brought you, and pray unto the Lord for them: for in his peace ye shall have peace.

Sentences_from: Zaprzęgajcie konie, a wsiadajcie jezdni, staócie w hełmach, wycierajcie oszczepy, obleczcie się w pancerze.
Sentences_to: Harness the horses, and get up, you horsemen, and stand forth with your helmets; furbish the spears, put on the coats of mail.
Translated_sentences: Harness your horses, and get on the road, stand in your helmets, wipe your Javelins, put on your armor.

Sentences_from: I nakłoniła go wielą słów swoich, a łagodnością warg swoich zniewoliła go.
Sentences_to: With persuasive words, she led him astray. With the flattering of her lips, she seduced him.
