Translated_sentences: The sloth hath hid his hand to his lips, and it is hard for him to lift it up to his mouth.

Sentences_from: Rozstępując rozstąpi się ziemia; rozsiadając rozsiądzie się ziemia; poruszając poruszy się ziemia.
Sentences_to: The earth is utterly broken. The earth is torn apart. The earth is shaken violently.
Translated_sentences: The earth shall be scattered, the earth shall be scattered, the earth shall be scattered, the earth shall be moved.

Sentences_from: Przetoż i Ja postąpię z nimi wedłu zapalczywości; oko moje nie sfolguje ani się zmiłuję; i będą wołać do uszów moich głosem wielkim, a nie wysłucham ich.
Sentences_to: Therefore will I also deal in wrath; my eye shall not spare, neither will I have pity; and though they cry in my ears with a loud voice, yet will I not hear them.
Translated_sentences: Therefore will I also deal with them according to zeal: mine eye shall not deceive, neither will I have mercy: and they shall cry in mine ears with a loud voice, and I will not hear them.

Sentences_from: Bo gdybyśmy byli nie omieszkali, już byśmy się byli dwa kroć wrócili.
Sentences_to: for if we hadn't delayed, surely we would have returned a second time by now."
Translated_sentences: Because if we hadn't been late, we'd have been back twice already.

Sentences_from: A ty, synu człowieczy! izalibyś się zastawiał, izalibyś się zastawiał za to miasto krwi? Raczej mu oznajmij wszystkie obrzydliwości jego.
Sentences_to: You, son of man, will you judge, will you judge the bloody city? then cause her to know all her abominations.
Translated_sentences: And you, son of man! would you intercede, would you intercede for this city of blood? Rather, tell him all his abominations.

Sentences_from: Usta moje będą opowiadały mądrość, a myśl serca mego roztropność.
Sentences_to: I will incline my ear to a proverb. I will open my riddle on the harp.
Translated_sentences: My mouth shall speak wisdom, and the thought of my heart wisdom.

Sentences_from: I rzekł Pan do Mojżesza: Wyciesz sobie dwie tablice kamienne, podobne pierwszym, a napiszę na tychże tablicach słowa, które były na tablicach pierwszych, któreś stłukł.
Sentences_to: Yahweh said to Moses, "Chisel two stone tablets like the first: and I will write on the tablets the words that were on the first tablets, which you broke.
Translated_sentences: And the Lord said unto Moses, cut thee two tables of stone like unto the first, and I will write upon the tables the words that were upon the first tables, which thou didst break.

Sentences_from: Przylgnęła do prochu dusza moja; ożywże mię według słowa twego.
Sentences_to: My soul is laid low in the dust. Revive me according to your word!
Translated_sentences: My soul clings to dust.revive me according to your word.

Sentences_from: Ale teraz niech odrzucą wszeteczeństwo swoje, i trupy królów swoich odemnie, a będę mieszkał w pośrodku ich na wieki.
Sentences_to: Now let them put away their prostitution, and the dead bodies of their kings, far from me; and I will dwell in their midst forever.
Translated_sentences: But now let them cast away their wickedness, and the carcases of their kings from me, and I will dwell in the midst of them forever.

Sentences_from: Gdzie rozmnożył Bóg lud swój bardzo, i uczynił go możniejszym nad nieprzyjaciół jego.
Sentences_to: He increased his people greatly, and made them stronger than their adversaries.
Translated_sentences: Where God has multiplied his people greatly, and made them more powerful than his enemies.

Sentences_from: A postanowił z nich siedmdziesiąt tysięcy, co ciężary nosili, a ośmdziesiąt tysięcy tych, co wyrąbywali na górze, a trzy tysiące i sześć set przystawów nad robotami ludu.
Sentences_to: Solomon numbered all the foreigners who were in the land of Israel, after the numbering with which David his father had numbered them; and they were found one hundred fifty-three thousand six hundred.
Translated_sentences: And he appointed of them seventy thousand that bore the burdens, and eighty thousand that ploughed in the mountain, and three thousand and six hundred sets over the works of the people.

Sentences_from: Miecz zewnątrz, a mór i głód będzie wewnątrz; kto będzie na polu, od miecza umrze; a kto w mieście, głód i mór go pożre.
Sentences_to: The sword is outside, and the pestilence and the famine within: he who is in the field shall die with the sword: and he who is in the city, famine and pestilence shall devour him.
Translated_sentences: The sword is without, and the pestilence and the famine are within; he that is in the field shall die by the sword; and he that is in the city shall be devoured by the pestilence and the famine.

Sentences_from: We dnie taczają się jako w ciemnościach, a jako w nocy macają w południe.
Sentences_to: They meet with darkness in the day time, and grope at noonday as in the night.
Translated_sentences: By day they roll as in darkness, and by night they roll as in noon.

Sentences_from: Którzy przyszedłszy do Balaama, mówili mu: Tak mówi Balak, syn Seforów: Nie ociągaj się proszę przyjść do mnie;
Sentences_to: They came to Balaam, and said to him, "Thus says Balak the son of Zippor, 'Please let nothing hinder you from coming to me:
Translated_sentences: And they came to Balaam, and said unto him, Thus saith Balak the son of Zippor, tarry not, come to me.;

Sentences_from: Który mądrze niebiosa uczynił; albowiem na wieki miłosierdzie jego;
Sentences_to: To him who by understanding made the heavens; for his loving kindness endures forever:
Translated_sentences: Who made heaven wise: for his mercy endureth for ever;

Sentences_from: Tedy rzekł Absalom i wszyscy mężowie Izraelscy: Lepsza jest rada Chusajego Arachity, niż rada Achitofelowa. Albowiem Pan był postanowił, aby rozerwana była rada Achitofelowa, która była dobra, a tak aby przywiódł Pan złe na Absaloma.
Sentences_to: Absalom and all the men of Israel said, "The counsel of Hushai the Archite is better than the counsel of Ahithophel." For Yahweh had ordained to defeat the good counsel of Ahithophel, to the intent that Yahweh might bring evil on Absalom.
Translated_sentences: And Absalom and all the men of Israel said, the counsel of hushai the arachite is better than the counsel of Ahithophel. For the Lord was determined that the counsel of Ahithophel, which was good, should be broken, and that the Lord should bring evil upon Absalom.

Sentences_from: Nie bój się, bo pohaóbiona nie będziesz; a nie zapalaj się, bo nie przyjdziesz na posromocenie; owszem na zelżywość młodości twojej zapomnisz, a na pohaóbienie wdowstwa twego więcej nie wspomnisz.
Sentences_to: "Don't be afraid; for you shall not be ashamed: neither be confounded; for you shall not be disappointed: for you shall forget the shame of your youth; and the reproach of your widowhood you shall remember no more.
Translated_sentences: Do not be afraid, for you will not be ashamed.do not be zealous, for you will not come to shame. you will forget the vivacity of your youth, and you will not remember the shame of your widowhood.

Sentences_from: Z Asera tłusty chleb jego, a on wyda rozkoszy królewskie.
Sentences_to: "Asher's food will be rich. He will yield royal dainties.
Translated_sentences: Of Asher is his fat bread, and he will give up the delights of the king.

Sentences_from: Gdy wchodzić będą do namiotu zgromadzenia, umywać się będą wodą, aby nie pomarli; także gdyby mieli przystępować do ołtarza, aby służyli, i zapalili ofiarę ognistą Panu.
Sentences_to: When they go into the Tent of Meeting, they shall wash with water, that they not die; or when they come near to the altar to minister, to burn an offering made by fire to Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: When they enter into the tabernacle of the congregation, they shall wash themselves with water, that they die not; and if they come near to the altar to minister, and burn an offering made by fire unto the Lord.

Sentences_from: Spraw sobie dwie trąby srebrne; robotą ciągnioną uczynisz je, których używać będziesz do zwoływania ludu, i gdyby się wojsko ruszać miało.
Sentences_to: "Make two trumpets of silver. You shall make them of beaten work. You shall use them for the calling of the congregation, and for the journeying of the camps.
Translated_sentences: Make thee two trumpets of silver: thou shalt make them a work of travail, which thou shalt use to call the people together, and if the army should move.

Sentences_from: Albowiem oto minęła zima! deszcz przeszedł, i przestał.
Sentences_to: For, behold, the winter is past. The rain is over and gone.
Translated_sentences: For, behold, winter is past! the rain stopped, and it stopped.

Sentences_from: Modlitwa Dawidowa. Nakłoó, Panie! ucha twego, a wysłuchaj mię; bomci nędzny i ubogi.
Sentences_to: < < A Prayer by David. > > Hear, Yahweh, and answer me, for I am poor and needy.
Translated_sentences: The Prayer Of David. Heel, Lord! and hearken unto me: the poor and the needy.

Sentences_from: A skórkami koźlęcemi obwinęła ręce jego, i gładkość szyi jego.
Sentences_to: She put the skins of the young goats on his hands, and on the smooth of his neck.
Translated_sentences: And with the skins of goats she blamed his hands, and the smoothness of his neck.

Sentences_from: Ale Jebuzejczyka, obywatela Jeruzalemskiego, nie mogli synowie Judowi wypędzić; przetoż mieszkał Jebuzejczyk z syny Juda w Jeruzalemie aż do dnia tego.
Sentences_to: As for the Jebusites, the inhabitants of Jerusalem, the children of Judah couldn't drive them out; but the Jebusites live with the children of Judah at Jerusalem to this day.
Translated_sentences: But the children of Judah could not drive out the Jebusite, a citizen of Jerusalem; and the Jebusite dwelt with the children of Judah in Jerusalem unto this day.

Sentences_from: Ten też poraził Edomczyków dziesięć tysięcy w dolinie solnej, i wziął mocą Selę, a nazwał imię jej Jokteel, aż do tego czasu.
Sentences_to: For he didn't leave to Jehoahaz of the people any more than fifty horsemen, and ten chariots, and ten thousand footmen; for the king of Syria destroyed them, and made them like the dust in threshing.
Translated_sentences: And he smote the Edomites ten thousand in the valley of salt, and took selah by force, and called her name Jokteel, until that time.

Sentences_from: Wszelkie bydlę poślubione, które się pod ślubem oddawa, od człowieka nie będzie odkupione, ale śmiercią umrze.
Sentences_to: You will eat the flesh of your sons, and you will eat the flesh of your daughters.
Translated_sentences: All married animals that give themselves in marriage shall not be redeemed from man, but shall die.

Sentences_from: A ten kozieł kosmaty jest król Grecki, a ten róg wielki, który jest między oczyma jego, jest król pierwszy.
Sentences_to: The rough male goat is the king of Greece: and the great horn that is between his eyes is the first king.
Translated_sentences: And this shaggy goat is the king of Greece; and this great horn that is between his eyes is the first king.

Sentences_from: Bo przez sześć dni stworzył Pan niebo i ziemię, morze, i cokolwiek w nich jest, i odpoczął dnia siódmego; przetoż błogosławił Pan dzień odpocznienia, i poświęcił go.
Sentences_to: for in six days Yahweh made heaven and earth, the sea, and all that is in them, and rested the seventh day; therefore Yahweh blessed the Sabbath day, and made it holy.
Translated_sentences: For six days the Lord made heaven, and earth, and the sea, and whatsoever is in them, and rested on the seventh day: therefore the Lord blessed the day of rest, and consecrated it.

Sentences_from: I będzie mocarz jako zgrzebia, a ten, który go uczynił, jako iskra; i zapalą się oboje pospołu, a nie będzie, ktoby zagasił.
Sentences_to: The strong will be like tinder, and his work like a spark. They will both burn together, and no one will quench them."
Translated_sentences: And there shall be a strong man as a carcase, and he that made him as a spark: and they shall be kindled together, and there shall be none to quench them.

Sentences_from: Wołają sprawiedliwi, a Pan ich wysłuchiwa, i ze wszystkich trudności ich wybawia ich.
Sentences_to: Yahweh is near to those who have a broken heart, and saves those who have a crushed spirit.
Translated_sentences: The righteous cry, and the Lord listens to them, and saves them from all their difficulties.

Sentences_from: Oto córka moja panna, i założnica jego, wywiodę je zaraz, że je obelżycie, a uczynicie z niemi, co się wam będzie dobrego zdało; tylko mężowi temu nie czyńcie tej zelżywości.
Sentences_to: Behold, here is my virgin daughter and his concubine. I will bring them out now. Humble them, and do with them what seems good to you; but to this man don't do any such folly."
Translated_sentences: Behold, my virgin daughter, and his concubine, I will bring them forth immediately, that ye shall offend them, and ye shall do unto them that which is good for you: but ye shall not do this wickedness unto this man.

Sentences_from: Według sprawiedliwości twej wybaw mię, i wyrwij mię; nakłoó ku mnie ucha twego, i zachowaj mię.
Sentences_to: Deliver me in your righteousness, and rescue me. Turn your ear to me, and save me.
Translated_sentences: According to thy righteousness deliver me, and deliver me: incline thine ear unto me, and keep me.

Sentences_from: Ale dwom mężom, którzy szpiegowali onę ziemię, rzekł Jozue: Wnijdźcie do domu niewiasty wszetecznej, a wywiedźcie stamtąd niewiastę, i wszystko, co jej jest, jakoście jej przysięgli.
Sentences_to: Joshua said to the two men who had spied out the land, "Go into the prostitute's house, and bring out from there the woman and all that she has, as you swore to her."
Translated_sentences: But to the two men who spied on the land, Joshua said, " go into the house of the woman who is a whore, and bring out from there the woman, and all that is in her, as you swore to her."

Sentences_from: A gdy rozszerzy Pan, Bóg twój, granice twoje, jako przysiągł ojcom twoim, i dać wszystkę ziemię, którą zaślubił dać ojcom twoim:
Sentences_to: They shall have like portions to eat, besides that which comes of the sale of his patrimony.
Translated_sentences: And when the Lord thy God shall enlarge thy borders, as he sware unto thy fathers, and give all the land which he hath sworn to give unto thy fathers,:

Sentences_from: Abyś tak nosiła haóbę twoję, a wstydziła się za wszystko, coś czyniła, a tak abyś je ucieszyła.
Sentences_to: that you may bear your own shame, and may be ashamed because of all that you have done, in that you are a comfort to them.
Translated_sentences: So that you may wear your robe, and be ashamed of everything, do something, and so that you may rejoice in them.

Sentences_from: Przetoż teraz o Panie, Boże Izraelski, ziść słudze twemu Dawidowi, ojcu memu, coś mu powiedział, mówiąc: Nie będzie odjęty przed twarzą moją z narodu twego mąż, któryby siedział na stolicy Izraelskiej, jeźli tylko będą przestrzegali synowie twoi drogi swej, chodząc przede mną, jakoś ty chodził przed oblicznością moją.
Sentences_to: Now therefore, may Yahweh, the God of Israel, keep with your servant David my father that which you have promised him, saying, 'There shall not fail you a man in my sight to sit on the throne of Israel, if only your children take heed to their way, to walk before me as you have walked before me.'
Translated_sentences: Now therefore, O Lord God of Israel, behold thy servant David my father spake unto him, saying, there shall no man be taken away from me out of thy people, that shall sit upon the throne of Israel, unless thy children keep their way before me, as thou walkest before me.

Sentences_from: Długość opony jednej dwadzieścia i osiem łokci, a szerokość opony jednej na cztery łokcie; pod jedną miarą były wszystkie opony.
Sentences_to: The length of each curtain was twenty-eight cubits, and the breadth of each curtain four cubits. All the curtains had one measure.
Translated_sentences: The length of one tyre was twenty and eight cubits, and the breadth of one tyre was four cubits.all the tyres were in one measure.

Sentences_from: Któż nie wie z tych wszystkich rzeczy, że to ręka Pańska sprawiła?
Sentences_to: Who doesn't know that in all these, the hand of Yahweh has done this,
Translated_sentences: Who does not know of all these things that it was the hand of the Lord that made them?

Sentences_from: A tak stanąwszy Rabsaces wołał głosem wielkim po żydowsku, a mówiąc rzekł: Słuchajcie słów króla wielkiego, króla Assyryjskiego.
Sentences_to: So one of the priests whom they had carried away from Samaria came and lived in Bethel, and taught them how they should fear Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: And Rabshaziah stood, and cried with a loud voice in the Hebrew language, and said, Hear ye the words of the great king, the king of Assyria.

Sentences_from: Trzeci Absalom, syn Maachy, córki Tolmaja, króla Giessur; czwarty Adonijasz, syn Haggity;
Sentences_to: the third, Absalom the son of Maacah the daughter of Talmai king of Geshur; the fourth, Adonijah the son of Haggith;
Translated_sentences: The third Absalom, the son of Maacah, the daughter of Tolmai King of Giessur; the fourth Adonijah, the son of Haggith;;

Sentences_from: Teraz tedy tak mówi Pan zastępów: Uważajcież, jako się wam powodzi;
Sentences_to: Now therefore this is what Yahweh of Armies says: Consider your ways.
Translated_sentences: Now therefore thus saith the Lord of hosts: take heed How Ye prosper.;

Sentences_from: O mieczu Pański, dokąd się nie uspokoisz? Wróć się do pochew twoich, uśmierz się, a ucichnij.
Sentences_to: You sword of Yahweh, how long will it be before you be quiet? Put up yourself into your scabbard; rest, and be still.
Translated_sentences: O sword of the Lord, where will you not calm down? Go back to your vagina, smile, and be quiet.

Sentences_from: Tedy rzekł Pan do Jozuego: Otom dał w ręce twoje Jerycho, i króla jego, i możne wojska jego.
Sentences_to: Yahweh said to Joshua, "Behold, I have given Jericho into your hand, with its king and the mighty men of valor.
Translated_sentences: And the Lord said unto Joshua, I have given Into thy hand Jericho, and her king, and her mighty armies.

Sentences_from: Tedy rzekł Manue do Anioła Pańskiego: Daj się proszę zatrzymać, a nagotujemy przed cię koźlątko z stada.
Sentences_to: Manoah said to the angel of Yahweh, "Please, let us detain you, that we may make a young goat ready for you."
Translated_sentences: And Manoah said unto the angel of the lord, let us tarry, I pray thee, and we will prepare before thee a young goat of the flock.

Sentences_from: Tedy mi rzekł: Synu człowieczy! onić to są mężowie, którzy zamyślają o nieprawości, a radzą złą radę w tem mieście,
Sentences_to: He said to me, Son of man, these are the men who devise iniquity, and who give wicked counsel in this city;
Translated_sentences: And he said unto me, son of man. these are the men who meditate on iniquity, and give Evil Counsel in this city.,

Sentences_from: Połknie śmierć w zwycięstwie, a Pan panujący otrze łzę z każdego oblicza, i pohaóbienie ludu swego odejmie ze wszystkiej ziemi; bo Pan mówił.
Sentences_to: He has swallowed up death forever! The Lord Yahweh will wipe away tears from off all faces. He will take the reproach of his people away from off all the earth, for Yahweh has spoken it.
Translated_sentences: He shall swallow up death in victory, and the Lord God shall wipe away a tear from every face, and shall take away the reproach of his people out of all the earth: for the LORD hath spoken.

Sentences_from: Inaczej stanie się, gdy zaśnie król, pan mój, z ojcy swymi, że będziemy ja i Salomon, syn mój, jako grzesznicy.
Sentences_to: Otherwise it will happen, when my lord the king shall sleep with his fathers, that I and my son Solomon shall be counted offenders."
Translated_sentences: Otherwise it shall be, when the king my lord sleeps with his fathers, that I and Solomon my son shall be sinners.

Sentences_from: Ale Pan rzekł do niego: idź, wróć się drogą twą na puszczę Damaską, a gdy tam przyjdziesz, pomażesz Hazaela za króla nad Syryją;
Sentences_to: Yahweh said to him, "Go, return on your way to the wilderness of Damascus. When you arrive, you shall anoint Hazael to be king over Syria.
Translated_sentences: And the Lord said unto Him, Go, return by thy way into the wilderness of Damascus; and when thou comest thither, thou shalt anoint Hazael king over Syria.;

Sentences_from: Zagubił też one konie, które byli królowie Judzcy oddali słoócu, a stały, kędy wchodzą do domu Pańskiego, podle mieszkania Natanmelecha dworzanina, które było na przedmieściu; i wozy słońca spalił ogniem.
Sentences_to: It happened, when the king had heard the words of the book of the law, that he tore his clothes.
Translated_sentences: And he destroyed the horses which the kings of Judah had given to the elephant, and they stood in the way of the house of the Lord, according to the habitation of nathanmelech the courtier, which was in the suburbs: and he burned the chariots of the sun with fire.

Sentences_from: Dał tedy Pan, Bóg nasz, w ręce nasze i Oga, króla Basańskiego, i wszystek lud jego, i poraziliśmy go, tak że nie zostało po nim nikogo.
Sentences_to: So Yahweh our God delivered into our hand Og also, the king of Bashan, and all his people: and we struck him until none was left to him remaining.
Translated_sentences: And the Lord our God gave into our hand Og king of Bashan, and all his people; and we smote him, and there was none left after him.

Sentences_from: Dokąd ujdę przed duchem twoim? a dokąd przed obliczem twojem uciekę?
Sentences_to: Where could I go from your Spirit? Or where could I flee from your presence?
Translated_sentences: Where will I go before your spirit? where do I run from you?

Sentences_from: Odpowiedział król, i rzekł: Zaiste wiem, że umyślnie odwłaczacie, bacząc, że mi ten sen z pamięci wyszedł.
Sentences_to: The king answered, I know of a certainty that you would gain time, because you see the thing is gone from me.
Translated_sentences: And the King answered and said, Surely I know that ye wilfully turn away, seeing that this dream is departed from my memory.

Sentences_from: Wielka jest chwała jego w zbawieniu twojem; chwałą i zacnością przyodziałeś go;
Sentences_to: For you make him most blessed forever. You make him glad with joy in your presence.
Translated_sentences: Great is his glory in thy salvation: glory and Glory have thou bestowed upon him;

Sentences_from: Każda jednak rzecz poślubiona, którą by kto poślubił Panu ze wszystkiego, co ma z ludzi, i z bydła, i z ról osiadłości swojej, nie będzie sprzedawana, ani odkupowana; bo wszelka rzecz poślubiona najświętsza jest Panu.
Sentences_to: then I will walk contrary to you in wrath; and I also will chastise you seven times for your sins.
Translated_sentences: But all that is married, which any man shall marry unto the Lord, of all that he hath of men, and of cattle, and of his possessions, shall not be sold or redeemed: for all that is married is most holy unto the Lord.

Sentences_from: Będą zaiste wielbłądy ich podane na łup, a mnóstwo dobytku ich na korzyść; i rozproszę na wszystkie wiatry tych, którzy i w najostateczniejszych kątach mieszkają, i ze wszystkich stron złe na nich przywiodę, mówi Pan.
Sentences_to: Their camels shall be a booty, and the multitude of their livestock a spoil: and I will scatter to all winds those who have the corners of their beards cut off; and I will bring their calamity from every side of them, says Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: And their camels shall be given for a prey, and their substance for a profit: and I will scatter to all winds them that dwell in the least places, and I will bring evil upon them on every side, saith the Lord.

Sentences_from: A gdy przyszli posłowie, oto obraz na łożu, a wezgłówko z koziej skóry pod głowami jego.
Sentences_to: When the messengers came in, behold, the teraphim was in the bed, with the pillow of goats' hair at its head.
Translated_sentences: And when the messengers were come, behold a picture upon a bed, and a head of goatskin under his heads.

Sentences_from: Potem też Dawid wstał, i wyszedł z jaskini, a zawołał za Saulem, mówiąc: Królu, Panie mój! Tedy się obejrzał Saul nazad, a Dawid schyliwszy się twarzą ku ziemi, pokłonił się.
Sentences_to: David knew that Saul was devising mischief against him; and he said to Abiathar the priest, "Bring the ephod here."
Translated_sentences: And David arose, and went out of the cave, and cried after Saul, saying, O king, my lord! And Saul looked back, and David bowed himself with his face to the ground, and bowed himself.

Sentences_from: A pamiętaj, żeś był niewolnikiem w ziemi Egipskiej, i wywiódł cię Pan, Bóg twój, stamtąd ręką możną, i ramieniem wyciągnionem; przetoż ci przykazał Pan, Bóg twój, abyś obchodził dzień sobotni.
Sentences_to: You shall remember that you were a servant in the land of Egypt, and Yahweh your God brought you out of there by a mighty hand and by an outstretched arm: therefore Yahweh your God commanded you to keep the Sabbath day.
Translated_sentences: Remember that you were a slave in the land of Egypt, and the LORD your God brought you out from there with a mighty hand and an outstretched arm; therefore the LORD your God commanded you to keep the Sabbath day.

Sentences_from: Dla braci moich i dla przyjaciół moich teraz ci będę żądał pokoju.
Sentences_to: For my brothers' and companions' sakes, I will now say, "Peace be within you."
Translated_sentences: For my brothers and for my friends, I will now ask you for peace.

Sentences_from: Jeźli też który z nich przychodzi, aby mię nawiedził, tedy na zdradzie mówi; serce jego zgromadza sobie nieprawość, a precz odszedłszy roznosi.
Sentences_to: All who hate me whisper together against me. They imagine the worst for me.
Translated_sentences: And if any one of them cometh to visit me, he speaketh treason: his heart gathereth iniquity, and goeth away, and spreadeth abroad.

Sentences_from: I zstąpił Pan w obłoku, i stanął tam z nim, i zawołał imieniem Pan.
Sentences_to: Yahweh descended in the cloud, and stood with him there, and proclaimed the name of Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: And the Lord came down in the cloud, and stood there with him, and called by the name of the Lord.

Sentences_from: Dziewiąty na Matanijasza, na synów jego i na braci jego dwanaście.
Sentences_to: the ninth to Mattaniah, his sons and his brothers, twelve:
Translated_sentences: The ninth for mataniah, and for his sons, and for his brethren, twelve.

Sentences_from: Aby otwierał oczy ślepych, a wywodził więźniów z ciemnicy, i z domu więzienia siedzących w ciemnościach.
Sentences_to: to open the blind eyes, to bring the prisoners out of the dungeon, and those who sit in darkness out of the prison.
Translated_sentences: That he may open the eyes of the blind, and bring forth the prisoners out of the prison, and out of the house of the prison, who are sitting in darkness.

Sentences_from: Jako żyję Ja, mówi panujący Pan, że ręką możną i ramieniem wyciągnionem, a w popędliwości wylanej będę królował nad wami;
Sentences_to: As I live, says the Lord Yahweh, surely with a mighty hand, and with an outstretched arm, and with wrath poured out, will I be king over you:
Translated_sentences: As I live, saith the Lord God, I will reign over you with a mighty hand, and with an outstretched arm, and with an outstretched hand,;

Sentences_from: A wszakże, jeźli się upodoba duszy twojej, zabijesz sobie, i będziesz jadł mięso według błogosławieństwa Pana, Boga twego, które da tobie we wszystkich bramach twoich; nieczysty i czysty jeść je będzie, jako sarnę albo jelenia.
Sentences_to: Notwithstanding, you may kill and eat flesh within all your gates, after all the desire of your soul, according to the blessing of Yahweh your God which he has given you: the unclean and the clean may eat of it, as of the gazelle, and as of the hart.
Translated_sentences: But if it please thy soul, thou shalt kill thyself, and eat the flesh according to the blessing of the LORD thy God, which he shall give thee in all thy gates: the unclean and the clean shall eat it as a stag or a stag.

Sentences_from: A zabije baranka na ofiarę za występek: a wziąwszy kapłan ze krwi ofiary za występek, pomaże koniec ucha prawego temu, który się oczyszcza; i palec wielki prawej ręki jego, i palec wielki prawej nogi jego.
Sentences_to: then the priest shall examine it; and behold, if the hair in the bright spot has turned white, and its appearance is deeper than the skin; it is leprosy. It has broken out in the burning, and the priest shall pronounce him unclean. It is the plague of leprosy.
Translated_sentences: And he shall kill a lamb for a trespass offering: and the priest shall take of the blood of the trespass offering, and anoint the end of the right ear of him that purgeth himself, and the great finger of his right hand, and the great toe of his right foot.

Sentences_from: Z synów Józefowych, a naprzód z synów Efraimowych, rodzajów ich według familii ich, według domów ojców ich, według liczby imion, od dwudziestu lat i wyżej, wszystkich wychodzących na wojnę;
Sentences_to: Of the children of Joseph, of the children of Ephraim, their generations, by their families, by their fathers' houses, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to go out to war;
Translated_sentences: Of the children of Joseph, and before them of the children of Ephraim, according to their families, according to their fathers ' houses, according to the number of their names, from twenty years old and upward, all that went out to war.;

Sentences_from: Synów Gazama, synów Uzy, synów Faseacha.
Sentences_to: the children of Gazzam, the children of Uzza, the children of Paseah.
Translated_sentences: The children of gazam, the children of uzzah, the children of Phaseach.

Sentences_from: Kapanie ustawiczne w dzień gwałtownego deszczu, i żona swarliwa są sobie podobni;
Sentences_to: A continual dropping on a rainy day and a contentious wife are alike:
Translated_sentences: Constant dripping in a day of heavy rain, and the swarthy wife are alike;

Sentences_from: Synom Merarego według domów ich dostało się w pokoleniu Rubenowem, i w pokoleniu Gadowem, i w pokoleniu Zabulonowem losem miast dwanaście.
Sentences_to: Their brothers the Levites were appointed for all the service of the tabernacle of God's house.
Translated_sentences: To the children of Merari, according to their houses, there were twelve cities in the tribe of Reuben, and in the tribe of Gad, and in the tribe of Zebulun.

Sentences_from: I będziecie wołać dnia onego dla króla waszego, którego sobie obierzecie, a nie wysłucha was Pan dnia onego.
Sentences_to: You shall cry out in that day because of your king whom you shall have chosen you; and Yahweh will not answer you in that day."
Translated_sentences: And ye shall cry in that day for your king, whom ye shall choose; and the LORD shall not hearken unto you in that day.

Sentences_from: I kiedyż będzie koniec tym próżnym słowom? albo co cię przymusza, że tak odpowiadasz?
Sentences_to: Shall vain words have an end? Or what provokes you that you answer?
Translated_sentences: And when will these vain words end? or what makes you say that?

Sentences_from: I rzekł Samuel do Saula: Posłał mię Pan, abym cię pomazał za króla nad ludem jego Izraelskim, przetoż teraz posłuchaj głosu słów Pańskich.
Sentences_to: Samuel said to Saul, "Yahweh sent me to anoint you to be king over his people, over Israel. Now therefore listen to the voice of the words of Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: And Samuel said unto Saul, The Lord hath sent me to anoint thee king over his people Israel: now therefore hearken unto the voice of the words of the Lord.

Sentences_from: Nogi ich bieżą do złego, i kwapią się na wylanie krwi niewinnej. Myśli ich są myśli nieprawości; spustoszenie i starcie jest na drogach ich.
Sentences_to: Their feet run to evil, and they make haste to shed innocent blood: their thoughts are thoughts of iniquity; desolation and destruction are in their paths.
Translated_sentences: Their feet run to evil, and they leap to the outpouring of innocent blood. Their thoughts are thoughts of iniquity.desolation and strife are in their ways.

Sentences_from: Nad to jeszcze urodziła syna, i nazwała imię jego Sela; a Judas był w Chezybie, gdy mu urodziła.
Sentences_to: She yet again bore a son, and named him Shelah: and he was at Chezib, when she bore him.
Translated_sentences: And she bare a son, and called his name Selah: and Judas was in Hezibah when she bare him.

Sentences_from: A po wyjściu dwudziestu lat, w których budował Salomon dom Pański i dom swój,
Sentences_to: It happened at the end of twenty years, in which Solomon had built the house of Yahweh, and his own house,
Translated_sentences: And after twenty years, when Solomon had builded the House of the Lord, and his house,,

Sentences_from: Świadczyć też będzie hardość Izraelska przeciwko niemu; przetoż Izrael i Efraim upadną dla nieprawości swojej, upadnie też i Juda z nimi.
Sentences_to: You will stumble in the day, and the prophet will also stumble with you in the night; and I will destroy your mother.
Translated_sentences: And the hardness of Israel shall testify against him: therefore Israel and Ephraim shall fall because of their iniquity, and Judah also shall fall with them.

Sentences_from: A ostatek ludu, który był został w mieście, i zbiegi, którzy byli zbiegli do króla Babilońskiego, i inne pospólstwo, przeniósł Nabuzardan, hetman żołnierski.
Sentences_to: Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard carried away captive the residue of the people who were left in the city, and those who fell away, who fell to the king of Babylon, and the residue of the multitude.
Translated_sentences: And the remnant of the people that were left in the city, and the fugitives that had fled to the king of Babylon, and the rest of the company, Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard carried away.

Sentences_from: A oni się byli nań zasadzili w komorze, i rzekła mu: Filistynowie nad tobą, Samsonie; ale on zerwał wici, jakoby kto zerwał nić zgrzebną, ogniem napaloną; i nie poznano, w czem była moc jego.
Sentences_to: Now she had an ambush waiting in the inner room. She said to him, "The Philistines are on you, Samson!" He broke the cords, as a string of tow is broken when it touches the fire. So his strength was not known.
Translated_sentences: And they were set upon him in the chamber, and she said unto him, the Philistines are upon thee, Samson: but he broke the thread, as if one had broken a thread of carded fire; and it was not known wherein was his power.

Sentences_from: Przetoż mów do domu Izraelskiego: Tak mówi panujący Pan: Nie dla was Ja to czynię, o domie Izraelski! ale dla imienia świętobliwości mojej, któreście splugawili między narodami, do którycheście przyszli;
Sentences_to: Therefore tell the house of Israel, Thus says the Lord Yahweh: I don't do [this] for your sake, house of Israel, but for my holy name, which you have profaned among the nations, where you went.
Translated_sentences: Therefore speak unto the house of Israel, Thus saith the Lord God; I do it not for you, O House of Israel. but for the sake of my holiness's name, which ye have profaned among the nations unto which ye came.;

Sentences_from: Tedy przepuścił Pan powietrze morowe na Izraela. I poległo z Izraela siedmdziesiąt tysięcy mężów.
Sentences_to: So Yahweh sent a pestilence on Israel; and seventy thousand men of Israel fell.
Translated_sentences: And the Lord sent the pestilence upon Israel. And there fell of Israel seventy thousand men.

Sentences_from: I poznaliby grzech, którym zgrzeszyli, ofiarować będzie ono zgromadzenie cielca młodego na ofiarę za grzech, a przywiodą go przed namiot zgromadzenia,
Sentences_to: when the sin in which they have sinned is known, then the assembly shall offer a young bull for a sin offering, and bring it before the Tent of Meeting.
Translated_sentences: And if they know the sin wherewith they have sinned, the congregation shall offer a young calf for a sin offering, and they shall bring it before the tabernacle of the congregation.,

Sentences_from: Miłując te, którzy cię mają w nienawiści, a nienawidząc tych, którzy cię miłują. Albowiem pokazałeś dziś, że sobie nie poważasz hetmanów, i sług twoich; bom doznał tego dziś, że gdyby Absalom był żyw, choćbyśmy my wszyscy dziś byli pobici, tedyć by się to bardzo podobało.
Sentences_to: Now therefore arise, go out, and speak to comfort your servants; for I swear by Yahweh, if you don't go out, not a man will stay with you this night. That would be worse to you than all the evil that has happened to you from your youth until now."
Translated_sentences: Loving those who hate you, and hating those who love you. For you have shown this day that you have no respect for your captains and your servants; for I have seen it this day, that if Absalom were alive, even though we were all slain this day, it would please him greatly.

Sentences_from: Obaczcież, rozdzieliłem wam losem te narody pozostałe w dziedzictwo między pokolenia wasze od Jordanu, i wszystkie narody, którem wytracił, aż do morza wielkiego na zachód słońca.
Sentences_to: Behold, I have allotted to you these nations that remain, to be an inheritance for your tribes, from the Jordan, with all the nations that I have cut off, even to the great sea toward the going down of the sun.
Translated_sentences: Behold, I have divided unto you by lot the remnant of these nations for an inheritance among your generations from the Jordan, and all the nations with which he hath destroyed, even unto the great sea at the setting of the sun.

Sentences_from: A gdy będą mieli wchodzić do bramy sieni wewnętrznej, tedy się obleką w szaty lniane, a nie wezmą na się nic wełnianego, gdy służyć będą w bramach sieni wnętrznej, i wewnątrz.
Sentences_to: It shall be that, when they enter in at the gates of the inner court, they shall be clothed with linen garments; and no wool shall come on them, while they minister in the gates of the inner court, and within.
Translated_sentences: And when they enter into the gate of the inner court, they shall put on linen garments, and shall not put on anything of wool, when they Minister in the gates of the inner court, and within.

Sentences_from: Albo posłałlibym mór na tę ziemię, i wylałbym popędliwość swoję na nią ku wytraceniu, aby z niej ludzie i zwierzęta byli wytraceni.
Sentences_to: Or if I send a pestilence into that land, and pour out my wrath on it in blood, to cut off from it man and animal;
Translated_sentences: Or I would send a pestilence upon the land, and pour out my wrath upon it, that men and beasts might be cut off from it.

Sentences_from: I rzekł: Błogosławiony Pan, Bóg Izraelski, który mówił usty swemi do Dawida, ojca mego, i skutecznie to wypełnił, mówiąc:
Sentences_to: He said, "Blessed is Yahweh, the God of Israel, who spoke with his mouth to David your father, and has with his hand fulfilled it, saying,
Translated_sentences: And he said, Blessed Be The Lord God of Israel, which spake with his mouth unto David my father, and did it effectually, saying,:

Sentences_from: Ani na bogów ojców swych nie będzie dbał, ani o miłość niewiast, ani o żadnego boga dbać będzie, przeto, że się nade wszystko wyniesie.
Sentences_to: Neither shall he regard the gods of his fathers, nor the desire of women, nor regard any god; for he shall magnify himself above all.
Translated_sentences: He will not care for the gods of his fathers, nor for the love of women, nor for any god, because he is exalted above all things.

Sentences_from: I rzekł Mojżesz do niego: Gdy wynijdę z miasta, wyciągnę ręce swe do Pana, a gromy ustaną, i grad nie będzie więcej, abyś wiedział, że Pańska jest ziemia;
Sentences_to: Moses said to him, "As soon as I have gone out of the city, I will spread abroad my hands to Yahweh. The thunders shall cease, neither shall there be any more hail; that you may know that the earth is Yahweh's.
Translated_sentences: And Moses said unto him, when I am gone out of the city, I will stretch out my hands unto the Lord, and the Thunders shall cease, and there shall be no more hail; that thou mayest know that the land of the Lord is;

Sentences_from: I zstąpił Pan w obłoku, i mówił do niego, a wziąwszy z Ducha, który był w nim, podzielił go między siedemdziesiąt mężów starszych; i stało się, gdy odpoczął nad nimi on Duch, tedy prorokowali, a potem nigdy.
Sentences_to: Yahweh came down in the cloud, and spoke to him, and took of the Spirit that was on him, and put it on the seventy elders: and it happened that when the Spirit rested on them, they prophesied, but they did so no more.
Translated_sentences: And the Lord came down in the cloud, and spake unto him, and took of the spirit that was in him, and divided him among the seventy elders: and it came to pass, when the spirit rested upon them, that they prophesied, and afterward never.

Sentences_from: On wysyła słowo swe na ziemię; bardzo prędko bieży wyrok jego.
Sentences_to: He sends out his commandment to the earth. His word runs very swiftly.
Translated_sentences: He sends his word to the earth; his judgment is swift.

Sentences_from: A czyniący miłosierdzie nad tysiącami tych, którzy mię miłują, i strzegą przykazaó moich.
Sentences_to: and showing loving kindness to thousands of those who love me and keep my commandments.
Translated_sentences: And he that showeth mercy upon thousands of them that love me, and keep my commandments.

Sentences_from: Ręce swoje obraca do kądzieli, a palcami swemi trzyma wrzeciono.
Sentences_to: She lays her hands to the distaff, and her hands hold the spindle.
Translated_sentences: He turns his hands to the angle, and with his fingers he holds the spindle.

Sentences_from: Bo pamiętam na sądy twoje wieczne, Panie! któremi się cieszę.
Sentences_to: I remember your ordinances of old, Yahweh, and have comforted myself.
Translated_sentences: Because I remember your eternal judgments, Lord! which I'm happy about.

Sentences_from: I obróci się w proch po wszystkiej ziemi Egipskiej, i będzie na ludziach, i na bydle wrzodem czyniącym pryszczele, po wszystkiej ziemi Egipskiej.
Sentences_to: It shall become small dust over all the land of Egypt, and shall be a boil breaking out with boils on man and on animal, throughout all the land of Egypt."
Translated_sentences: And it shall be turned to dust in all the land of Egypt, and it shall be upon men, and upon cattle, a boil of boils, throughout all the land of Egypt.

Sentences_from: Ja też wam to uczynię: nawiedzę was strachem, suchotami i gorączką, które wam oczy popsują a boleścią napełnią dusze wasze, a siać będziecie próżno nasienie wasze, bo je zjedzą nieprzyjaciele wasi;
Sentences_to: According to the length of the years you shall increase its price, and according to the shortness of the years you shall diminish its price; for he is selling the number of the crops to you.
Translated_sentences: I will also do this to you: I will afflict you with fear, with dryness, and with fever, which will spoil your eyes, and fill your souls with anguish, and you will sow your seed in vain, because your enemies will eat it.;

Sentences_from: Gdy on sprawi pokój, któż go wzruszy? także, gdy skryje oblicze, któż go ujrzy? A to czyni tak całemu narodowi, jako każdemu człowiekowi,
Sentences_to: When he gives quietness, who then can condemn? When he hides his face, who then can see him? Alike whether to a nation, or to a man,
Translated_sentences: When he makes peace, who will move him? and when he hides his face, who will see him? And it does so to the whole nation, as to every man,

Sentences_from: I pytał się Dawid Pana, który odpowiedział: Nie pójdziesz przeciwko nim; ale je obtoczywszy z tyłu natrzesz na nie przeciwko morwom.
Sentences_to: When David inquired of Yahweh, he said, "You shall not go up. Circle around behind them, and attack them over against the mulberry trees.
Translated_sentences: And David inquired of the Lord, and he said, Thou shalt not go against them: but when thou goest round about them behind, thou shalt meet them against the mulberry trees.

Sentences_from: I hamował Kaleb lud szemrzący przeciw Mojżeszowi, i mówił: Pójdźmy a posiądźmy ziemię, bo ją pewnie sobie podbijemy.
Sentences_to: Caleb stilled the people before Moses, and said, "Let us go up at once, and possess it; for we are well able to overcome it."
Translated_sentences: And Caleb hindered the murmuring people against Moses, and said, let us go and possess the land; for we will surely conquer it.

Sentences_from: I opuściwszy wszystkie rozkazania Pana, Boga swego, poczynili sobie lane bałwany, mianowicie dwóch cielców; poczynili też gaje, a kłaniali się wszystkiemu wojsku niebieskiemu, i służyli Baalowi.
Sentences_to: Urijah the priest did so, according to all that king Ahaz commanded.
Translated_sentences: And they forsook all the commandments of the lord their God, and made them idols, two calves, and made groves, and worshipped all the host of heaven, and served Baal.

Sentences_from: Pytaliśmy tedy starszych onych męwiąc do nich: Któż wam rozkazał ten dom budować, i te muru z gruntu wywodzić?
Sentences_to: Then we asked those elders, and said to them thus, "Who gave you a decree to build this house, and to finish this wall?"
Translated_sentences: And we asked the elders, and said unto them, who hath commanded you to build this house, and to build these walls out of the ground?

Sentences_from: Wyższe są niż niebiosa, cóż uczynisz? Głębsze niż piekło, jakoż poznasz?
Sentences_to: They are high as heaven. What can you do? They are deeper than Sheol . What can you know?
Translated_sentences: Higher than the heavens, what will you do? Deeper than hell, how will you know?

Sentences_from: Oto Pana, Boga twego, są niebiosa, i niebiosa niebios, ziemia i wszystko co na niej.
Sentences_to: Behold, to Yahweh your God belongs heaven and the heaven of heavens, the earth, with all that is therein.
Translated_sentences: Behold, the LORD thy God is the heavens, and the heavens of the heavens, the earth, and all that is therein.

Sentences_from: Strzeżże, synu mój! przykazania ojca twego, a nie opuszczaj nauki matki twojej.
Sentences_to: My son, keep your father's commandment, and don't forsake your mother's teaching.
Translated_sentences: Guard, my son! the commandments of your father, and do not forsake the teaching of your mother.

Sentences_from: A choć początek twój mały będzie, jednak ostatek twój bardzo się rozmnoży.
Sentences_to: Though your beginning was small, yet your latter end would greatly increase.
Translated_sentences: And though your beginning be small, yet your end shall be multiplied greatly.

Sentences_from: I będzie ofiarował z niego jeden chleb z każdej ofiary na podnoszenie Panu. Kapłanowi, który kropi krwią ofiar spokojnych, należeć to będzie.
Sentences_to: "'This is the law of the meal offering: the sons of Aaron shall offer it before Yahweh, before the altar.
Translated_sentences: And he shall offer of it one loaf of every sacrifice, for an offering made by fire unto the Lord. The priest who sprinkles the blood of the peace offerings shall have it.

Sentences_from: Bodaj się były zaćmiły gwiazdy przy zmierzkaniu jej! a czekając światła, aby się go była nie doczekała, ani nie oglądała zorzy porannej!
Sentences_to: Let the stars of its twilight be dark. Let it look for light, but have none, neither let it see the eyelids of the morning,
Translated_sentences: Wish you were eclipsed by the stars when you met her! and waiting for the light, so that she would not wait for it, nor see the morning dawn!

Sentences_from: I uczynili synowie Lewiego według słowa Mojżeszowego; i poległo z ludu dnia onego około trzech tysięcy mężów.
Sentences_to: The sons of Levi did according to the word of Moses: and there fell of the people that day about three thousand men.
Translated_sentences: And the children of Levi did according to the word of Moses: and there fell of the people that day about three thousand men.

Sentences_from: Bracią także twoję, pokolenie Lewiego, ród ojca twego, przypuścisz do siebie, aby byli przy tobie, i posługowali tobie; a ty i synowie twoi z tobą służyć będziecie przed namiotem świadectwa.
Sentences_to: Your brothers also, the tribe of Levi, the tribe of your father, bring near with you, that they may be joined to you, and minister to you: but you and your sons with you shall be before the tent of the testimony.
Translated_sentences: And thy brethren, the tribe of Levi, the family of thy father, shalt thou bring unto thee, that they may be with thee, and minister unto thee: and thou and thy sons shall minister with thee before the tent of testimony.

Sentences_from: A tak chwaliłem wesele, przeto, iż niemasz nic lepszego człowiekowi pod słońcem, jedno jeść, i pić, i weselić się, a iż mu jedno to zostaje z pracy jego po wszystkie dni żywota jego, które mu Bóg dał pod słońcem.
Sentences_to: Then I commended mirth, because a man has no better thing under the sun, than to eat, and to drink, and to be joyful: for that will accompany him in his labor all the days of his life which God has given him under the sun.
Translated_sentences: And thus I praised the feast, because thou hast nothing better for a man under the sun, to eat one thing, and to drink one thing, and to rejoice; and that he hath one of his labour all the days of his life which God hath given him under the sun.

Sentences_from: A z Absalomem poszło było dwieście mężów z Jeruzalemu zaproszonych, którzy szli w prostości swojej, niewiedząc o niczem.
Sentences_to: Two hundred men went with Absalom out of Jerusalem, who were invited, and went in their simplicity; and they didn't know anything.
Translated_sentences: And with Absalom went two hundred men from Jerusalem, invited, who went in their simplicity, knowing nothing.

Sentences_from: Bo tak mówi Pan: Oto Ja puszczę na cię strach, na cię i na wszystkich przyjaciół twoich, którzy upadną od miecza nieprzyjaciół swych, na co oczy twoje patrzyć będą; a wszystkiego Judę podam w ręce króla Babilońskiego, który ich zaprowadzi do Babil onu, i pozabija ich mieczem.
Sentences_to: For thus says Yahweh, Behold, I will make you a terror to yourself, and to all your friends; and they shall fall by the sword of their enemies, and your eyes shall see it; and I will give all Judah into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he shall carry them captive to Babylon, and shall kill them with the sword.
Translated_sentences: For Thus saith the Lord; Behold, I will send fear upon thee, upon thee, and upon all thy friends, that shall fall by the sword of thine enemies, Whereat thine eyes shall look: and I will deliver all Judah into the hand of the king of Babylon, who shall bring them to Babylon, and shall kill them with the sword.

Sentences_from: A wyrzuciwszy bałwany z domu Baalowego, popalili je.
Sentences_to: They brought out the pillars that were in the house of Baal, and burned them.
Translated_sentences: And they cast the idols out of the house of Baal, and burned them.

Sentences_from: Ale Pan jest Bóg prawy, jest Bóg żywy, i król wieczny; przed jego zapalczywością ziemia drży, a narody nie mogą znieść rozgniewania jego.
Sentences_to: But Yahweh is the true God; he is the living God, and an everlasting King: at his wrath the earth trembles, and the nations are not able to withstand his indignation.
Translated_sentences: But the Lord is a righteous God, a living God, and an everlasting king; before his zeal the earth trembles, and the nations cannot bear his wrath.

Sentences_from: Tedy kazał przyjść Isaj siedmiu synom swoim przed Samuela. I rzekł Samuel do Isajego: Nie obrał Pan i tych.
Sentences_to: Jesse made seven of his sons to pass before Samuel. Samuel said to Jesse, "Yahweh has not chosen these."
Translated_sentences: And Jesse commanded his seven sons to come before Samuel. And Samuel said unto Jesse, The Lord hath not chosen these also.

Sentences_from: Naliczono ich z pokolenia Judowego siedemdziesiąt i cztery tysiące i sześć set.
Sentences_to: those who were numbered of them, of the tribe of Judah, were sixty-four thousand six hundred.
Translated_sentences: And they were numbered of the tribe of Judah, seventy and four thousand and six hundred.

Sentences_from: Bo im on los rzucił, a ręka jego onę im sznurem rozmierzyła; aż na wieki dziedzicznie ją posiądą, od narodu do narodu mieszkać w niej będą.
Sentences_to: He has cast the lot for them, and his hand has divided it to them with a measuring line. They shall possess it forever. From generation to generation they will dwell in it.
Translated_sentences: For he hath cast a lot upon them, and his hand hath measured it for them with a cord: they shall inherit it for ever, and shall dwell therein from nation to nation.

Sentences_from: Synów Azgadowych tysiąc dwieście dwadzieścia i dwa.
Sentences_to: The children of Azgad, one thousand two hundred twenty-two.
Translated_sentences: The children of azgad, one thousand two hundred twenty and two.

Sentences_from: Szedł tedy Dawid, sam i one sześć set mężów, które miał z sobą, a przyszli aż do potoku Besor; a niektórzy pozostali.
Sentences_to: Achish answered David, "I know that you are good in my sight, as an angel of God. Notwithstanding the princes of the Philistines have said, 'He shall not go up with us to the battle.'
Translated_sentences: And David went, and he, and they Six hundred men that he had with him, and came unto the brook Besor: and some remained.

Sentences_from: Wtemem ocucił i spojrzałem, a sen mój był mi wdzięczny.
Sentences_to: On this I awakened, and saw; and my sleep was sweet to me.
Translated_sentences: Then he woke up and I looked, and my dream was grateful to me.

Sentences_from: Roku dziewiątego Sedekijasza, króla Judzkiego, miesiąca dziesiątego, przyciągnął Nabuchodonozor, król Babiloński, ze wszystkiem wojskiem swojem do Jeruzalemu, i oblegli je.
Sentences_to: It happened when Jerusalem was taken, (in the ninth year of Zedekiah king of Judah, in the tenth month, came Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and all his army against Jerusalem, and besieged it;
Translated_sentences: In the ninth year of Zedekiah king of Judah, in the tenth month, Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon brought all his army to Jerusalem, and they besieged it.

Sentences_from: I posłał Farao, a oto, nie zdechło z bydła Izraelskiego i jedno; ale ociężało serce Faraonowe, i nie wypuścił ludu.
Sentences_to: Pharaoh sent, and, behold, there was not so much as one of the livestock of the Israelites dead. But the heart of Pharaoh was stubborn, and he didn't let the people go.
Translated_sentences: And Pharaoh sent, and, behold, not one of the cattle of Israel was dead: but Pharaoh's heart was heavy, and he sent not the people away.

Sentences_from: Izali zatrzymał w gniewie litości swoje? Sela.
Sentences_to: Then I thought, "I will appeal to this: the years of the right hand of the Most High."
Translated_sentences: Izali stopped his pity in anger? Sela.

Sentences_from: Tedy odpowiedzą: Przeto, iż opuścili Pana, Boga swego, który wywiódł ojce ich z ziemi Egipskiej, a chwycili się bogów cudzych, i kłaniali się im, a służyli im: dla tegoż przywiódł Pan na nie to wszystko złe.
Sentences_to: and they shall answer, 'Because they forsook Yahweh their God, who brought their fathers out of the land of Egypt, and laid hold of other gods, and worshiped them, and served them. Therefore Yahweh has brought all this evil on them.'"
Translated_sentences: And they shall say, because they have forsaken the lord their god, who brought their fathers out of the land of Egypt, and have taken hold of other gods, and have worshipped them, and served them: therefore the LORD hath brought all these evil things upon them.

Sentences_from: Podam ich, mówię, na utrapienie, i na ucisk po wszystkich królestwach ziemi, na pohaóbienie i na przypowieść, na przysłowie i na przeklęstwo po wszystkich miejscach, do których ich zapędzę;
Sentences_to: I will even give them up to be tossed back and forth among all the kingdoms of the earth for evil; to be a reproach and a proverb, a taunt and a curse, in all places where I shall drive them.
Translated_sentences: I will bring them, I say, to Affliction, and to oppression in all the kingdoms of the earth, to shame, and to parable, and to Proverb, and to curse in all the places whither I shall drive them.;

Sentences_from: Którzy myślą złe rzeczy w sercu, a na każdy dzień zbierają się na wojnę.
Sentences_to: They have sharpened their tongues like a serpent. Viper's poison is under their lips. Selah.
Translated_sentences: Who think evil things in their hearts, and every day they gather for war.

Sentences_from: Dosycieście już krążyli około tej góry, obróćcież się ku północy;
Sentences_to: "You have encircled this mountain long enough. Turn northward.
Translated_sentences: You've been circling this mountain enough, turn north;

Sentences_from: Była granica ich od Machanaim wszystko Basan i wszystko królestwo Oga, króla Basańskiego, i wszystkie wsi Jairowe, które są w Basan, sześćdziesiąt miast.
Sentences_to: Their border was from Mahanaim, all Bashan, all the kingdom of Og king of Bashan, and all the towns of Jair, which are in Bashan, sixty cities.
Translated_sentences: And their border was from Mahanaim all Bashan, and all the kingdom of Og king of Bashan, and all the villages of Jair, which are in Bashan, sixty cities.

Sentences_from: A sam tylko Mojżesz wstąpi do Pana; ale oni nie przybliżą się ani lud wstąpi z nim.
Sentences_to: Moses alone shall come near to Yahweh, but they shall not come near, neither shall the people go up with him."
Translated_sentences: But Moses alone shall ascend unto the Lord: but they shall not come near, neither shall the people ascend with him.

Sentences_from: I mówił Abram: Otoś mi nie dał potomka, ale oto sługa domu mego dziedzicem moim będzie.
Sentences_to: Abram said, "Behold, to me you have given no seed: and, behold, one born in my house is my heir."
Translated_sentences: And Abram said, Behold, he hath not given me any seed: but, behold, the servant of my house shall be my heir.

Sentences_from: Tedy niebiosa opowiedzą sprawiedliwość jego; albowiem sam Bóg jest sędzią. Sela.
Sentences_to: The heavens shall declare his righteousness, for God himself is judge. Selah.
Translated_sentences: And the heavens shall declare his righteousness: for God himself is judge. Sela.

Sentences_from: A gdy przyszli do gumna Nachonowego, ściągnął Oza rękę swoję ku skrzyni Bożej, i zadzierżał ją: bo woły były wystąpiły z drogi:
Sentences_to: When they came to the threshing floor of Nacon, Uzzah reached for the ark of God, and took hold of it; for the cattle stumbled.
Translated_sentences: And when they were come to the threshing floor, Oz stretched out his hand unto the ark of God, and slew it: for the oxen were gone out of the way.:

Sentences_from: A rozmnożę nasienie twoje jako proch ziemi; bo jeźli kto będzie mógł zliczyć proch ziemi, tedy i nasienie twoje zliczone będzie.
Sentences_to: I will make your offspring as the dust of the earth, so that if a man can number the dust of the earth, then your seed may also be numbered.
Translated_sentences: And I will multiply thy seed as the dust of the earth: for if any man be able to number the dust of the earth, then shall thy seed also be numbered.

Sentences_from: I czarnoksiężnik, i ten, który ma sprawę z duchy złymi, i praktykarz, i wywiadujący się czego od umarłych.
Sentences_to: according to the tenor of the law which they shall teach you, and according to the judgment which they shall tell you, you shall do; you shall not turn aside from the sentence which they shall show you, to the right hand, nor to the left.
Translated_sentences: And the sorcerer, and the one who deals with evil spirits, and the practitioner, and the Inquirer of things from the dead.

Sentences_from: Gdzież jest król Elmat, i król Arfad, i król miasta Sefarwaim, Ana, i Awa?
Sentences_to: Where is the king of Hamath, and the king of Arpad, and the king of the city of Sepharvaim, of Hena, and Ivvah?'"
Translated_sentences: Where is king elmath, and King Arpad, and king of the city of Sepharvaim, Ana, and AWA?

Sentences_from: Nie będziesz pożądał domu bliźniego twego, ani będziesz pożądał żony bliźniego twego, ani sługi jego, ani dziewki jego, ani wołu jego, ani osła jego, ani żadnej rzeczy bliźniego twego.
Sentences_to: "You shall not covet your neighbor's house. You shall not covet your neighbor's wife, nor his male servant, nor his female servant, nor his ox, nor his donkey, nor anything that is your neighbor's."
Translated_sentences: Thou shalt not covet thy neighbor's house, neither shalt thou covet thy neighbor's wife, nor his manservant, nor his maidservant, nor his ox, nor his ass, nor any thing of thy neighbor's.

Sentences_from: A synowie Korego: Asyr, i Elkana, i Abyjazaf. Teć są domy Korytów.
Sentences_to: The sons of Korah: Assir, and Elkanah, and Abiasaph; these are the families of the Korahites.
Translated_sentences: And the sons of Korah: Assyria, and Elkanah, and abijazaf. These are the trough houses.

Sentences_from: A powiedziałem wam: Jam Pan, Bóg wasz, nie bójcież się bogów Amorejskich, w których ziemi wy mieszkacie; aleście nie usłuchali głosu mego.
Sentences_to: and I said to you, "I am Yahweh your God; you shall not fear the gods of the Amorites, in whose land you dwell." But you have not listened to my voice.'"
Translated_sentences: And I said unto you, I am the LORD your God, fear not the gods of the Amorites, in whose land ye dwell: but ye have not obeyed my voice.

Sentences_from: Że, widząc synowie Boży córki ludzkie, iż były piękne, brali je sobie za żony, ze wszystkich, które sobie upodobali.
Sentences_to: that God's sons saw that men's daughters were beautiful, and they took for themselves wives of all that they chose.
Translated_sentences: That when the sons of God saw the Daughters of men that they were beautiful, they took them to wives of all whom they pleased.

Sentences_from: A wziąwszy je, przeprawił je przez tęż rzekę, i przeprowadził wszystko, co miał.
Sentences_to: Jacob was left alone, and wrestled with a man there until the breaking of the day.
Translated_sentences: And he took them, and passed them over the same river, and carried away all that he had.

Sentences_from: Będę wysławiał Pana ze wszystkiego serca mego; opowiadać będę wszysteki cuda twoje.
Sentences_to: I will be glad and rejoice in you. I will sing praise to your name, O Most High.
Translated_sentences: I will praise the Lord with all my heart; I will tell all your wonders.

Sentences_from: Śpiewajcie Bogu, śpiewajcie psalmy imieniowi jego; gotujcie drogę temu, który jeździ na obłokach. Pan jest imię jego, radujcież się przed obliczem jego.
Sentences_to: A father of the fatherless, and a defender of the widows, is God in his holy habitation.
Translated_sentences: Sing to God, sing psalms to his name; prepare the way for him who rides on the clouds. The Lord is his name, rejoice in his presence.

Sentences_from: Tedy się modlił Izaak Panu za żonę swą, iż była niepłodna; i wysłuchał go Pan, i poczęła Rebeka, żona jego.
Sentences_to: Isaac entreated Yahweh for his wife, because she was barren. Yahweh was entreated by him, and Rebekah his wife conceived.
Translated_sentences: And Isaac prayed unto the Lord for his wife, that she was barren: and the Lord hearkened unto him, and Rebekah his wife conceived.

Sentences_from: Pan wszystko za mię wykona. O Panie! miłosierdzie twoje trwa na wieki; sprawy rąk twoich nie opuścisz.
Sentences_to: Yahweh will fulfill that which concerns me; your loving kindness, Yahweh, endures forever. Don't forsake the works of your own hands.
Translated_sentences: You'll do everything for me. O Lord! thy mercy endureth for ever: thou shalt not forsake the work of thy hands.

Sentences_from: Tedy wezwawszy Laban wszystkich mężów miejsca onego, sprawił ucztę.
Sentences_to: Laban gathered together all the men of the place, and made a feast.
Translated_sentences: And laban called all the men of the place, and made a feast.

Sentences_from: Wstańże, a młóć, córko Syoóska! bo róg twój uczynię żelazny, a kopyta twoje uczynię miedziane, i pokruszysz wiele narodów; i poświęcę Panu korzyści ich, a majętności ich Panu wszystkiej ziemi.
Sentences_to: Arise and thresh, daughter of Zion; for I will make your horn iron, and I will make your hoofs brass; and you will beat in pieces many peoples: and I will devote their gain to Yahweh, and their substance to the Lord of the whole earth.
Translated_sentences: Rise and thrash, daughter of sioosha! for I will make your horn of iron, and your hoofs of brass, and you will crush many nations; and I will sacrifice their goods to the Lord, and their substance to the Lord of all the earth.

Sentences_from: A w każdem mieście złożył tarcze i włócznie, a opatrzył je bardzo mocno: a tak panował nad Judą i Benjaminem.
Sentences_to: He put shields and spears in every city, and made them exceeding strong. Judah and Benjamin belonged to him.
Translated_sentences: And in every city he laid shields and spears, and bound them exceedingly: and he ruled Judah and Benjamin.

Sentences_from: Uczynisz też deski do przybytku, dwadzieścia desek ku stronie południowej, ku wiatrowi południowemu.
Sentences_to: You shall make the boards for the tabernacle, twenty boards for the south side southward.
Translated_sentences: And thou shalt make boards for the tabernacle, twenty boards for the south side, for the south wind.

Sentences_from: Synów Pachat Moabowych, synów Jesui Joabowych dwa tysiące ośm set i dwanaście;
Sentences_to: The children of Pahathmoab, of the children of Jeshua and Joab, two thousand eight hundred twelve.
Translated_sentences: The children of Pahath Moab, the children of Jeshua Joab, two thousand eight hundred and twelve.;

Sentences_from: Na czem są podstawki jej ugruntowane? albo kto założył kamień jej węgielny?
Sentences_to: Whereupon were its foundations fastened? Or who laid its cornerstone,
Translated_sentences: What are the stands of her well-established? or who laid the foundation stone?

Sentences_from: Dla proroków skruszyło się serce moje we mnie, poruszyły się wszystkie kości moje, stałem się jako człowiek pijany, a jako mąż, po którym się rozeszło wino, dla Pana i dla słów świętobliwości jego.
Sentences_to: Concerning the prophets. My heart within me is broken, all my bones shake; I am like a drunken man, and like a man whom wine has overcome, because of Yahweh, and because of his holy words.
Translated_sentences: Because of the prophets my heart was broken in me, all my bones were moved, I became as a drunken man, and as a man after whom wine was spread, for the Lord and for the words of his holiness.

Sentences_from: Stawają się jako plewa przed wiatrem, i jako perz, który wicher porywa.
Sentences_to: How often is it that they are as stubble before the wind, as chaff that the storm carries away?
Translated_sentences: They become as chaff before the wind, and as Perz, which the wind takes away.

Sentences_from: Każdego, który się nazywa imieniem mojem, i któregom ku chwale swojej stworzył, któregom ukształtował, i któregom uczynił.
Sentences_to: everyone who is called by my name, and whom I have created for my glory, whom I have formed, yes, whom I have made.'"
Translated_sentences: Every one that is called by my name, and to whom he hath created for his glory, and to whom he hath formed, and to whom he hath made.

Sentences_from: Roku czwartego króla Ezechyjasza, (który był rok siódmy Ozeasza, syna Eli, króla Izraelskiego) wyciągnął Salmanaser, król Assyryjski, przeciwko Samaryi, i obległ ją.
Sentences_to: The children of Israel did secretly things that were not right against Yahweh their God: and they built them high places in all their cities, from the tower of the watchmen to the fortified city;
Translated_sentences: In the fourth year of King Hezekiah, which was the seventh year of Hosea the son of Eli king of Israel, Shalmaneser king of Assyria went out against Samaria, and besieged it.

Sentences_from: Owce i woły wszystkie, nadto i zwierzęta polne.
Sentences_to: The birds of the sky, the fish of the sea, and whatever passes through the paths of the seas.
Translated_sentences: All sheep and oxen, and also all animals of the field.

Sentences_from: Teć są dziedzictwa, które losem podzielili w osiadłość Eleazar kapłan, i Jozue, syn Nunów, i przedniejsi z ojców pokolenia synów Izraelskich w Sylo przed Panem, u drzwi namiotu zgromadzenia, i dokończyli podziału ziemi.
Sentences_to: These are the inheritances, which Eleazar the priest, Joshua the son of Nun, and the heads of the fathers' houses of the tribes of the children of Israel, distributed for inheritance by lot in Shiloh before Yahweh, at the door of the Tent of Meeting. So they made an end of dividing the land.
Translated_sentences: These are the inheritances which Eleazar the priest, and Joshua the son of nun, and the chief of the fathers of the tribe of the children of Israel, settled in Shiloh before the Lord, at the door of the tabernacle of the congregation; and they finished dividing the land.

Sentences_from: A widząc Gaal lud, rzekł do Zebula: Oto, lud idzie z wierzchu gór. Któremu odpowiedział Zebul: Cieó góry ty widzisz, jakoby ludzie.
Sentences_to: When Gaal saw the people, he said to Zebul, "Behold, people are coming down from the tops of the mountains." Zebul said to him, "You see the shadow of the mountains as if they were men."
Translated_sentences: When Gaal saw the people, he said to zebul, " behold, the people are coming from the top of the mountains." To whom zebul answered, thou seest the mountains as men.

Sentences_from: Synowie Sofachowi: Suach, Harnefer, i Sual, i Bery, i Imra.
Sentences_to: The sons of Zophah: Suah, and Harnepher, and Shual, and Beri, and Imrah,
Translated_sentences: The sons of zephah: suah, harnether, and Sual, and Beri, and imrah.

Sentences_from: A inne sprawy Amazyjaszowe, pierwsze i poślednie, izali nie są zapisane w księgi królów Judzkich i Izraelskich?
Sentences_to: These are those who conspired against him: Zabad the son of Shimeath the Ammonitess, and Jehozabad the son of Shimrith the Moabitess.
Translated_sentences: And the rest of the acts of Amaziah, first and last, are they not written in the book of the kings of Judah and Israel?

Sentences_from: I rzekł: Nie będzie nazywane więcej imię twoje Jakób, ale Izrael; boś sobie mężnie poczynał z Bogiem, i z ludźmi, i przemogłeś.
Sentences_to: Jacob asked him, "Please tell me your name." He said, "Why is it that you ask what my name is?" He blessed him there.
Translated_sentences: And he said, thy name shall no more be called Jacob, but Israel: for thou hast dealt with God and with men, and thou hast prevailed.

Sentences_from: I tak zbogacił się on człowiek bardzo, i miał owiec wiele, i służebnic i sług, i wielbłądów, i osłów.
Sentences_to: The man increased exceedingly, and had large flocks, female servants and male servants, and camels and donkeys.
Translated_sentences: And the man became very rich, and had many sheep, and female servants, and male servants, and camels, and asses.

Sentences_from: A tak usłyszawszy Achab, że umarł Nabot, wstał, a szedł do winnicy Nabota Jezreelity, aby ją posiadł.
Sentences_to: It happened, when Ahab heard that Naboth was dead, that Ahab rose up to go down to the vineyard of Naboth the Jezreelite, to take possession of it.
Translated_sentences: And when Ahab heard that Naboth was dead, he arose, and went to the vineyard of Naboth the Jezreelite, to possess it.

Sentences_from: Kto wyleje krew człowieczą, przez człowieka krew jego wylana będzie: bo na wyobrażenie Boże uczynion jest człowiek.
Sentences_to: Whoever sheds man's blood, his blood will be shed by man, for God made man in his own image.
Translated_sentences: He that shall shed the blood of man shall shed his blood by man: for man is made in the likeness of God.

Sentences_from: Tak mówi Pan: Zawściągnij głos swój od płaczu, a oczy swe od łez; bo będziesz miała zapłatę za pracę swoję, mówi Pan, że się nawrócą z ziemi nieprzyjacielskiej.
Sentences_to: Thus says Yahweh: Refrain your voice from weeping, and your eyes from tears; for your work shall be rewarded, says Yahweh; and they shall come again from the land of the enemy.
Translated_sentences: Thus saith the Lord, refrain thine voice from weeping, and thine eyes from tears: for thou shalt have the wages of thy labour, saith the Lord, that they shall return out of the land of the enemy.

Sentences_from: A słupów do nich cztery, także podstawków ich cztery miedzianych; główki ich srebrne, i zakrycia wierzchów ich, także okręcenia ich srebrne.
Sentences_to: Their pillars were four, and their sockets four, of brass; their hooks of silver, and the overlaying of their capitals, and their fillets, of silver.
Translated_sentences: And their pillars four, and their sockets four of brass; their heads of silver, and the covering of their tops, and their fillets of silver.

Sentences_from: A poczekawszy jeszcze drugie siedem dni, po wtóre wypuścił gołębicę z korabia.
Sentences_to: He stayed yet another seven days; and again he sent the dove out of the ship.
Translated_sentences: And when he had waited another seven days, the second time he sent forth the dove out of korabia.

Sentences_from: Błogosławiony Pan, Bóg Izraelski, od wieków aż na wieki. I rzekł wszystek lud Amen, i chwalił Pana.
Sentences_to: Blessed be Yahweh, the God of Israel, from everlasting even to everlasting. All the people said, "Amen," and praised Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: Blessed be the Lord, the god of Israel, from everlasting to everlasting. And all the people said amen, and praised the Lord.

Sentences_from: Nawrócą się, aby siedzieli pod cieniem jego, ożyją jako zboże, i puszczą się jako winna macica, której pamiątka będzie jako wino Libańskie.
Sentences_to: Men will dwell in his shade. They will revive like the grain, and blossom like the vine. Their fragrance will be like the wine of Lebanon.
Translated_sentences: They shall return to sit under his shadow, and shall live as grain, and shall be released as a Vine, whose memorial shall be the wine of Lebanon.

Sentences_from: A posyłając je Mojżesz na przeszpiegowanie ziemi Chananejskiej, mówił do nich: Idźcie w tę stronę ku południowi, a wnijdźcie na górę:
Sentences_to: Moses sent them to spy out the land of Canaan, and said to them, "Go up this way by the South, and go up into the hill country:
Translated_sentences: And when Moses sent them to search the land of Canaan, he said unto them, go this way southward, and come up into the mountain.:

Sentences_from: Ale gdy go zastaną, nagradza siedmiorako, albo wszystkę majętność domu swego daje.
Sentences_to: but if he is found, he shall restore seven times. He shall give all the wealth of his house.
Translated_sentences: But when they find him, he rewards them sevenfold, or gives all the wealth of his house.

Sentences_from: I wyciągnął Mojżesz rękę swą ku niebu, i były ciemności gęste po wszystkiej ziemi Egipskiej przez trzy dni.
Sentences_to: Moses stretched out his hand toward the sky, and there was a thick darkness in all the land of Egypt three days.
Translated_sentences: And Moses stretched out his hand toward heaven; and there was darkness throughout all the land of Egypt for three days.

Sentences_from: I stało się, gdy Samuel sprawował całopalenie, że Filistynowie przyciągnęli blisko, aby walczyli przeciw Izraelowi; ale zagrzmiał Pan grzmotem wielkim dnia onego nad Filistynami, a potarł je, i porażeni są przed obliczem Izraela.
Sentences_to: As Samuel was offering up the burnt offering, the Philistines drew near to battle against Israel; but Yahweh thundered with a great thunder on that day on the Philistines, and confused them; and they were struck down before Israel.
Translated_sentences: And it came to pass, when Samuel was burning, that the Philistines drew near to fight against Israel: but the Lord thundered with a great thunder that day upon the Philistines, and smote them, and they were smitten before Israel.

Sentences_from: Tak mówi Pan: Jako gdyby kto znalazł wino w gronie, i rzekłby: Nie psuj go, bo błogosławieństwo jest w niem; tak i Ja uczynię dla sług moich, że ich wszystkich nie wygubię.
Sentences_to: Thus says Yahweh, "As the new wine is found in the cluster, and one says, 'Don't destroy it, for a blessing is in it:' so will I do for my servants' sake, that I may not destroy them all.
Translated_sentences: Thus saith the Lord; as if a man find wine in a company, and say, spoil it not: for the blessing is in it: so will I do for my servants, that I destroy them not all.

Sentences_from: Tedy nabrawszy Abimelech owiec, i wołów, i sług, i służebnic, dał Abrahamowi, i wrócił mu Sarę, żonę jego.
Sentences_to: Abimelech took sheep and cattle, male servants and female servants, and gave them to Abraham, and restored Sarah, his wife, to him.
Translated_sentences: And Abimelech took sheep, and oxen, and male and female servants, and gave them to Abraham, and gave him Sarah his wife.

Sentences_from: Ale przemógł lud, który przestawał z Amrym, on lud, który zostawał przy Tebni, synem Ginetowym; i umarł Tebni, a królował Amry.
Sentences_to: But the people who followed Omri prevailed against the people who followed Tibni the son of Ginath: so Tibni died, and Omri reigned.
Translated_sentences: But the people that were with Amry prevailed, even the people that were with Tebni the son of gineth; and tebni died, and Amry reigned.

Sentences_from: Tedy słudzy króla Syryjskiego rzekli do niego: Bogowie ich są bogowie górni, przetoż nas przemogli; a wszakże zwiedźmy z nimi bitwę w polu a ujrzysz, jeźli ich nie przemożemy.
Sentences_to: The servants of the king of Syria said to him, "Their god is a god of the hills; therefore they were stronger than we. But let us fight against them in the plain, and surely we shall be stronger than they.
Translated_sentences: And the servants of the king of Syria said unto him, their gods are the gods of the mountains; therefore they have overpowered us: but let us fight with them in the field, and thou shalt see, if we shall not overpowerthem.

Sentences_from: I stworzył Bóg wieloryby wielkie, i wszelką duszę żywiącą płazającą się, którą hojnie wywiodły wody, według rodzaju ich; i wszelkie ptactwo skrzydlaste, według rodzaju ich; i widział Bóg, że to było dobre.
Sentences_to: God created the large sea creatures, and every living creature that moves, with which the waters swarmed, after their kind, and every winged bird after its kind. God saw that it was good.
Translated_sentences: And God created great whales, and every creeping thing that the waters brought forth abundantly, according to their kind, and every winged fowl, according to their kind: and God saw that it was good.

Sentences_from: I rzekł Saul do wyrostka swego, który nosił broń jego: Dobądź miecza twego, a przebij mię nim, by snać nie przyszli ci nieobrzezańcy, i nie przebili mię, a nie czynili igrzyska ze mnie. Ale nie chciał wyrostek jego, bo się bardzo bał. Przetoż Saul porwał miecz i upadł nań.
Sentences_to: Then Saul said to his armor bearer, "Draw your sword, and thrust me through with it, lest these uncircumcised come and thrust me through, and abuse me!" But his armor bearer would not; for he was terrified. Therefore Saul took his sword, and fell on it.
Translated_sentences: And Saul said unto his little finger that bore his armour, take thine sword, and pierce me therewith, lest these uncircumcision come, and pierce me, and make a game of me. But he did not want his appendix, because he was very afraid. So Saul took the sword and fell on it.
